story:
Short Summary

The Spiral collective is a Denver-based community yoga wellness center that aims to make holistic health accessible for truly everyone regardless of background, age, or what you look like. Here at Spiral we believe that community is synonymous with family, so whether you're a Colorado resident or a friend behind the computer screen we want Spiral to feel like home. 

Hey there, it’s Paige! Co-founder of The Spiral Collective, proud momma to Simba and a passionate yogi…..and by yogi I mean donut-eater. My heart has been incredibly full since the beginning of TSC. I’ve never been more grateful, nervous and abundantly happy! It truly is my home and I am constantly inspired to spread mindfulness, women empowerment and the importance of acting with intention.

 Hi my name is Kait, co-founder of The Spiral Collective, mother to a very fluffy puppy named Tinkerbelle, and a passionate proponent of holistic health. The Spiral Collective is my dream realized. I am so grateful to have found a partner whose dream so perfectly complements my own so much so that The Spiral Collective is a seamless amalgamation of both of our visions and feels so much fuller because of it.


The Spiral Collective has many ways YOU can learn to be more mindful without mirrors, weights, heat, expectations or judgement. Are you close to Denver? Great! Come visit our space(when it opens, but only with your help) and take advantage of some of these fun things:

  • Yoga- Offering 6-10 classes everyday, seven days a week ranging from kids yoga, accessible and chair yoga, beginner-intermediate classes, prenatal, and even restorative- we have a class designed just for you!
  • Meditation- seven days a week starting at 7pm, open meditation will occur in it's very own sacred space. Meditating on your own not your thing? No worries, at least one guided meditation class will happen every day.
  • In-house holistic health practitioners.
  • Workshops- Every Friday night you can guarantee something fun will be happening at TSC! Paint by yoga, gong baths, live local DJ's, mala-bead making, how-to's, and many more!
  • Book share library- Have books at home you don't read? Bring em in and to share! Take one for yourself while you're at it. TSC believes in paying it forward.
  • Spiral Shop- a massive retail section offering house-made loose leaf teas, body-care products, bath salts, jewelry and more! Always organic, fair-trade and always, always made with love. Did we mention YOU can sell your homemade goodies at Spiral? Featuring a local artist/spiral family member each month to showcase their goodies!
  • Spiral School- ever wanted to learn how to actually do chaturanga? Want to take a journey through the chakras? How does learning sanskrit sound? Everything holistic, every Wednesday, guaranteed. 
  • Community pot-luck style dinners once a month, every month,  where everyone is always welcome. 
    Don't live in Denver? No worries, yoga and meditation classes, SpiralSchool and our whole retail section will be available online for purchasing and downloads. The Spiral Collective wants to be accessible for anyone, anywhere, anytime. 
What We Need & What You Get

The Spiral Collective lives only in our hearts at the moment. This is where YOU come in. We have an unsecured space that  is going to need renovations to make it yoga friendly. Including all new floors, central heating and air conditioning system, kitchen equipment including new fridge and stove, and other additions to make TSC the best it can be!

Guess what? Regardless if you live near or far, by donating you'll receive goodies from our retail (some exclusive to this campaign!), access to Spiral online and our forever gratitude. 

    Challenges

    They say it takes a village to create something significant. TSC cannot happen without you. The more people we can reach and raise the mindful awareness of TSC, the better. Even if you can't contribute to this project, you can still help. Please utilize the tools provided by sharing this project with as many of your friends and family as possible.  

      Thank you!

story:
What We've Done So Far

Comics N' More has changed owners and towns after a 25 year legacy in downtown Northampton. Since October 2014 we have been going nonstop getting the store into the best shape possible with the resources that we have to work with. Before the move we worked long hours everyday for weeks to get the space clean and ready and painted. Then there was the actual move; it took ten 10' box trucks filled to the brim to move everything from Northampton to Easthampton and the help of over a dozen generous, wonderful, and strong friends to whom we are forever grateful.
Since the move we have organized a great deal of the collection and put it out for sale. We have also expanded the retail and gaming area by knocking down a wall. We have bought lights and carpets and wall base and tables and a ton of other things to try to complete the renovations. Not to mention the thousands of new comic books and toys! With that said, there is still so much more that we'd like to do!


Plans For The Not So Distant Future

Ideally, we want to raise at least $2000. The most important thing we are raising money for is the sign, so we are putting out indigogo goal at $1500 which would allow to get get the sign and have a little leftover to help with our other projects.

  • For the first time in the stores 25 year history we are determined to have a proper, large, lit up sign on the front of the building. We have the design ready to go. Now, we need to get the sign produced and installed. $1000
  • We have plans to turn one of the rooms into a lounge area where we will hold book clubs, screen movies, and just have somewhere comfortable to sit and read comic books. For this we need to purchase chairs, couches, tables, a working television, and rugs. $400
  • We want to continue expanding our gaming section. This means investing in more gaming products on our shelves. We would love to have a better selection of Magic the Gathering cards, table top games, and role playing books. $600
  • Please consider donating to us so that we can continue to make the store into a place where everyone is comfortable and happy. If we raise more then our goal it will only go to making the store even better by upgrading the flooring throughout the space and installing better lighting fixtures upstairs! Thank you!

story:
Short Summary

The CEO has more than 20 years of education, training and work experience in Air Traffic Control, Flight Dispatch and Private pilot.  The positions held were in Government, corporate and private operations of logistics and management.

As the ancillary costs of storage, maintenance and aviation insurance increases for aircraft ownership, individual ownership, even in the simplest of scenarios, becomes a harrowing proposition

In the past, the most common approach was to buy an aircraft in part or whole through a variety of structured options. Since the 1980’s, several companies developed that provided a new market called aircraft fractionalization, and were/are oriented towards a “timeshare” type of program or structure with the focus on General Aviation jets.  These programs are based on the sale of flying time called a “wet lease” (normally used for short term leasing) where the purchaser does not necessarily fly the aircraft. Significant cost factors for the buyer occur as they pay for pilot, airtime and fuel. These are the primary costs that affect these fractional operations; however, positioning/re-positioning flights (empty flights/Non-revenue) are the most costly operational expenditures. These markets have seen a need for critical alternatives to fleet management. (see ’Marketing Periodicals’ AMSTAT Market Analysis)

       

For a pilot to purchase a General Aviation (GA) aircraft retailing for $3,000,000 or under, there is, for all intents and purposes, either full ownership with supplemental management, or partnerships. The full ownership without supplemental management brings a number of responsibilities, which are at times daunting to say the least. Supplemental management relieves the owner of the day-to-day responsibilities but at additional costs. The partnership option can lead to liabilities and/or disputes in management, due to ever-changing regulations required of the owner, crew, and aircraft management.

Recently, Congress passed a bill requiring airline pilots to hold an ATP rating (Airline Transport Pilot), which carries a new requirement, is for over 1,500 flight hours. Previously a pilot was able to work for an airline with only 300 hours or less.  This will create costly challenges for the airlines and General Aviation (including higher-end fractional companies) to maintain the crews and replenish them. Major commercial operations as well as General Aviation operations, requires that a pilot must have these flight hours, which could cost well over $300.00 hour or more depending on the aircraft and training facility. 

For an aspiring pilot, faced with current rating requirements, the need to keep up with advances or changes in aviation skill sets, and at the same time including the costs of renting or owning a light aircraft; the pursuit can quickly become overwhelming. Many try renting the simplest and most affordable of aircraft to build flight time, with costs ranging from nearly $125 up to $300+ per hour. Often these aircraft are not maintained by the same standards that many people would desire, and/or are inadequately equipped by current standards.

There are currently significantly limited to NO operations providing an aircraft fractionalization specifically for pilots to build time in current platforms necessary to maintain or upgrade certifications.

Currently, there are NO fractional programs that have provisions in place, to absorb the management of an existing, ongoing aircraft partnership or individual ownership.

                                           

Under the FlyteOne program, the more daunting aspects of aircraft ownership have been provided for so that flying can once again be affordable and enjoyable for the everyday enthusiast as well as those wanting more sophisticated equipment.

FlyteOne will offer well-maintained aircraft for individual rental, flight training or fractional ownership. In sequence, FlyteOne will also provide primary and advanced flight instruction through the use of independent flight instructors possessing corporate and airline backgrounds.


What We Need & What You Get


We are in need of $550,000 of seed capital to purchase the initial aircraft for distribution in the fractional sales and aircraft management.  These aircraft will be  operated and managed under Lookin Up Enterprises Inc which also manages and operates a growing boat club and rental management operation which has accelerated its operations based upon the same type platform of business principles and practices.  We have building the this business for over the past 6 years culminating perspective member owners, coordination and logistics to deliver the services and support of the aircraft.  Networks have been established in both Central Florida and Seattle, Washington to initially launch the aircraft sales and management.

    Lookin Up Enterprises Inc. DBA Lottoboat.net intends to adopt an aggressive approach to ensure it responds to its customers demands, fulfills prompt and courteous delivery, remains cost efficient and committed to providing added-value to its existing product line.  Determining factors in ensuring that Lookin Up Enterprises Inc. DBA Lottoboat.net provides a reliable service and/or quality product line are upholding marketing strategy, knowledgeable and committed personnel, and upholding exceptional service level.

      Lookin Up Enterprises Inc. DBA Lottoboat.net will remain focused on providing customer support and after sale service by continuing communication efforts through affordable repeat use incentives of reduced priced rentals or significantly reduced rates of use through membership programs designed and tailored to each members intended frequency of use.


      The Impact

      Lookin Up Enterprises Inc. DBA Lottoboat.net’s goal is to excel in the  business by delivering high quality safe boats with flexible; terms, conditions and scheduling encompassing excellent service without the hassles at significantly low pricing through the means of the lotto boat network and systems of service. We will remain highly competitive and will maintain high standards to ensure maximum customer satisfaction.

      Its products will be sought for their quality and reliability.  We will treat each customer with respect and we will be recognized for our integrity and superior customer service.

      Risks & Challenges

      Lookin Up Enterprises Inc. DBA Lottoboat.net holds leverage over its competition because it provides reliable service, cost competitive prices, and vast selection of choices and it will attract clients because we have better quality newer well equipped boats, more flexible scheduling, and more affordable prices.  Referral advertising and word-of-mouth marketing will be key components in attaining new clients.  Lookin Up Enterprises Inc. DBA Lottoboat.net is confident that prospects will hear positive word-of-mouth marketing and will seek us out.

      Given the personal nature of communications between individuals, we believe that our business will gain an added layer of credibility over our competition. Our objective is to treat each customer with respect and we will be recognized for our integrity and superior service. Our research shows that individuals are more inclined to believe word-of-mouth marketing than other promotional methods. With the emergence of Web 2.0, mainly Facebook, You Tube, My Space and Digg, word-of-mouth marketing will flow through these social networks and strengthen our position and recognition in a cost effective manner.

      Lookin Up Enterprises Inc. DBA Lottoboat.net’s entry against competition will be eased by its choice of distribution channel. We will employ direct selling such as outbound sales force, mail order campaign, and internet and telephone sales, agents who will sell directly on our behalf to end users, distributers such as wholesalers who will sell directly to retailers, retailers also known as dealers or resellers who will sell directly to end users. Our research has shown that this is the most cost effective mode to reach our target market. Our selected distribution channel is well designed and takes into account the link between sales activities and marketing efforts to better reach and serve our end users. It addresses consumer needs and preserves our role in an increasingly fluid channel structure. Service levels and operational performance will be enhanced and costs will be controlled.


        Other Ways You Can Help

        Please let your friends and family know that there is a new way to enjoy boating with more affordable and flexible means.

story:
I am raising the money to start production and for marketing/promotion. I have been working on this project for over 3 years, i am unable to get funding. I am not a quitter, i refuse to let it die. I have spent a lot of money countless hours in designing and producing prototypes. I Martial have designed every piece on our website. We have a patent pending for shoe design and a pending trademark for the name and logo. We need your help and support to make this dream will come to life!  

http://www.zetasports.net  everything on the website are only prototype for promotional purpose

story:
We are the creators of the "I Am Never Alone" movement, aimed at eliminating the debilitating feelings of isolation that many people in our society have, be it from conditions they may be experiencing, either permanent or temporary, circumstantial or chronic (such as terminal illness, mental or physical disability, depression, PTSD, addiction, suicidal thoughts, autism, eating disorder, etc, death of a loved one, etc), or ultimately for any reason that may diminish the spirit.  We feel that the greatest impact we have as individuals lies in our spirit and the resulting energy that we put out into the world.  By addressing feelings of isolation, we are raising the spirit of society as a whole.

Our goal is to eliminate feelings of isolation in society by creating a culture of connection, love, empathy and support through which we can generate a better and brighter future for all.  

We plan to accomplish this through the creation of a media campaign in which individuals' stories of overcoming isolation and hardship will be showcased and indexed on our website, iamneveralone.org (launching on January 6th), providing a source of inspiration for others who may be experiencing similar conditions and/or circumstances.  We are currently compiling stories, and creating an event that is going to be the kick start to our campaign. We would love your participation in helping us make our vision a reality!

story:
Welcome to Project "SMNS"

Project "SMNS" or Social Media & Networking Software is a projected designed to build cheap but powerful software that will give everyone the tools to setup their own social media or network site. The software is designed for Artists, Film Makers, Designers, Developers and Gamers, enabling them to build community websites based on sharing content & media.

With a lot of software being rather exspensive, not having the desired features, taking up a lot of resources or not very SEO friendly. We're hoping to solve that problem by creating a software that can suit multiple purposes, optimized for good SEO and enabing anyone regardless of budget to start their own network. Without being filled with a lot of useless features, heavy and hard to use UI or requiring coding knowledge.

The software is being developed for the users and with that in mind, we’ll be asking you to request features you want to. We will also be allowing users to suggest and select an official name for the software on release.

If you want to create a site for a studio, you can.
If you want to create a site for a gaming news network, you can.
If you want to create a social site for artists, musicians, gamers, you can.
If you want to create a site to share mods, downloads you can.
If you want a community forum you can.
If you want a site to manage your gaming league or network, you can.
And more.

What are some of the Major Features?

The system will come with some the following features on release:

Built For Many - The software is planned to come in 3 packages, included in the same download. While installing the software users will be taken through and interactive UI which will have 3 (currently planned) Options. Basic - which will be for single users to upload and share their content. This option is for portfolios, popular youtube channels or things of that nature. Community Lite - Will contain the most used features of the software, allowing you to setup a community for sharing content which will also include a forum. Community Pro - Will be filled with every and anything featured on launch that the user can take full advantage of. A full list of features that will be in each version, will be provided during developement.

Each version is designed to ensure only the features needed are used, to ensure a smaller database, optimizing loading speeds and to limit the amount of options are thrown at the user. HOWEVER do not worry, users can install or enable certain features even after a version of the software is selected. Each version also has the option to install and enable any add-on or feature.

Full Template System - Allowing users to install and change themes to suit their needs, will be easy to use and just as easy to edit or add new themes. Allowing designers to go wild and create stunning themes without having to get stuck on confusing syntax or large amount of code.

Add-on Support - Allowing developers to easily and effectively create add-ons or apply modifications to the exsisting code. We're taking a whole new approach to developement with add-ons and plan to have more infomation on this later on. However we plan to ensure that installing and removing add-ons is very easy, no files will be mixed up and allows users to easily clean through add-ons they no longer wish installed.

Full SEO - After years of experience with SEO and how search engines tend to work, we will be making SEO a primary feature with the software. Making sure that content and sites get high ratings for the search terms used.

Language System - English will be supported on release, however we'll be making it very easy to support other languages right out of the box. By creating a easy to use and edit language system, users will be able to adjust the languages or provide their own language files for others to install and use. We'll be trying to add as much language support as possible during developement.

Much more - we can't honestly can't list all the features that will be included at this time. There is a lot of them. But rest assured everything we feel you'll need to upload, sort and manage a community and a wide range of media will be included.


(Concept Photo Attached)

What Sub-Features will the software have?

The current smaller features are planned for launch:

  • Full reporting system, which will have the option for the community to moderate what is and isn't accepted on the site
  • Organize information through galleries, folders and catagories that will be easy to find and use. Making sharing content easier and better for everyone.
  • No coding exsperiance will be needed to setup, manage and run the software
  • Community Forum, allow the community to talk on a public forum, or use it as a help desk.
  • Pages System, create addtional pages and easily add them to menus or articles.
  • Powerful user profiles, users will be able to customize and showcase their profiles and even use them as CVs if enabled.
  • Upload media types such as images and videos, later on we plan to support music as well.
  • Permission Masking, have groups of members to access different features, from members, artists, moderators and administrators.
  • Advertisements, add your own ads to make money from users
  • Article system, The article system will enable users to create news articles and publish them in a professional manner, both for large and small content sites.
  • Privacy Options, Privacy is a big concern for us and we don't want our software to be abused. We will be making a lot of options to project user information. Including encrypting email address (used to login), passwords and all sensative information. Also requiring very little information to register and maintain an account with the software (this will change depending on the community / website though to some degree).
  • Social networking features, share content on facebook,twiiter,reddit and other networks easily for more exspoure.
  • Off and on, Turn the site on and off to apply updates or maintaince, allowing only staff members into the site at the time.
  • Mobile Support, mobile devices will be fully supported on release on the front end. Allowing tablets and phones to access the site.
  • Much more, we can't honestly can't list all the features that will be included at this time. There is a lot of them. But rest assurd everything we fell you'll need to upload, sort and manage a community and a wide range of media will be included.

What Future Features will the software have?

We have plans to make it easier for users to make money or self-fund their own communities with things other then ads. A store and subscription option will be added. Allowing users to sell their content through the site or the site to request subscription or payments for additional account features.

(software concept)

 

What About other Uses?

At the moment, you may have an idea of some of the uses this software can have, however we mentioned gamers earlier and we'll explain how the software can also be used through the add-on system for gamers:

We also plan to release sub-features to appeal to gamers, musicians and other forms of media and entertainment. Such add-ons will allow users to setup events, game results and other useful community features. These features can also be applied or other add-ons developed at a later time, enabling users to use the system to suit their needs.

So if your a community on sharing resources, publishing art, networking people for work, a youtuber or moviemaker, artist, facebook like pages or more. You'll find great tools tailored to making your website easy to use and manage.

How Much Will The Software Cost On Release?

One of the things we really want to do, is make it as easy and affordable as possible for users to create content driven community websites and share their content with the world. As a result on release, you will pay whatever you want for the software (if you haven't contributed). Be it 1 dollar or 100dollars, it is entirely up to you. Anyone who funds the project right now, will get the software on release, as well as any rewards for each perk. No matter how much the cost may change in the future, you will still get those perks and the software.

If the project meets it's funding goal, we'll release the whole thing as an open source project, it won't cost a thing to download or use the software or any of it's options.

We also have plans to provide very cost effective hosting to those who want it. The software will be free with any hosting plan you take out. Shared, VPS, Dedicated or Cloud. So we will happily setup the website for you, to use as you want without having to spend huge amounts of money on software, subscriptions or be left high and dry by poor customer support.
 

What will the money be used for?

All the money will be used to cover living costs while the software is in developement, to cover the costs of registering a LC and things of that nature.

When will the software release?

We honestly can't say, because of the scale of the project. However there will be a beta before the new year and a full release soon after. That is our goal anyway.

In Closing

After 7+ years of experience in web designer and developement, we want to create a software that anyone can easily use to create a community based on sharing user created content. We hope you'll take the time to share or contibute to our project, we hope even more that you'll find it useful. The more the project grows, the more features we can release and the more support we can provide to make things even easier.

A developement blog, facebook and twitter will be live soon, which will have weekly updates on progress and a list containing more information and features.

Thank you everyone.
story_txt:
Welcome to Project "SMNS"
Project "SMNS" or Social Media & Networking Software is a projected designed to build cheap but powerful software that will give everyone the tools to setup their own social media or network site. The software is designed for Artists, Film Makers, Designers, Developers and Gamers, enabling them to build community websites based on sharing content & media.  With a lot of software being rather exspensive, not having the desired features, taking up a lot of resources or not very SEO friendly. We're hoping to solve that problem by creating a software that can suit multiple purposes, optimized for good SEO and enabing anyone regardless of budget to start their own network. Without being filled with a lot of useless features, heavy and hard to use UI or requiring coding knowledge.  The software is being developed for the users and with that in mind, we’ll be asking you to request features you want to. We will also be allowing users to suggest and select an official name for the software on release.  If you want to create a site for a studio, you can. If you want to create a site for a gaming news network, you can. If you want to create a social site for artists, musicians, gamers, you can. If you want to create a site to share mods, downloads you can. If you want a community forum you can. If you want a site to manage your gaming league or network, you can. And more.


What are some of the Major Features?
The system will come with some the following features on release:Built For Many - The software is planned to come in 3 packages, included in the same download. While installing the software users will be taken through and interactive UI which will have 3 (currently planned) Options. Basic - which will be for single users to upload and share their content. This option is for portfolios, popular youtube channels or things of that nature. Community Lite - Will contain the most used features of the software, allowing you to setup a community for sharing content which will also include a forum. Community Pro - Will be filled with every and anything featured on launch that the user can take full advantage of. A full list of features that will be in each version, will be provided during developement.  Each version is designed to ensure only the features needed are used, to ensure a smaller database, optimizing loading speeds and to limit the amount of options are thrown at the user. HOWEVER do not worry, users can install or enable certain features even after a version of the software is selected. Each version also has the option to install and enable any add-on or feature.
Full Template System - Allowing users to install and change themes to suit their needs, will be easy to use and just as easy to edit or add new themes. story:
UPDATE: Anyone who Pledges will Receive the Perk listed. I have Ordered the New CNC Mill for another project.

Please click on Like / +1 or Tweet Us Out. We have more than 500 likes on Facebook already and could use all the extra help I can get. Thanks Everyone!! 

Why an Ice Ball? Isn't all Ice the same? 
Well not so fast, a sphere has the unique characteristics of allowing the most volume to be contained within the least surface area possible. Meaning, an ice ball provides a drink with the least ice-to-alcohol/drink contact ratio possible drastically reducing the speed at which the ice melts. By comparison, crushed ice has low volume & a high total surface area, which is why it melts so fast in your drink. 

Sometimes you can find bartenders carving a cube of ice into a sphere for customers. Recently ice ball makers have been replacing this time consuming task. Plus how many people want to carve ice at home for their drinks. Our Ice Ball maker will be one of the first to be manufactured in the United States with an excruciating attention to detail and superior craftsmanship over more expensive units.

Plus my friends and I are Scotch lovers and you can't drink a watery Scotch now can you?

Okay great so that's an Ice Ball but how does it work?
 
Our Easy Ice Ball Maker is made of aluminum which has the highest thermal conductivity of any metal that can be reasonable used. As a comparison, stainless steel has about one-tenth the thermal conductivity as the aluminum alloy we use at three times the weight. Meaning a stainless steel unit would weigh about 46 pounds and take approx. 4 minutes to make an ice ball as opposed to the 2.75” Easy Ice Ball Maker weighing about 16 pounds and taking only 90 seconds. 

As for the operation - you simply place a block of ice on the bottom half of the Easy Ice Ball Maker, place the top half of the assembly on the guide-rails, and let gravity and the Easy Ice Ball Maker go to work. About a minute later you'll have a perfectly sphere or ice ball to impress yourself, your friends, or your customers with.

How Big is that Ice Ball you ask? 

2.75" or 70mm for the Large Easy Ice Ball Maker 
2.00" or 50mm for the Mini Easy Ice Ball Maker  

This is IndieGoGo why so expensive? 

Well believe it or not, our Easy Ice Ball Makers are 50% - 70% less than our competitors. The prices below don't even include the accessories that we include. That's all extra.

Competitor A - $1,448 (2.75” - Japan) 
Competitor B - $1,006 (2.50” - Scotland) 
Competitor C - $930 (2.95” - UK) 
Competitor D - $799 (2.75” - US) 

High quality ice ball makers are difficult products to manufacturer. Aluminum is a soft metal requiring extra careful handling throughout the entire process of manufacturing & assembly, all parts need to be machined to very precise measurements for everything to line up properly, and we are only using premium components.

What are we using the IndieGoGo Funds for?

We will use the funds to update our machine shop with a higher capacity cnc machine. This will allow us to create and machine the Easy Ice Ball Maker to the precise measurements to create a perfect sphere every time and allow our production runs to be faster. We will order the aluminum and start manufacturing once the materials arrive and then shipping of the Easy Ice Ball Makers. 

Don't forget to tell others that you think may be interested in such a sophisticated and Easy Ice Ball Maker.

story:
What is Gear Cartel?

We realized that the Independent Ski and Snowboard market is highly fragmented and it is extremely difficult for a consumer to track down unique products they can identify with. We also realized that many Independent brands dont have the resources they need to increasing their exposure which would help them grow their businesses.

That is where we come in. Our new website will launch on September 7th. We have built an easy to use platform that has an enormous selection of Independent Ski and Snowboard brands. We take care of the business side, so they can focus on what they love...Making quality products.

Our selection rivals that of the larger online as well as brick and mortar stores, but we focus on the Independent brands that are too small to stock some of the larger chain stores. We will be offering a comprehensive list of products not available anywhere else.  We will carry everything from hard goods like Skis and Snowboards to soft goods of performance and casual varieties. We even carry artwork and handmade goods related to Skiing and Snowboarding.

Who We Are:

Dan Parker (CEO and Founder): "I got my MBA from the University of Utah.  I am also an avid snowboarder and wanted to find a way to connect people like me to products they could really identify with."

Jared Gallardo (Vice President and Founder): "My degree is in Cognitive Science. My work experience is deeply rooted in marketing and user experience for technology companies. I have been involved in several start up companies and am drawn to the energy in getting good ideas off the ground."

Sushil Dosi (Developer): "I have a Masters degree in Computer Science. My passion is the 1's and 0's of programming. This project has helped test my development skills daily."

Whitney Baum, Shane Halvorsen, Jeff Theodosopoulos, and Jake Hansen (videographer) all head up the amazing effort to get our name out in the social media realm and bloggosphere.

Our Goal:

The goal of our campaign is to generate funds we can use to tell the world about our website www.gearcartel.com when we are ready to launch.  We have worked tirelessly to put together a community devoted to quality and dependability for the customer. Now we need to spread the word to our customers to let them know we are finally here.   

Your contributions will be the difference in our success as a company.  We have done our part in building the website and the essential relationships with the brands we represent. Now we need your help.  By donating to our campaign, you will allow us to market our idea to our customers and show them something completely unique and entirely new.

The perks we are offering are just a few of the quality products we will offer on our website. We promote brands who are green and give back to their communities and our giflts represent that well.  If you cant afford to contribute, please spread the word about our campaign to your friends using the indiegogo.com sharing tools.

Check Out Our Gifts! —>

story:
I plan to self-publish a book that offers menus and recipes for a year's worth of parties for busy women. Setting time aside to see one's friends is vitally important but most of us are so overworked and overwhelmed that we have to make a conscious effort to do so. The book is called Golden Afternoons: The Official Handbook of the Society for the Preservation of Ladies' Afternoon Tea. There are 15 menus in all – spread over the course of the year – offering multiple opportunities to get together.

About the Book 
The book is fun, funny, and irreverent. It offers intriguing menus, delicious recipes that are elegant but not too fussy, and interesting activity suggestions. I've decided to self-publish it so that I can maintain some degree of control over the look and content of the book. Plus, I ultimately want to give 10% of the profits from its sale to charities that fund the research and treatment of women's cancers (breast, ovarian, cervical, uterine, and endometrial) and I feel that I'll have better control over that aspect if I self-publish. My mother died of breast cancer and many, many of my friends have suffered from one – or more – of these illnesses, so I want to do what I can to raise both money and awareness. 

The Teas 
There are teas for every season. In January there are two teas: a readers' tea and a garden planning tea. In February, there is a funky valentine-making cocktail party as well as an elegant Valentine's Day afternoon tea. In March – International Women's Month – a remembrance tea is held where friends can talk about women who have inspired them, ranging from friends and family to historical figures and even fictional characters. Comfort food from different cultural traditions is served. 

April brings a travel-minded tea – for either planning or reminiscing – and in May there is a May Day breakfast, complete with strawberries and cream. It’s a proper occasion upon which to wear an outrageous hat! The May chapter also includes a graduation tea suitable for young women graduating from high school or college or for women in mid-life who’ve taken on the challenge of completing a degree while simultaneously meeting all of life’s other demands. These are achievements worth celebrating. June's offering is an elegant tea that could serve as a wedding shower, an intimate wedding, or simply as a celebration of the delicacies that spring and summer have to offer. A guide to tasting and serving Champagne is included. 

July's party is an ice cream social enhanced with some classic Southern picnic foods and August's menu is composed of meals from warm climates that are perfect to serve when it's seemingly too hot to eat. September's Mediterranean menu is dedicated to the concept of steadfastly refusing to acknowledge summer's end and it makes the most of the last of the garden's fresh produce.

October's menu is an apple and cheese tasting with an accompanying guide to hard ciders and appropriate wine selections. November's menu is suitable for a casual craft session: soups and sandwiches. You can prepare for the holidays or choose instead to chill out before the seasonal onslaught and just get together to put your feet up and watch Christmas in Connecticut (a comedy starring a young Barbara Stanwyck as a home and hearth expert advising others on how to prepare for the holidays. There’s just one small problem: she turns out to be a terrible fraud.) December's tea – the last of the year – is a Boxing Day tea featuring traditional holiday favorites perfect for an open house. 

Contributing Writers 
Many of my food writer friends want to join in this effort and they are contributing recipes to the book. I am very grateful to them and very excited about sharing their work! You can see links to their books on my blog, which will be following the progress of the book, at TeamTeaBook (see button below.) 

The Look and Feel of the Book 
I want to create a book that is beautiful as well as useful. Many people have told me that they plan on giving this book as a gift, so I want to make sure that it is gorgeous. Color photographs are very expensive to shoot and to print, but I can't imagine giving you recipes and not showing you what the finished product looks like. Printing and binding are expensive as well, as are layout and design. I've already written the text for the book and created and tested my recipes. It's the actual printing and production that is going to be expensive. My goal is to raise at least $25,000 of the cost of producing the book. 

Fundraising Strategy 
At this stage, I am using IndieGoGo.com to raise the amount of money necessary to pay for photos, layout, and the printing of the book. The money donated to me to create and print the book is not part of the money I plan to give to women's cancer charities: all of the money donated via IndieGoGo to me will go towards producing the book. I will instead be giving 10% of the money from the eventual sale of the book to these charities. The gifts given to me to produce the book will ultimately lead to raising money for this cause, but it is an indirect path. Money given to me to produce the book is not considered a donation when it comes to taxes. I just want to make sure that I am very clear and upfront about that.

PayPal
If you have a PayPal account, using it rather than a credit card will be even more helpful to me. If you don't have one, a credit card is fine too. I am profoundly grateful in either case!

Delivery Date 
I hope to be able to print the book by late spring/early summer, but since it depends on so many things, I can't give an exact date yet. 

Questions? 
Please feel free to contact me at teamteabook@gmail.com. 

Who am I? 
Click on the link ("created by") that will take you to my profile to learn about me and my previous food writing work. 

Thank you!
Thank you for your help. I deeply appreciate it.
story_txt:
I plan to self-publish a book that offers menus and recipes for a year's worth of parties for busy women. Setting time aside to see one's friends is vitally important but most of us are so overworked and overwhelmed that we have to make a conscious effort to do so. The book is called Golden Afternoons: The Official Handbook of the Society for the Preservation of Ladies' Afternoon Tea. There are 15 menus in all – spread over the course of the year – offering multiple opportunities to get together.
About the Book 
The book is fun, funny, and irreverent. It offers intriguing menus, delicious recipes that are elegant but not too fussy, and interesting activity suggestions. I've decided to self-publish it so that I can maintain some degree of control over the look and content of the book. Plus, I ultimately want to give 10% of the profits from its sale to charities that fund the research and treatment of women's cancers (breast, ovarian, cervical, uterine, and endometrial) and I feel that I'll have better control over that aspect if I self-publish. My mother died of breast cancer and many, many of my friends have suffered from one – or more – of these illnesses, so I want to do what I can to raise both money and awareness. The Teas There are teas for every season. In January there are two teas: a readers' tea and a garden planning tea. In February, there is a funky valentine-making cocktail party as well as an elegant Valentine's Day afternoon tea. In March – International Women's Month – a remembrance tea is held where friends can talk about women who have inspired them, ranging from friends and family to historical figures and even fictional characters. Comfort food from different cultural traditions is served. April brings a travel-minded tea – for either planning or reminiscing – and in May there is a May Day breakfast, complete with strawberries and cream. It’s a proper occasion upon which to wear an outrageous hat! The May chapter also includes a graduation tea suitable for young women graduating from high school or college or for women in mid-life who’ve taken on the challenge of completing a degree while simultaneously meeting all of life’s other demands. These are achievements worth celebrating. June's offering is an elegant tea that could serve as a wedding shower, an intimate wedding, or simply as a celebration of the delicacies that spring and summer have to offer. A guide to tasting and serving Champagne is included. July's party is an ice cream social enhanced with some classic Southern picnic foods and August's menu is composed of meals from warm climates that are perfect to serve when it's seemingly too hot to eat. September's Mediterranean menu is dedicated to the concept of steadfastly refusing to acknowledge summer's end and it makes the most of the last of the garden's fresh produce.
October's menu is an apple and cheese tasting with an accompanying guide to hard ciders and appropriate wine selections. November's menu is suitable for a casual craft session: soups and sandwiches. You can prepare for the holidays or choose instead to chill out before the seasonal onslaught and just get together to put your feet up and watch Christmas in Connecticut (a comedy starring a young Barbara Stanwyck as a home and hearth expert advising others on how to prepare for the holidays. There’s just one small problem: she turns out to be a terrible fraud.) December's tea – the last of the year – is a Boxing Day tea featuring traditional holiday favorites perfect for an open house. 

Contributing Writers 
Many of my food writer friends want to join in this effort and they are contributing recipes to the book. I am very grateful to them and very excited about sharing their work! You can see links to their books on my blog, which will be following the progress of the book, at TeamTeaBook (see button below.) 
The Look and Feel of the Book 
I want to create a book that is beautiful as well as useful. Many people have told me that they plan on giving this book as a gift, so I want to make sure that it is gorgeous. Color photographs are very expensive to shoot and to print, but I can't imagine giving you recipes and not showing you what the finished product looks like. Printing and binding are expensive as well, as are layout and design. I've already written the text for the book and created and tested my recipes. It's the actual printing and production that is going to be expensive. My goal is to raise at least $25,000 of the cost of producing the book. 
Fundraising Strategy 
At this stage, I am using IndieGoGo.com to raise the amount of money necessary to pay for photos, layout, and the printing of the book. The money donated to me to create and print the book is not part of the money I plan to give to women's cancer charities: all of the money donated via IndieGoGo to me will go towards producing the book. I will instead be giving 10% of the money from the eventual sale of the book to these charities. The gifts given to me to produce the book will ultimately lead to raising money for this cause, but it is an indirect path. Money given to me to produce the book is not considered a donation when it comes to taxes. I just want to make sure that I am very clear and upfront about that.PayPalIf you have a PayPal account, using it rather than a credit card will be even more helpful to me. If you don't have one, a credit card is fine too. I am profoundly grateful in either case!
Delivery Date 
I hope to be able to print the book by late spring/early summer, but since it depends on so many things, I can't give an exact date yet. 
Questions? 
Please feel free to contact me at teamteabook@gmail.com. 
Who am I? 
Click on the link ("created by") that will take you to my profile to learn about me and my previous food writing work. Thank you!Thank you for your help. I deeply appreciate it.

story:
Short Summary

As an entertainer in Orlando for years I've been looking for the next best thing. Well just about two years ago I found it. I guess founded it is more apt. In January of 2011 I launched A Little Punch Drunk a podcast and Internet radio show that has been growing and changing non stop since episode one.
With very humble beginnings it was two guys huddled over a tiny audio relay splitting one mic and one headset jack. A few months later I had a new host and begin the live video feed durithey'll the recordings. As we continued to grow we began brining on guests like Ed and Gavin from Midnight Syndicate and doing conventions in town like Vuducon and Spooky Empire Mayhem I reached an impass. Brought on by the departure of my current co-hosts I was left short on equipment and partners. So my hope is that with the new your of ALPD and my new team we can raise the money to replace and upgrade the equipment and quality of the show.

What We Need & What You Get

The show is trying to raise $2000 for the equipment to improve the quality and overall production of the show. The money will go toward the following.

  • A MacBook Pro ~ better audio and video cards to take the quality to the next level $100-$1500
  • Portable hard drive ~ to allow me to keep everything safe and in a designated space $100
  • New cameras ~ for cleaner crisp picture during the video broadcast and multiple angles $120
  • USB hub ~ ease and accessibility for new tech $30
  • Headphone splitter ~ for monitor use for all recording $30
  • Monitor headsets ~ ability to monitor sound quality $120
  • New mic stands ~ stands for the mics $60
  • Pop filters ~ screens to stop unwanted sounds in the mics $60
  • Various cables ~ upgrades to cables improve sound quality $60

 

The Impact

By donating you will be directly responsible for allowing the show to grow. There are plans in place for live events, bookings for conventions, interviews, and much more in store for A Little Punch Drunk. The current project is one where the show hits the road to various haunted or wildly interesting locations in Fl to record. But without the upgrades and missing equipment needed none of it can happen. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you yourself cannot donate to the campaign please:

  • Share this campaign with as many people as you can
  • Give the show itself a listen! 
  • Go to www.cafepress.com/alittlepunchdrunk and buy some merch
  • "like" the Facebook fan page and share it with others

story:
Be sure to check the UPDATES tab for all the latest info and photos as the Quilts are being made!

Even though we've reached our "goal", the girls can still use a lot of help, please continue to donate. Every bit helps provide for them now that their mother cannot.

Short Summary

Danyell Furrh passed away unexpectedly on July 2nd, 2012, leaving behind Kaitlyn (9) and Zoe (18). Kaitlyn just completed 3rd grade in Mrs. Margolese's class at Spring Creek Elementary in Dallas, TX.  Danyell was a single parent. Kaitlyn is currently living with her uncle Keith's family.  

Danyell's Obituary & Video: http://www.affoplano.com/component/obituary/?view=detail&id=166

Articles about the accident: http://thescoopblog.dallasnews.com/2012/07/woman-struck-and-killed-by-concrete-truck-while-crossing-northwest-highway.html/

http://dfw.cbslocal.com/2012/07/02/woman-crossing-highway-hit-killed-by-cement-truck/

What We Need

We are raising funds to have a memory quilt made from pieces of Danyell's clothing, one Queen sized quilt for each girl.

(Update 8/14): Just got the pricing back -- it turns out that Queen Sized Quilts will run $850/each after labor, backing material, edging, embroidery and taxes. Queen Sized is actually pretty big 96" x 102". I am having Full Sized Quilts quoted also to see if that will save some money and leave more to give the girls from what is leftover. Also, if anyone knows how to get us tax exempt status, because this is technically a donation, please let me know, it'll save us about $130 and we can give that to the girls instead!  

The quilts will take about 6 weeks to make and should be ready around Sept 30th if all goes well.

Link to the company in Carrollton who will make the quilt for us: http://theoldcraftstore.com/wordpress/

Example quilt, similar to the one we are having made: http://acornridgequilting.blogspot.com/2011/05/memory-quilts-for-two-sisters.html

The Impact

Everyone wants to help in some way, but it is difficult to know what to do. Making these quilts will preserve a piece of their mother for the girls and give them an heirloom they can wrap themselves in and feel her presence for years to come.


My daughter and her friend Kaitlyn

Any Extra Funds

As of 7/17 we have met our initial goal and have enough to go ahead with the quilts!! :-) Any extra $$ raised at this point will go into a fund for the girls and be administered by their Uncle Keith. The girls still need a lot of help beyond the quilts, so thank you so much for anything that you care to donate, it is VERY appreciated. The donations ability at this site will remain open until mid September.

story:
I'm Tabatha, and I'm currently a freelance writer/graphic designer work-from-home-mom to two awesome kids under three years of age and wife to an inner city public school teacher. My son is severely developmentally delayed and has several ongoing health issues, so working out of the home at a traditional job is near impossible with his interventions, therapies, appointments and other care ... not to mention his little sister's very normal needs and care as well. We do okay on my husband's beginner teacher's salary, but after renovating the majority of our century-plus old house over the last five years as well as the cost of care for our son, we don't have a lot left anymore for small extras, nevermind starting a business.

I'm asking for help to convert a partially-finished room in my basement into an office space for not only my writing and graphic work, but for beginning a career in interior design. I've found deep fulfillment in transforming spaces to reflect the people who inhabit them, and I've had increasing interest from others for me to help them with their homes and work spaces. I've been featured on several websites for the unique style of work that I've done in my own home, and I feel a deep drive to take this talent out into the world. I do a lot of work now for barter or trade, but unfortunately that doesn't help me or my family financially.

Right now I work from a corner of my kitchen that also serves as our family's general crap drop off space. I don't have anywhere to think quietly for a minute, or store samples, or even bring people over to see what I do that isn't covered with kid and pet paraphernalia. I need an organized, dedicated space to pursue my dreams and create a way to support my family that is in the best interests of all of us.

What We Need & What You Get

I'm asking for $3000 to get my business, Tabulous Industries, off the ground from start to finish. The room I want to convert is mold infested and will need to be completely gutted and reconstructed with sealers, mold-resistant drywall, and the concrete floor will need repaired and evened out and refinished. This is work that my husband and I can do ourselves, with the help of some family and friends, and that would also give me something to write about throughout the process for both my own website and some of my freelance jobs, which have started to become few and far between as of late.

I have the desk in the kitchen and some paper storage boxes, but in the way of office furniture that's about it, so resonable furnishings would be a part of the budget. I love finding things at thrift stores and refinishing them, so please know I would be budget-minded as I completed the space.

My laptop is about two years old and is in decent shape, but it does need some repairs to get it up to snuff. I'd really like to have a desktop to do my designing on, but I can make do with what I have as long as I can afford to get it repaired. My phone is also on it's last legs, but I'm not eligible for an upgrade until January 2013 -- and you can't run a business without a phone.

I also want to become a licensed contractor in my area, so that I may work on projects myself as time and childcare allows. One of my favorite parts of transforming a space is actually getting my hands dirty and literally doing it myself. So I would need help with the tests and insurance/bonding costs that come along with that official status.

As for perks, I can offer my services -- writing, interior design, links on my website, DIY labor -- really the options are endless! I love being useful and helping people, so if you have a project in mind I'll do my best to help you with it. 

Of course, I know I'm asking for a lot of money and I know there's a chance I won't reach my goal. Whatever funding I do recieve will go towards at least starting this project -- most importantly removing the mold from my home and repairing my computer so that I may continue to work to the best of my abilities with what I have. 

The Impact

Creating my own office space will help me to use my creative inclinations to fuel my passions into a viable buisness to help support my family. I've spent a lifetime being told that artists don't make money and that simply just can't be true. I want to prove to my kids as they grow that you really can be anything you want to be when you grow up, and that there's no shame in following your dreams. I want them to have a mom they're proud of, and I want my husband to have a wife whose choices he doesn't have to defend to outsiders.

By funding my campaign, you will help me make the lives of people happier, one room at a time. You'll enable a small-town girl to follow her heart and have purpose and worth in the world. You'll help a young family not be defined by the bad times they've overcome, but by the succcesses they created together. And you'll be supporting a women-run small business in a time where it's really hard for the little guy to stay afloat on their own.

If you want to see the kind of design work & projects I've done in my own home and at a couple of friend's homes, please visit http://turnrightatlakemichigan.blogspot.com (my home renovation website) and http://www.sotabulous.com (my personal life blog). I can send you graphic design examples too, if that's more up your alley.

Other Ways You Can Help

I know times are tight for everyone, so if you can't contribute but want to help, then share this campaign through social media, blog about it, shoot me a message and interview me about it, or if you can donate time, services, or materials to help, any and all of that would be so very deeply and gratefully appreciated.

Thanks for taking the time to check out my dream, and I hope you have a wonderful day!

I can send you graphic design examples too, if that's more up your alley.

Thanks for taking the time to check out my dream, and I hope you have a wonderful day!

story:
Update

12/5-check out our finalized logo image above, and our first Youtube video in the Gallery! more vid to come!

My Story

My name is Joshua Miller, and I am a chef. I come from a family of chefs. My grandfather cooked on a Navy Destroyer in WWII and my mother was a cook in a Meditation Ashram where I first started as an assistant cook in 1986.


It's been my dream as long as I can remember to start my own business, to create wonderful food, cooked with love. 


Now, after a long period working with some of the best catering companies in the San Francisco Bay Area... and gaining valuable skills and knowledge in the industry, I am ready to take the wisdom I have gained and apply it towards realizing my dream. I am looking for the right kitchen space in the East Bay or San Francisco which will allow me to begin, and at the same time make a positive impact in a community that I love.



The Impact

Your donations will allow me to help alleviate world hunger, end our system of political corruption and stop global warming in it's tracks.... Okay, perhaps I'm overstating. I'm a chef, not a rocket scientist! What can I do? 


I can take my skills I learned in the professional culinary world, and the love I learned to cook with in the Meditation Ashram, and look to make people the best tasting, most wholesome food possible.


I can donate any food excess from an event to help those in need.


I can commit to no longer using single-use disposable items, but use multi-use items as much as possible. When not possible, I will use compostable disposables.


I can commit to giving 15% of my profits after tax to the Occupy movement, or if Occupy disbands, any other movement that empowers those who feel powerless.


I can teach what I know, what I am passionate about, so I can pass the torch to the next generation.


I can commit to mentoring other budding entrepreneurs and helping them learn skill sets, see the big picture and most importantly, learn how to treat their obstacles as stepping stones on a path rather than a wall that keeps them from a future.


and, I can commit to paying it all forward. Because, no matter how much each of us have done, we owe a debt we cannot repay to others along our journey. 


finally, I can help young entrepreneurs understand that a mastery of punctuation marks is overrated.... that you can even get your idea across with a run-on sentence. (apologies to Mrs. Adams, my 2nd grade math teacher) 




What We Need & What You Get

What we Need: 

Startup Operating Capital- for utilitites, rent, ingredients, and equipment. 

Funds for large kitchen appliances

food-safe work tables

food safe metro shelving

small wares

cambro food transport containers


You get: 

insight into the disturbed mind of a professional chef through my blog

A ringside seat in the creation and struggles of a young upstart company

You get to live vicariously through the twists and turns of my little adventure, so you don't have to.

And you can feel good knowing that you are helping this red-headed stepchild achieve his dream.




Other Ways You Can Help

Money is always welcome.... but when that's not an option, there are many other ways you can help.... 

If you have an opinion about what I'm doing, or my plans, feel free to email me, as I look forward to hearing from you! 

If you have an old family recipe you'd like to share, perhaps I can revive it for you, and credit you or your family member as the source, if you like.

Also, it will help me a lot if you share my story with your friends. 

You can email people on your contact lists, 

you can post my link on the wall of your facebook page, 

and you can also tweet that same link on your twitter account.


The more people we can have see this page, the quicker we work towards making the campaign goal a done deal.

I can take my skills I learned in the professional culinary world, and the love I learned to cook with in the Meditation Ashram, and look to make people the best tasting, most wholesome food possible.

I can donate any food excess from an event to help those in need.

I can commit to no longer using single-use disposable items, but use multi-use items as much as possible. When not possible, I will use compostable disposables.

I can commit to giving 15% of my profits after tax to the Occupy movement, or if Occupy disbands, any other movement that empowers those who feel powerless.

I can teach what I know, what I am passionate about, so I can pass the torch to the next generation.

I can commit to mentoring other budding entrepreneurs and helping them learn skill sets, see the big picture and most importantly, learn how to treat their obstacles as stepping stones on a path rather than a wall that keeps them from a future.

and, I can commit to paying it all forward. Because, no matter how much each of us have done, we owe a debt we cannot repay to others along our journey. 

finally, I can help young entrepreneurs understand that a mastery of punctuation marks is overrated.... that you can even get your idea across with a run-on sentence. (apologies to Mrs. Adams, my 2nd grade math teacher) 


What
We Need & What You Get
What we Need: 
Startup
Operating Capital- for utilitites, rent, ingredients, and equipment. 
Funds for large kitchen appliances
food-safe work tables
food
safe metro shelving
small wares
cambro
food transport containers

You get: 
insight into the disturbed mind of a professional chef through my blog
A ringside seat in the creation and struggles of a young upstart company
You get to live vicariously through the twists and turns of my little adventure, so you don't have to.
And you can feel good knowing that you are helping this red-headed stepchild achieve his dream.


Other
Ways You Can Help
Money is always welcome.... but when that's not an option, there are many other ways you can help.... 
If you have an opinion about what I'm doing, or my plans, feel free to email me, as I look forward to hearing from you! 
If you have an old family recipe you'd like to share, perhaps I can revive it for you, and credit you or your family member as the source, if you like.
Also, it will help me a lot if you share
my story with your friends. 
You can email people on your contact lists, 
you can post my link on the wall of your facebook page, 
and you can also tweet that same link on your twitter account.

The more people we can have see this page, the quicker we work towards making the campaign goal a done deal.

story:
THE BENEFICIARIES

Elite Rescue, Recovery, and Rebuilding (ER3)

was founded after Hurricanes Katrina and Rita as a full scale disatser relief organization. ER3 is based out of Philadelphia, PA. In all non-emergent times, ER3 works with community partners around the U.S. and around the world in the areas of education, health, and arts. Their involvement in Haiti has been constant since the January 12,2010 earthquake. They are currently working with the advancement of arts, as well as health and education with the Children's Home of Gonaives in Gonaives, Haiti.

The Childrens Home of Gonaive (CHG)

The Children’s Home of Gonaives is in need of financial assistance to care for our orphans. Our most immediate need is for nutritious food to give to the children, since the orphanage has not yet received food rations. The orphanage would be greatly appreciative of any support in helping our children lead healthy, fulfilling lives.

The Children’s Home of Gonaives is an orphanage located in Gonaives, Haiti. The orphanage is currently housing and helping 15 children. The city of Gonaives was affected by Cyclone Hanna which hit Haiti in 2008. On January 12th, 2010, Haiti experienced a devastating earthquake which claimed hundreds of thousands of lives. Fortunately, the orphans and the staff of the Children’s Home of Gonaive’s were unharmed. Two weeks after the earthquake, the Children’s Home of Gonaives took in several more children who had lost their parents in the tragedy.

THE IMPACT

Your donations would enable CHG to make their monthly budget for food, clothing, and the day to day needs for the children of CHG.

Your donations will also enable ER3 to continue their critical role of support in providing educational materials, school supplies, arts supplies, and internet service for educational resources.

This partnership was formed back in 2010 when Jim Stephens and Douglas Hogue of ER3 were working with Jeudy Djemson in Leogane, Haiti after the January 12 earthquake.

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

If you cannot contribute, please pass the word around to your friends or family who may be able to assist. Regretfully, no perks are available due to this urgent need. Thank You.

story:
Sie glauben noch immer an das gute alte  Unternehmertum, an den Firmenpatriarchen des alten Stils? Macht nichts, es geht heute auch anders. Sie glauben, Politiker schaffen Arbeitsplätze? Und Konzerne sichern unsereren Wohlstand? Wohl kaum. Es sind die Unternehmer des neuen Typs, besser Entrepreneure genannt, die unsere Gesellschaft voran bringen. Tatsächlich gab es auch früher nur wenige Menschen, die alles konnten. Die eine Geschäftsidee entwarfen und erfolgreich umsetzten konnten, den Vertrieb selber gemacht haben und abends noch schnell die Buchhaltung erledigt haben um am nächsten Tag schnell noch die Pressearbeit zu erledigen. Entrepreneure wissen es besser: Sie konzentrieren sich auf ihre Stärken und lassen die übrigen Aufgaben von Fachleuten erledigen. Oft geht es dann sogar besser und billiger.

Mit einem Film über diese neuen Entrepreneure soll gezeigt werden, dass es gar nicht so schwierig ist, ein Unternehmen zu gründen und erfolgreich zu führen. Die von Prof. Günter Faltin aus Berlin angstoßene Bewegung besteht bislang aus geschätzt 1% wirklichen Entrepreneuren. Buch und Film sollen die Bewegung weiter anstoßen, damit wir eines Tages 10% solcher Entrepreneure unter uns haben werden. Machen Sie mit, damit dieser Film Wirklichkeit wird.

Wer bin ich / mein Hintergrund ?

Als Filmemacher und Journalist nutze ich mein Know-How Geschichten interessant zu erzählen.

Welches Problem löst ENTREPRENEUR TV ?

Ich möchte das spannende Entrepreneur-Schaffen in der Realität zeigen (den Film zum Buch "Kopf schlägt Kapital" von Prof. Günter Faltin aus Berlin machen)

- dabei eine neue Werbe-Plattform für Entrepreneure schaffen: Stichwort: "Gelbe Seiten" als Videos

- also Entrepreneuren, längere kostengünstige Image-Filme anbieten

- Ganz nebenbei, sozusagen kostenlos dazu gibt es für die Entrepreneure ein Kamera-Training („wie verhalte ich mich vor der Kamera)

- Schließlich: neue, künftige Entrepreneure sehen anhand positiver Beispiele, wie es gehen könnte.

- also: salopp gesagt: das Buch zum Film „Kopf schlägt Kapital“ gibt es schon, die Verfilmung soll zu einer Serie mit neuen Entrepreneur-Beispielen ständig ergänzbar sein

Produkt-Erklärung und Lösung

- Meine Zielgruppe: Entrepreneure, die erfolgreich nach Prof. Günter Faltin´s Leitfaden „Kopf schlägt Kapital“ arbeiten

- Ich biete kompakte Dreharbeiten (Thema ist allen klar) an und bündele die Drehorte: mehrere Firmen pro Tag (verzicht auf teuren Marketin-Schnick-Schnack

- Geplant sind visuelle Baukästen: nach Branchen etc. ständig erweiterbar, um Filme via DVD-Schulung, auf YouTube und der eigenen (Entrepreneur´s-Webseite) zugänglich zu machen

- Entrepreneure können zum einen Ihr Konzept in der Praxis vorstellen, und auch einen eigenen, längeren Image-Film in Auftrag geben (wenn das Kamera-Team schon mal da ist...)

Wen benötige ich

Entrepreneure, die ihr Konzept vor der Kamera vorstellen möchten und eine Anschub-Finanzierung.

Wie geht´s los?

Mit der Basis-Finanzierung über diese Campagne soll es den ersten Grundlagen-Film geben. Das Ziel: 3 Muster-Entrepreneure werden vorgestellt und Prof. Faltin erläutert seine Ansätze.

Anschließend können wie bei einem Baukasten immer mehr Entreprepneure ihr Konzept filmisch vorstellen.

story:
Who is Survive The Streets?

Survive The Streets is an annual survival gear giveaway for homeless and very low-income adults which originated in Seattle started by Patti Dunn, Mike Grabham. Since 2008 they have partnered with Real Change News to broaden the reach of participants. In 2011, STS served 175 citizens from the Real Change, Bread of Life, and Compass Center communities-- this year, in 2012 we are expanding our goals to serve and meet the needs of the growing homeless population in North America by providing food, clothing and necessities in Seattle, San Francisco, Los Angeles, Phoenix and St. John's, Canada.

What We Need: 

Seed money to afford a fully functioning website to share Survive The Streets and offer the option to donate year-round to support the homeless community.

Advertising money to spend on publicizing the cause on social media channels and community based blogs. 

Money to afford the printing and manufacturing costs for STS posters, flyers and event signage for all city chapters.

Basic funds for food, survival packs (back packs with daily necessities, toiletries, socks, (1) clean set of clothes, flash light, rain jacket, misc), sleeping bags and more.

Funds to purchase enough toys, books, supplies and necessities for homeless children and the day schools they attend in all our chapter cities.

Money to support opening Survive The Street community chapters in Seattle, Los Angeles, San Francisco and Phoenix, AZ.

What You Get:

$5.00 donation - A custom Survive The Streets sticker for your car, notebook, laptop, guitar case, you name it. Sticker says "I Help Survive The Streets Care for the Homeless Community in my City."

$10.00 donation - A custom, American Apparel, burn out style, extralong, long sleeve, Survive The Streets t-shirt. Tee has our STS logo on the front and our slogan on the back, "I Help Survive The Streets Care for the Homeless Community in my City."

$50.00 donation - A custom STS sticker, custom burnout, long sleeve STS tee, our national promotional 36 x 24 sized poster (wonderful way to spread the love on campus in your dorm, your classroom, office or cafe) and a shout out and @tag with tweets on our Survive The Streets Facebook and Twitter pages.

$100.00 donation - A private, exclusive dinner with founders and a VIP event participant badge. A custom STS sticker, custom burnout, long sleeve STS tee, our national promotional 36 x 24 sized poster (wonderful way to spread the love on campus in your dorm, your classroom, office or cafe) and a shout out and @tag with tweets on our Survive The Streets Facebook and Twitter pages. 

$250 donation - A private, exclusive dinner with founders for up to (5) guests, and a VIP event participant badge for each guest. Custom STS stickers, custom burnout, long sleeve STS tees, our national promotional 36 x 24 sized posters (wonderful way to spread the love on campus in your dorm, your classroom, office or cafe) and a shout out and @tag with tweets on our Survive The Streets Facebook and Twitter pages for up to (5) names. 

$500 donation - ELITE STATUS. A private, exclusive dinner with founders for up to (5) guests, and a VIP event participant badge for each guest. Custom STS stickers, custom burnout, long sleeve STS tees, our national promotional 36 x 24 sized posters (wonderful way to spread the love on campus in your dorm, your classroom, office or cafe) and a shout out and @tag with tweets on our Survive The Streets Facebook and Twitter pages for up to (5) names. PLUS: personally named as an Elite Survive The Streets Donor on the STS website and all social media pages. We will add a profile of you and your company for all our donors and supporters to see. Ad banners created for your website to tell the world you are a STS Elite Donor.

$1000 donation - GOLD STATUS. A private, exclusive dinner with founders for up to (5) guests, and a VIP event participant badge for each guest. Custom STS stickers, custom burnout, long sleeve STS tees, our national promotional 36 x 24 sized posters (wonderful way to spread the love on campus in your dorm, your classroom, office or cafe) and a shout out and @tag with tweets on our Survive The Streets Facebook and Twitter pages for up to (5) names. PLUS: personally named as an Elite Survive The Streets GOLD Donor on the STS website and all social media pages. We will add a profile of you and your company for all our donors and supporters to see. Ad banners created for your website to tell the world you are a STS Elite Donor. PLUS: Gold Donors will also be included in the filming of the Survive The Steets documentary short film and any TV and press exposure for up to one year.

Should Survive The Streets and our volunteers not reach out goal with this campaign, whatever funds are raised will be allocated to developing a strong website presence and to afford as much as we can for our event on November 22, 2012. We will focus our efforts on getting the needs met of our homeless community as base our level of support from the seed money we are able to raise - we need your help.

The Impact

At a time of ever-decreasing funding for homeless services from both the cities and county offices, personal donations and financial support are needed now more than ever. That’s why we are partnering with local, regional and national businesses, community groups, and schools to hold survival gear drives throughout the US and Canada for our organization, Surviving The Streets.

Our deepest and most sincere mission is to support, nourish, clothe and empower the growing homeless community of men, women and children in multiple cities in the US and Canada. Our one-day gear drive will be coordinated to service over 1000 members of this in-need population -our target date in Thanksgiving, 2012.

YOU are how we do this! Without the support, love and encouragement from donors like you, Survive The Streets cannot thrive, cannot serve the homeless community and we NEED you more than ever. 

Our team of fund raising experts, film makers, photographers, web designers, PR agents, and social media experts have donated countless hours to this campaign because they know the impact of homelessness on our society and the want CHANGE. Choose to be a part of the change, choose to be a part of Survive The Streets. You Can Help.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean you can't help:

Post this campaign on your Facebook, Twitter, Google+ and Pinterest account - sharing the word is wonderful and we appreciate anything you can do!

Remember, use the "share" tools here on our STS campaign page and put the word out to all your friends, family and co-workers, the effort can make all the difference!

We are so grateful to have this opportunity to engage with you and to share our cause - with you we know we can be the light for so many who have lost their way, lost hope... there is hope and there is a way. You are that way.

story:
WE NEED YOUR HELP TO RAISE $3,000 BY APRIL 3rd
SO THAT WE CAN HOLD DIY DAYS NYC.

ADDITIONAL funds raised beyond $3,000 will be applied to future DIY DAYS events.


DIY DAYS is a FREE roving conference for those who create. Focused on creativity and storytelling the event strives to help those working in film, music, games, design and software to fund, create, distribute and sustain from their creative efforts. On April 3rd DIY DAYS is coming to the New School in NYC.

DIY DAYS NYC needs your help as we are mounting one of the largest events we’ve done to date. There will be over 30 speakers and more than 25 different sessions. While we’ve tried to barter for as much as possible NYC is an expensive place to hold an event.


There are a few things that we need money for…

- Event insurance
- After party mixer (location, food, drink)
- Printing of programs
- Coffee and bagels at the event
- walkie talkie rentals for conference staff



photo by Mike Hedge


Taking place over the course of a day the event consists of talks, presentations and workshops. We’ll also be introducing a new section at DIY DAYS NYC called “incubator.” The incubator gathers experts in various fields (legal, funding, biz dev, software developers, designers, brand specialists) to help two entrepreneurs think thank their media startups.


DIY DAYS events have been held in LA, San Francisco, Boston and Philadelphia. To date over 1,500 people have attended and the videos which we’ve released as open media have been viewed upwards of 400,000 times.



photo by Mike Hedge

The DIY DAYS video was produced by SABI PICTURES with music from the new album by DEKLUN
