story:
The Albuquerque Police Officer's Association is turning to YOU to help Officer Kyle Evans.

Officer Evans is a 23 year old policeman that was diagnosed with Hodgkin's Lymphoma. The tumor has returned and now there is a cyst growing on the tumor.

This has left Officer Evans with excrutiating headaches (among other things), yet he continues to work.

Many ask why he is still working; the answer is easy- that's just the way Kyle Evans is! He is constantly thinking of others before himself. For example, instead of focusing his worries on his upcoming surgery, he is worried about letting his squad down.

This campaign will help offset the horrendous bills Officer Evans is faced with, especially with his pending surgery. Thank you Officer Kyle Evans for everything you have done. Thank you for protecting the people of Albuquerque everyday.

You are the true definition of HERO!

story:
The Commit to Give – New England (CTGNE) Story:

CTGNE provides New England-based nonprofit organizations and charitable groups with an opportunity to promote their events, share their volunteer opportunities and connect to those who are interested in volunteering or supporting a particular cause. For volunteers, financial donors, or those who simply enjoy giving back to their communities, CTGNE is the gateway to finding volunteer opportunities, local charity news and potential job opportunities.

CTGNE was founded in 2010 by Irene Johnson of Massachusetts. Its concept was born of her own desire to volunteer and her struggle to locate and learn about the volunteer opportunities and needs of her community. 

After weeks of research and thorough investigation, Irene created the CTGNE online database of nonprofit organizations and charitable groups in the New England area, created CTGNE's website, contacted several of these organizations and groups, informed them of her intended services and invited them to participate in her new venture, thus creating the CTGNE network. The reception was overwhelming.

Once the nonprofit organizations and charitable groups seeking volunteer staff or financial supporters made the commitment to work with CTGNE, CTGNE embarked on the second part of its mission; to inform potential volunteers on how to use the CTGNE network to find these organizations and groups. Through CTGNE’s website and social network sites such as Facebook, Twitter and LinkedIn, CTGNE, in such a short period of time, has become very successful at establishing itself as a powerful resource of information to hundreds of potential volunteers.

CTGNE is a free service that is offered to nonprofit organizations, charitable groups and to those who enjoy giving back to their community whether through volunteering or financial support.  When nonprofit organizations and charitable groups join Commit to Give – New England, they are granted permission to share their events and/or volunteer opportunities through CTGNE's social media channels. 

 

How Your Investment Will Be Used:

Your financial investment will be applied towards marketing our services to nonprofits and potential volunteers, advertising, website maintenance, staffing needs, volunteer recruitment programs and business development initiatives to increase revenue opportunities. With your help, we can continue to provide these services for FREE!

story:
What is QUILT?

QUILT is a community-driven platform for a variety of underrepresented members of the queer community. We want to create a space where voices from all gender expressions, ethnic and national backgrounds, sexual preference or lack thereof, and bodies can be heard on a national level. Our goal is to provide that platform for those voices to speak about culture, news, entertainment, current events, interviews, lifestyle and education to patch together our intersectional communities.


Why QUILT?

When you are able to give a  voice to an under represented member of ANY community, it just feels good. We want to create a sustainable business model where writers are paid for their contributions to QUILT, both ensuring that we maintain a high quality of work for audience and also fairly compensating writers for the time and effort they put into each piece of QUILT. Each member of our team comes from a different background in community building, website management, and writing, but we all share a drive to enable marginalized groups to have their stories told.


What does QUILT need?

Our funds are going to be going towards web development, content production financing, promotion of QUILT, trademark licensing, and creating a nest egg for payment of staff and contributing writers in the future. Many sites have trouble maintaining quality of content and longevity without such funding, so your contributions mean QUILT will have a more stable stage for underrepresented voices to use to speak out!


Other Ways You Can Help

  • Help us spread the word about our fundraising campaign! Share this link with your current network!
  • Be sure to like us on Facebook and Twitter!
    https://www.facebook.com/quiltmag
    https://twitter.com/QuiltMag

story:
ReforestNation is a new project that aims to buy and replace monoculture plantation woodlands and poor quality grazing land with healthy deciduous forests in Southern Scotland – and help build community in the process.

We want our project to be both environmentally and economically sustainable, so we aim to make and sell great products from Sitka woods – such as cabins, saunas and sheds – and use the funding we generate to fund reforestation, creating both healthy wild woods for plants and animals, and woods that benefit humans through woodland education and craft programs, hutting communities, and forest gardens.

We have a talented team of people with the rights skills and experience to take the project forward – people with experience of reforesting, permaculture, green wood work, crafts, community education – all with a passion for the ideas behind the project. To find out more about who we are, click here.

What We Need & What You Get

In the first phase of the project, we want to raise a small sum through crowd-funding to kickstart the project. Now £4000 isn't going to buy any land for the project, but it will be enough to start a tree nursery and to invest in essential tools and equipment. 

Our biggest single investment is going to be in a mobile saw-mill - which might seem a strange way for a reforesting project to start! The mobile saw-mill is going to allow us to harvest and cut sitka trees and turn the wood into useful building materials to make saunas and cabins, which can then be sold to raise money for the project to invest in land to reforest.  

If the crowdfunding project goes well we hope to build our first prototype wood powered sauna over the winter - and this first sauna is a perk you can bid for in this campaign!


Flexible Funding 

With Indiegogo you can choose whether to have a fixed target for funding, where you only get the funding if you hit the target, or a flexible target, where you get to keep whatever your raise. We've opted for this option so that we can get started on the project however much we raise. If we miss our goal by a lot, we won't be able to buy the saw-mill - but we will put the funding straight into essential tools and materials for the tree nursery, and borrow or hire a saw-mill to be able to build the prototype saunas. 

The Impact

Whilst planting more trees and creating decidious forests is one of the key aims of this project, we think Reforestnation can offer something even more inspiring.

We are hoping to create a model that shows that a group of people with a passion can generate the funding to buy and reforest land themselves - without relying ongrants or funding from Goverment or charities. It's about turning people power into community woodland. 


In that sense, we are at the very beginning of an exciting experiement experiment, and we hope you'll get involved. We'll be documenting the whole experience through in film and photography, and through the Reforestnation website. 

Risks & Challenges

This is an experiment in community building that is built around a positive vision of what we can do if we pool our resources. We have a great team of people with diverse skills to get the project started, and if we raise the funding for the first phase of the project, we certainly have all the right experience and skills to create our first tree nursery and to build the first cabin and sauna prototypes.


What comes after that is a much bigger challenge. Raising enough money to buy land for the project is going to take a lot more funding, and another crowdfunding campaign. But by then we aim to have some pretty exciting things to offer people who support us - and a lot of new supporters like you to help spread the word.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    As we said above, ReforestNation aims to turn people power into trees. We hope you'll support us in any way you can - spread the word about the project, follow us on Twitter or Facebook, and share our crowdfunding campaign with your friends. 

    Once the project gets going, we're also going to holding lots of community events, including seed collection and tree planting, stay tuned to our website and Facebook page for more information. 

    And if you have skills that are relevent to our project, or if you just want to find out more, don't hesitate to get in touch - we'd love to hear from you. Just email reforestnation@gmail.com

    Tom, Sarah, Simon, Jen, Andy, Gene, Caff, James and Elly :)

story:
Proving Up the Welk Homestead

UPDATE: Early Sunday morning 22 July, this campaign achieved its initial goal of $4000. Individual thank-you's are going out, but here's a general shout of appreciation to all who have supported the effort.

Are we done, then? Well, no. In the first place, now that we have the money to buy lumber, we need to do the actual, physical work! The big push will come with a work party on 1-3 August. If you'd like to help with that, call Clarence Herz at 701-799-4081. We need hands.

Second, the online campaign covers what we need for the basic repairs on the barn, but there are other repairs to cover, too. There is foundation work we really should do on the barn, and we're short on funds to cover that. Moreover, our partner on site, Pioneer Heritage Inc., needs money for materials to repair other buildings, such as the summer kitchen, and so what we don't need for barn work will be welcome for other use.

Summing up, then: additional contributions sought and welcomed! And all funds will be put to direct use overcoming issues of deferred maintenance to prepare the site for the assumption of management by the State Historical Society of North Dakota in summer 2015.

---------------------------------------

The Ludwig & Christina Welk Homestead is known to the world as the birthplace and boyhood home of Lawrence Welk, America's Music Maker. This farm site in Emmons County, North Dakota, is much more than that. It is the American homestead of two hard-working immigrant farmers, Ludwig and Christina Welk, parents of Lawrence. It is a place for the celebration of pioneer family farming, as well as the rich heritage of the Germans from Russia, North Dakota's largest ethnocultural group.

The legislature of North Dakota has appropriated funds to purchase the homestead. The State Historical Society of North Dakota has agreed to make it a state historic site. All this is contingent, however, on certain repairs being made to buildings on site, especially the barn, which has been deemed unsafe. "Proving Up the Welk Homestead" is the campaign to fund the repairs, as required by the state historical society and as specified by our consulting engineers from KLJ.

In the days of the Homestead Act, settlers had to "prove" up their claims by building a home and making improvements. Today, in the process of making a state historic site, we are proving up the Welk Homestead once again.

Who Is Doing This?

In the old days, neighbors came together in old-fashioned barn-raisings. Neighbors are coming together again to rehabilitate the barn and buildings on the Welk Homestead. The centerpiece of the homestead is the residence, built in the old-country style of earthen brick, subsequently expanded and sided to accommodate the growing Welk family. The house and most of the outbuildings require only minor and cosmetic repairs. The barn, however, needs major work to make it safe.

The site is owned by a local nonprofit, Pioneer Heritage Inc., which includes Welk family members. Assisting with the reorganization and transfer to the state historical society is the Tri-County Tourism Alliance, an association of citizens from Emmons, Logan, and McIntosh counties (German-Russian Country) that promotes grassroots heritage tourism. North Dakota State University, too--through NDSU Extension, the Germans from Russia Heritage Collection, and the Center for Heritage Renewal--has brought material aid to the cause. The CHR, specifically, has provided more than $2000 in materials and also significant volunteer person-power through service learning by NDSU students. They have brought the barn repairs to a level of 40% complete.

View the NDSU service learning expedition to Welk Homestead, April 2014, here - https://www.flickr.com/photos/german-russian/sets/72157645311907371/

What's Next?

The big push to repair the barn comes on August 1-3, 2014, as volunteers come together on site intending substantially to complete the barn repairs. At the same time, citizens from across the region will be invited to visit the site, see the work being done, join in, and take part in other celebratory activities. This will be promoted and publicized both within North Dakota and across the country, resulting in major positive publicity for the site, as well as the completing of important work.

The Need

We need money primarily for materials (mostly two-inch lumber), secondarily for equipment rental and volunteer expenses. Our target is $4000. We seek support in amounts from $100 up. All funds raised will be received and disbursed by the Tri-County Tourism Alliance, a 501c3 nonprofit, solely for work on the Welk Homestead buildings. The TCTA will issue each donor a receipt for tax purposes.

Help us with this good work! If you are a farmer, or a German from Russia, show your pride in heritage by donating to this project. If you care about the wellbeing of central North Dakota and want to promote it through grassroots heritage tourism, lend your support. Or perhaps you just care about our heritage here in North Dakota and want to show it in a tangible way.

Make your donation now. Make a donation of $100, and receive Lawrence Welk 1930, a signed & numbered offset lithograph by artist Gary P. Miller, depicting Lawrence Welk coming home to the Welk Homestead in his new 1930 Cord automobile. Make a donation of $500, and receive the same litho, mailed flat on a mat, ready for framing. View print here - http://heritagerenewal.org/docs/WelkPerk.pdf

The Impact

Envision the results of your support: the first state historic site ever dedicated to the commemoration of homesteading and pioneer farming; the first state historic site ever devoted to the cultural heritage of the Germans from Russia; a major boost to grassroots heritage tourism on the northern plains. We can make this happen.

story:
About the authors and this project!

We're sisters-in-law Ellie and Sabrina Bedford, and we've teamed up to create a fully illustrated children's raw vegan cookbook! Ellie is a home educating mum of two little girls, a whole-food consultant and food blogger in Oxfordshire, England. Sabrina is a recent college grad, aspiring illustrator and visual artist working in California.

This project came about for a couple of reasons. Ellie really wanted to buy a healthy children's cookbook for her children, as they love being in the kitchen as much as she. After searching high and low, all she could find for children were cookbooks full of sugary cakes and cookies! She was disappointed and decided it was time for somebody to fill that gap in the market, to create a plant-based book that included fresh fruits and veggies and that was free of refined sugars, but was still interesting to kids.

After pitching the idea to Sabrina, Ellie's little sis-in-law got to work immediately. Her watercolor illustrations emphasize depth, detail, and diversity. With Sabrina's artistic vision and skill we believe we have a book that children would want to own. Children love looking at the fanciful pages and families love the healthy results. Finally we have a book to rival all those princess cupcake books out there!

Where does my money go?

To complete the project, we have a goal of $8,000. Your support will go directly to completing, printing, and distributing this book. For your support, you'll receive a gift from us ranging from a postcard to being on or in the book itself. You'll also receive our gratitude and personal thanks for making this project a reality. Without your support, big or small, this cookbook won't make it to the kitchens!

Why should I support?

This recipe book was created to be easily incorporated into anyone's diet. It's a book of recipes full of fresh fruits and veggies that avoid refined flours and sugars, gluten, and animal products. We are out to prove that healthy foods can also be delicious and beautiful!

We know how hard it can be to include fresh foods in children's diets and hope that by presenting them in a fun and vibrant way, we can make it easy. For this reason, the recipes in How to Eat a Rainbow are taken from the most difficult dietary areas: treats, snacks, and drinks. We've targeted these areas to help kids avoid the sugary, highly processed foods and to get more nutritional value with every tasty bite.  Eaten alongside a balanced whole foods diet, these recipes can add an extra boost of energy and get kids excited about healthy eating.

What else can I do?

Any donations are valued and are critical to the success of this book, but we don't just need money! Sharing, posting, and talking about this campaign with your family, friends, and anyone you know will help this project reach its goal and get more folks enjoying healthy, raw, and vegan foods. 

When will I get a book?

Books will be delivered about three months after the campaign!

disappointed and decided it was time for somebody to fill that gap in the
market, to create a plant-based book that included fresh fruits and
veggies and that was free of refined sugars, but
was still interesting to kids.

After pitching the idea to Sabrina, Ellie's little sis-in-law got to work
immediately. Her watercolor illustrations emphasize depth, detail, and diversity. With Sabrina's
artistic vision and skill we believe we have a book that children would want to
own. Children love looking at the fanciful pages and families love the healthy
results. Finally we have a book to rival all those princess cupcake books out
there!



Where does my money go?
To complete the project, we have a
goal of $8,000. Your support will go directly to completing, printing, and
distributing this book. For your
support, you'll receive a gift from us ranging from a postcard to being on or in the book itself. You'll also receive our gratitude
and personal thanks for making this project a reality. Without your
support, big or small, this cookbook won't make it to the kitchens!




Why should I support?
This recipe book was created to be
easily incorporated into anyone's diet. It's a book of recipes full of fresh fruits and veggies that avoid
refined flours and sugars, gluten, and animal products. We are out to prove that healthy foods can also be delicious and
beautiful!






We know how hard it can be to include
fresh foods in children's diets and hope that by presenting them in a fun and vibrant
way, we can make it easy. For this reason, the recipes in How to Eat a
Rainbow are taken from the most difficult dietary areas: treats,
snacks, and drinks. We've targeted these areas to help kids avoid
the sugary, highly processed foods and to get more nutritional value with every
tasty bite.  Eaten alongside a balanced whole foods diet, these recipes can
add an extra boost of energy and get kids excited about healthy eating.
What else can I do?
Any donations are valued and are critical to
the success of this book, but we don't just need
money! Sharing, posting, and talking about this campaign with your family,
friends, and anyone you know will help this project reach its goal and get more
folks enjoying healthy, raw, and vegan foods. 
When will I get a book?
Books will be delivered about three months after the campaign!

story:
Who am I?

Hello, 

My names is James Wier. I am currently a Pennsylvania College Student. I have recently seen the cold water challenge on Facebook and it hurts me. It hurts me to see a generation opting out of charitable donation. This is to change our course of thought. Please help a society in need. 

What We Can Do

I want to raise $1,000 for ALS to show that opting out of donation is the exact opposite of what we want to do. The money will be donated direct to the ALS association on behalf of all contributors. These issues need help and we as an online community can help them. I simply need as much as you can give. Whatever you want $1.00 from 1,000 people can help an organization in need. I need you.

    The Impact

    The impact is this. You gave to give. You impacted the lives of those suffering from ALS and therefore bettered yourselves. I will also publish all names of any donators at all in any release I create for this. Please just help. 

      Risks & Challenges

      If we don't reach our goal, no money is given. We need to challenge ourselves and our society to give and not avoid for fun and foolishness.

      Other Ways You Can Help

      SPREAD THE WORD! Get this out there. If we do not spread the word, nobody will know. We need people to give so therefore we need to share to everyone we can. 

        And that's all there is to it.

story:
Featured:

On Nov. 5th, 2014 CTA  was one of two Community Impact Awards winners recognized by Silicon Valley Business Journal:  http://www.bizjournals.com/sanjose/news/2014/11/07/ending-homelessness-through-tech.html

Our Mission:

CTA harnesses technology to empower communities to develop data-driven solutions to poverty and homelessness.

What We Do:

Community Technology Alliance (CTA) is an award winning Silicon Valley nonprofit creating 21st Century solutions to poverty and homelessness by providing technology as well as technical training and support to nonprofits, public agencies and community organizations. CTA’s technology tools and services help our partners save time and money that is redirected into providing housing and stabilization services to people in need. CTA builds the capacity of human services agencies to engage in data-driven strategic planning and measure their collective impact.

CTA's Impact: 

Thanks to CTA's broad network of partners and our innovative ways of leveraging resources, every dollar donated to CTA results in $50 worth of services and support to people who are homeless or at-risk of becoming homeless.

Your donations

HELP PEOPLE

  • Discounts negotiated by CTA save our partners $120,229 per year in software costs--enough to allow them to provide supportive services, like housing and job search assistance or connections to healthcare providers, to an additional 40 clients per month for a year.
  • 530 chronically homeless people have moved into permanent housing as a result of CTA’s data reporting and analysis.
  • 78,745 homeless and extremely low-income families and individuals received better-coordinated care last year as a result of CTA’s involvement in the community.

HELP NONPROFITS

  • CTA’s partners were able to redirect 5,961 hours of staff time to serving their clients thanks to technology tools that improve efficiency in service delivery.
  • CTA’s database services allowed our partners to secure more than$81,266,997 in Federal funding last year to provide 20,515 units of shelter and housing, including housing for 1,996 veteran households.
  • 155 nonprofits and public agencies in California and Pennsylvania provide more efficient and effective care because of CTA.

HELP COMMUNITIES

  • CTA’s data analysis saved Santa Clara and Santa Cruz Counties $6,890,000 in taxpayer revenue by identifying and prioritizing high-cost chronically homeless people for access to permanent supportive housing. Providing housing to chronically homeless people has been demonstrated to save communities more than $13,000 PER PERSON PER YEAR.

Together, we will end homelessness!

What We Need and Why:

Warren has lived in San Jose for fifteen years, and spent thirteen of those years without a home. When sleeping on the streets, he says “all you can do is say a prayer and persevere.” CTA uses data collected in HMIS to help our partners prioritize sick and vulnerable individuals, like Warren, for access to housing and other resources. CTA is proud to report that as a result of our data analysis that moved him to the top of the priority list, Warren has been housed for 2 years and has been able to take positive steps towards improving his health and well-being.

CTA’s mission is to harness technologies to empower communities to develop data-driven solutions to poverty and homelessness for people like Warren. In 2013, 78,745 men, women, and children visited one of CTA’s partners seeking shelter, food, clothing, healthcare or employment support. We know the exact count because CTA helps communities administer their Homeless Management Information System (HMIS), a shared client database that is used to connect homeless and extremely low-income households to resources to find sustainable jobs, feed their families, and move into stable and secure homes. Data collected in HMIS is also used by communities to develop data-driven strategies for improving services as we work toward an end to homelessness and poverty.

What you get:

  • $20 Smile! You helped a homeless family get connected to stabilization services.
  • $50 Cheer! You helped cut the length of time a single mom had to wait in line to get food for her kids.
  • $150 Celebrate! You helped a nonprofit Program Manager evaluate outcomes and improve service delivery.
  • $500 Rock on! You helped a local nonprofit qualify for a new grant to increase the supply of supportive housing in the community.
  • $2500 Stand up and be recognized! You helped CTA empower communities to develop data-driven solutions to poverty and homelessness.

Risks & Challenges

CTA’s work is largely driven by the U.S. Department of Housing and Urban Development (HUD). In recent years, HUD has issued a number of “unfunded mandates” to communities related to data collection and performance measurement. We are currently working with our partners to develop sustainable funding strategies to support these new efforts.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute financially, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Please share our campaign on Facebook and Twitter
  • Volunteer with CTA

THANK YOU!!! Together we will end homelessness!

story:
Hello, my name is Shae and a I’m a 26 year old living in Atlanta, though I’m originally from all over asI’m a military brat. One of the things that I like most about the city of Atlanta is the culture; it is full of people of all kinds from all walks of life. As a nerd, living somewhere where I am able to find places toplay tabletop RPG’s, Warhammer 40,000, Magic the Gathering and the like is a godsend. But in order to continue to do the things that I love in the city I love, I must remain free, without the constant fear of at a moment’s notice being carted off to jail because of a series of unfortunate events.

          I've found myself in a situation where I am unable to pay the fines that have snowballed from the original broken head light incident, and this has resulted in a bench warrant for my arrest. The bench warrant makes it near impossible for me to find work in order to pay off the fines, leaving my only real remaining option as serving jail time.

           

         This is why I need your help. I have always attempted to live my life by the “Do unto others. . .” motto and I am reaching out now in the hopes that others who believe similarly might be willing to offer me a bit of kindness in my time of need. I need to raise $4000 dollars for the payment of legal fines, taxes, and of course a shiny new working headlight to replace the one that got me in all this trouble in the first place. Even if I don’t manage to make the entire goal, what I do get will go towards legal counsel to possibly reduce the amount of time I would have to spend in jail.

        While we have seen many campaigns like this one on indiegogo my hope is that this is one of the ones that stands out for the amount of time and effort put into it. Furthermore any extra money will not just go to waste, but be used in future Dudes Saving Dudes projects, paying it forward and spreading goodwill one dude in need at a time.

         We know that monetarily supporting this project isn’t for everyone and that’s ok! Spreading the word is a great way to support the project so liking or sharing this on Facebook, Tumblr, or Twitter as dudessavingdudes is greatly appreciated! Thank you for all your support!

-Shae

 

P.S. here is a sample of the type of song that you will recieve as part of our perks. Thanks again!

story:
Short Summary

DeKalb County Community Gardens, in partnership with the Live Healthy DeKalb County  Initiative, has been building raised-bed gardens for local use since spring last year. Last growing season we raised and donated to local food pantries and community meal centers over 1.5 tons of food. Our county has 1 in 5 children living with food insecurity. This year we are expanding our organic gardens to a total of 35 different sites, and nearly 10 acres of growing space, we hope to close the food gap and prevent food deserts in all of DeKalb County Illinois. 

What We Need

Materials to make 20 or more raised-bed gardens ($75 each) These gardens will be located at the Annie Glidden DeKalb County Outreach Campus in DeKalb County Illinois. These gardens will provide an intergenerational and inter-cultural opportunity. The campus gardens will benefit WIC Program participants, senior citizens living independently as well as nursing home residents. Also nearby residents who are part of a residential center will be able to help grow and share in the vegetables.

Your donations will help us create these gardens for the community in order to give people free access to organic produce.

The Impact

Our raised bed gardens are maintained by volunteers in the community and produce not taken by community members is donated to local food pantries.  Just last year, we donated over two thousand pounds of produce.

For more info, please check out our site: http://dekalbgardens.org/

Other Ways You Can Help

Please spread this page to anyone you know who may be interested. Also visit our Face Book page.

We will also be having a volunteer days for anyone in the area who would like to help: http://www.signupgenius.com/go/60B0A45A5A828A20...

story:
I'm 30, baby! Help me celebrate!

It's true. I turn(ed) 30 on January 6, 2013 and I couldn't be more pumped up about my thirties! Twenties--it's been real. Thirties--let's do this thing! Bring it on!

I don't really want or need gifts for my big 3-0. I've been blessed with plenty of awesomeness in my life already. So instead of throwing a big party, I decided to commemorate my 30 years on this planet by raising some dough for fabulous nonprofit. It's the best gift I could think of getting.

I'm involved in lots of community things, as ya'll know, and one that I am super proud of and excited about is being a founding board member and volunteer staff for Connect & Breathe. Connect & Breathe is a ground-breaking and taboo-breaking nonjudgmental after-abortion talkline based out of the Rochester area and serving the entire U.S. Our vision is to live in a world where the shame and stigma of abortion is lifted and every person's experience with abortion is treated with dignity and respect. 

Will you make a gift to Connect and Breathe in my honor today? Every gift helps us do amazing work.

What is Connect & Breathe?

Connect & Breathe is a nonjudgmental after-abortion talkline inspired by the work of a similar organization on the West Coast, Exhale, and by the need for UNbiased after-abortion services. There are hundreds of so-called crisis pregancy centers and hotlines and programs for women who have had abortions that are funded by conservative religious groups. Connect & Breathe is one of just a handful of organizations in the U.S. that truly offer unbiased after-abortion care. We are neither pro-choice or pro-life and we affirm people of all (or no) religious backgrounds. We believe abortion is a personal experience that needs to be lifted out of the political and talked about as a real, human experience.

1 in 3 women in the U.S. will have an abortion by the age of 45, yet no one talks about it. We aim to break this silence and give all people a safe, supportive, and confidential place to talk frankly about abortion.

Since our phones went live in 2011, we've taken over 400 calls from all over the U.S. (and a handful from abroad), which are answered by one of the 30 volunteers we have trained over the past 2 years. We talk to callers who mainly feel relief, who are deeply greived, who had an abortion days ago and who had an abortion years ago. What we offer is a listening and supportive ear that will not judge or condescend, a friendly voice that will affirm each experience and emotion as valid and important.

Why Connect & Breathe?

As a small non-profit, just rounding out our second year, we are in a critical time for the success of a nonprofit org. We are very lean--all volunteer staff and board. We depend entirely on grants and individual donations to keep our little operation moving and growing. We use our resources wisely and we are doing incredibly powerful work on a shoestring budget. A generous gift in any amount will be put to great use. Our primary expenses are:

  • Printing and distribution of marketing materials to health providers and community orgs across the U.S., which we currently provide free-of-cost to abortion providers,
  • Training costs for the 30-hour training we provide twice a year for talkline volunteers.
  • Exhibition costs at reproductive health conferences across the U.S. to get the word out to providers about our services, and
  • Talkline and office expenses--the nitty gritty stuff like phones, letterhead, and other operational costs..

It's been a blessed experience being on the frontlines of this organization, seeing it move from an inspired idea to an incorporated nonprofit organization to a growing and successful talkline. We rely on individual donations to keep our phones on and to expand our reach.

Connect & Breathe sounds awesome! How else can I help?

Become a talkline volunteer

We have a training coming up in April for new talkline volunteers. It is a rigorous training and experience, but you don't need any special degree or background to help. Our training is designed to help you do some deep self-learning and self-care around abortion that will prepare you for the volunteer role and help you figure out if it is a good fit for your skill set. If you are interested, give me a shout at kaelyn@connectandbreathe.org. Yep, I'm the volunteer manager, too. We really are all volunteer. That's how we roll!

Donate your skills

If you want to donate other skills you may have such as web design or fundraising skills, we'd love to talk more about that, too!

Apply to join the board of directors

We are also currently seeking new board members to join our very kitchen-table-grassroots and small board. You can get in touch with me at kaelyn@connectandbreathe.org if this sounds like your jam.

Host a fundraiser or share this indiegogo campaign with your friends

Help us keep doing amazing work for years to come! Host a house party or personal fundraiser. Ask your friends to contribute to this campaign.

I want to learn more!

  • Check us out at www.connectandbreathe.org
  • Like us on Facebook at www.facebook.com/connectandbreathe.
  • Email us at info@connectandbreathe.org
  • Just ask me! I would love to talk to you about our work!

We are also currently seeking new board members to join our very kitchen-table-grassroots and small board. You can get in touch with me at kaelyn@connectandbreathe.org if this sounds like your jam.
Host a fundraiser or share this indiegogo campaign with your friends
Help us keep doing amazing work for years to come! Host a house party or personal fundraiser. Ask your friends to contribute to this campaign.
I want to learn more!

Check us out at www.connectandbreathe.org

Like us on Facebook at www.facebook.com/connectandbreathe.
Email us at info@connectandbreathe.org

Just ask me! I would love to talk to you about our work!

story:
Our Mission

The mission of the Gye Nyame (pronounced jean-yuh-me) Empowerment Project (GNEP) is dedicated to the education and advancement of people of Pan-African descent, and the development of the neighborhoods and communities they reside in through conferences, workshops and other social and educational mediums. Our vision is to provide a supportive network and forum that empowers the individual, the family and the community to meet their full potential. 


We believe that if you empower an individual, you inspire the family. If you inspire the family, you uplift communities. If you uplift communities, you alter the worlds view on humanity.


Our Story

On March 31, 2012, GNEP looks forward to its 5th annual "Sista-2-Sista Youth Summit," a one-day summit that empowers 125 young high school women of color from New York City to tap into their full potential by letting go of their stories of the past and embracing NOW.  The summit will engage the participants in panel discussions, workshops, live entertainment, and reflective activities. 

This year's theme is Unraveling Stories, Creating New Possibilities.  GNEP believes that everyone has a story about their past; however it is the interpretation of these stories that often stops people from tapping into their full potential or giving 100% of themselves in any given situation.  We will aid the young women in overcoming some barriers of the past, and in creating new and empowering stories about their present and their future.   


The Impact

Through mentorship programs and annual youth summits, GNEP utilizes a three step process of self awareness, self appreciation and self actualization that empowers youth to make well informed decisions about NOW and their futures. 


Upon completion of the Summit, the participants will be provided with access to resources in the areas of personal and professional development; will be affirmed that they can be whatever they choose to be; will continue to foster an appreciation for sisterhood; will develop skills to think critically and engage in healthy debate while unraveling the stories from the past that hinder them from reaching their full potential; and they will be inspired to take action in the areas of their life that matter most.


What We Need & What You Get

We are seeking donations to support the costs of the summit which include: the venue, food, entertainment, resource directory and workshop materials.  

Every dollar helps!!!! You can contribute to one of 2 of our fundraising efforts: 

The Two Approaches... 

1,000 Strong - Be one of the 1,000 people to donate $6 each! 

or 

Sponsor a Student - and donate $80.67! This will cover the cost of 1 student to participate in the Summit. For those that sponsor a student, you will receive a personal thank you card from a participant. 
(If you have a particular child that you want to sponsor, please include their name, contact information and grade in high school when you make your donation, and be sure to provide an accurate mailing address). 

"As people let their own light shine, they unconsciously give others permission to do the same" -Marianne Williamson 

Any donation is a powerful donation, all money raised will help make this possible for not only us, but the young women that we look forward to empowering and giving permission to shine! 

Other Ways You Can Help

We ask that you do not overlook the power of your voice, it is priceless. Please help us empower the next generation and spread the word about what we are up to.  You can also share your story by contributing to our Unraveling Stories Video Viral Campaign. 


Thank you!

story:
Supporting Sculling in the United States any amount is welcome!

My name is Xeno Müller, Olympic gold and silver medalist single scull.

Hello and thank you for taking the time to consider this fundraiser.

With your help we can assist scullers from the United States win Olympic medals, support current national team scullers, up and coming scullers and their coaches achieve sculling excellence.

Which scullers will get coaching support: Current national team rowers, juniors and elite. Scullers who have ranked in the top 5 at the US national Championships and have finished within the top 5% of the fastest finishing time at head races such as the Head of the Charles, the Head of the Schuykill, and the Head of the Hooch.


I will maintain a list on my website of the coaching beneficiaries and a short story about their goal.

When you follow the link below I explain how my coaching is done:

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Sqk9jqCTBzQ&feature=relmfu

Follow this link and you will be able to relive my Olympic gold medal race:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=wViOIIh7pUU

Thank you for supporting scullers in the United States.

Sincerely,

Xeno Müller

www.xenorowingcoach.com

story:
The Cupcake Delight Beginnings

  My name is Peggy Headings and I grew up in the state of Maine where food was everywhere. Homemade cakes, cookies, donuts, whoopie pies, breads, cupcakes ect.. When I was a child my mom would make chocolate whoopie pies and my cousin would always get the first one and you got it... it was still hot! It will melt and make a mess but she loved it every time. One of my all time favorites are chocolate cake with peanut butter frosting!  Every child should be able to enjoy great tasting desserts and I want to provide them!

   I wanted to find a way to open up a bakery years ago but we couldn't due to having to look after our children and one with a disability called Dystonia. We went through a long 14 years of hoping and praying for our son to get better. Traveled 5 hours to Little Rock for tests and more tests til they found out what my son had. Then two years ago we heard about DBS surgery. I remember how terrified I was to see the day that my son would get his head drilled into. But Thank God, It's over and he now can walk around like you and I!

  Now it's a new beginning. A new beginning starting with my long ago dream taking flight!  I developed a love for baking from a young age and went to Reign 3 in high school for baking and I have worked at Wal-marts bakeries. I have decorated Wedding cakes, Anniversary Cakes, Birthday Cakes, cupcakes and all kinds of different desserts and breads for years in my own home. Many people have asked me if I made cakes to sell when they see my creations. 

  I want to create some Gluten Free product as well as diabetic products along with the regular desserts. How about stopping in for a nice, big cinnamon roll! Yummy!  I believe all people should be able to enjoy a good dessert. It should also be available to the diabetics and those allergic to gluten!  I hear it often.. A lady with a small child has come by the bakery where I worked and the child asked, "Mommy, can we have one please?" and the mom said, "No, you we can't have any of those desserts because it isn't gluten free." 

  Opening up a Bakery has been a life long dream. A dream that can come true with your help. I want to create a better place for our children and our community. We may be making this a Bakery/pizza shop for all to enjoy. What child doesn't like pizza? Pizza that you can buy hot or ready to take home and bake in your own oven. 

 I also want to add different fun things to do for the children in our community. Let's play some Trivia children! They will win a delicious dessert for their reward!  Let's not forget our Police Officers and Fire Fighters. They will be able to come in once a week for a FREE coffee and dessert! What a bunch of yummy treats that will be available when we open our Bakery to our community!

Our Mission

 Provide the best baked goods for our customers, connect communities to the source of their food and provide children a safe place to socialize, and offer delicious, honest food in a casual setting. 

What is Cupcake Delight?

Cupcake Delight is what we like to call a cupcake house. Lots of cupcakes and breads  to enjoy and sit and have a cup of coffee, hot chocolate or soda. Our community needs a special place for our children to have a free cookie time and play some trivia to win a free cupcake or other delicious treat! We believe in getting children to interact together. Of course there will be breads of all shapes and sizes, but there will also be donuts, delicious pies, seasonal cakes, and drinks. The food will be served with soda, hot chocolate, or coffee, to enhance the atmosphere. And, like any bakery shop, you can also take just a single treat to go if you please.

Cupcake Delight will do for our bakery what a coffee does for coffee shop, a pizza does for a pizza place. We will offer a unique experience where cupcakes and delicious treats are enjoyed, discussed, and paired in an unpretentious casual setting. I will also be taking orders for cakes for your special occasion. 

Where We Are Now

  I have found a building that would work for our bakery! It is for sale and they are asking $96,000. I am hoping to get it for a cheaper price! I have done all the research required to get a permit to open a bakery and where to get all the ingredients and supplies I need to start up Cupcake Delight.  I have the knowledge I need to succeed and the desire to see it come alive to our community! I am excited to think what it can do for our Schools, Churches and our whole Community! Any product that is not sold will go to the local food banks or those in our community to help those in need. I want to make treat boxes to give to people also! I look forward to allot of fun stuff to do for everyone!

Where You Come In

 We could really use some help. I can't afford to purchase this building or get the equipment and supplies needed. What money I do receive will go for the bakery. If it is lower then what I need for this building I will find another building or use what monies we receive to build one or make a Bakery in our own home. I rechecked for prices and found Ebay was cheapest way to purchase.

Things we will need:

1. Building- (with windows to display items in front) $96,000. (There is pictures of the building in the gallery)

2.Display cases (approximately $2,581.55- $3,500.00  each, need at least 4) – glass-faced refrigeration to display the goods.

3. Walk in Refrigerator cooler - $$6,500.00

4. Walk in Commerial Freezer $25,000

5. Bakers Pride Double Deck Electric Convection oven- $5,152.73-$9,950.00 (New)

6. 40 Qt. Floor Mixer- $5,895.00-$7,500.00 (new)

7. Money for ingredients and supplies- $6,800.00

8. Stainless steel tables $600.00(new or will buy used)

9.Full Donut fryer setup - $4,500.00-$10,500.00 (for fryer, depending whats available when purchased, Free Shipping) Glazer - $500.00 (plus shipping)

10. Work that needs to be done on the building inside and out. ($6,201.00-$10,250.00)

  Any and all left over money would go for the starting up of the bakery and for our community. I am and have been excited about opening up this bakery in our town for a long time. We do not have a bakery like the bakery I imagine for our community! It will be enjoyable and fun for everyone! And with your help this dream can become a REALITY! Thank you so much for your support! It means EVERYTHING for this Bakery and our Communities children! God Bless you!

You may not be able to contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Ask other people you know to get the word out about my campaign.
  • You can  use the Indiegogo share tools to help me get word out!

story:
We did it!

We're back in the UK in one piece and are happy to report that we both completed the race.  Simon's time was a far more respectable 3:51 to my slow 5:20, but we both left everything on the mountain and were pleased with our respective times given the tough conditions.  We're really grateful for all the kind sponsorship to date - thank you.

Liz (15th March)

--------------------------------------------------------------

The Challenge

On 2nd March 2014, we will be attempting to run the Kilimanjaro marathon in order to raise funds for a cause we both really care about and have seen the importance of first hand.  LEMU (The Land and Equity Movement for Uganda) is a grass roots NGO dedicated to alleviating poverty through the protection of land rights for some of Uganda's most vulnerable people.  A large part of LEMU's work is in offering legal support and dispute resolution for people with land rights disputes, ranging from appropriate protection of women's rights, to combatting organised land grabbing. There is more on LEMU on their website (linked below), but in brief, Liz spent time working with LEMU on our last east Africa trip, and has stayed in touch with their excellent work ever since.

The run itself is going to be a real challenge for us both, and we've been training hard for the past few months.  The marathon starts from Moshi, northern Tanzania and tackles some of the lower slopes of the mountain itself. Simon is hoping to be celebrating his birthday (race day!) with a respectable time given the equatorial conditions, whilst Liz is focusing on getting over the line in one piece.

What we are asking for

We are, of course funding the trip to Tanzania ourselves.  However, we are keen to raise as much as possible to help to keep LEMU's staff on the ground, doing what they do best.  Finding funds to continue the work that the team does can be really difficult. Anything that we raise will go towards funding this vital work.

We will 'close' the campaign on 16th March, two weeks after the race - so if you want to wait and see how we get on before deciding to sponsor us, please check back here for an update!

For more information

Please get in touch with us if there's anything further you'd like to know.  

LEMU's website is: http://land-in-uganda.org/

^ Summer training in Morocco

story:
The team

EUETIB e-Tech Racing is a team consisting of 34 mechanical, electronics and electrical engineering students of the Universitat Politècnica de Catalunya (Barcelona-Tech).

What we seek

Our aim is to participate in the Formula Student Spain competition, which will take place at the end of August 2014, with the design and construction of an electrically powered single-seater.

The objective of this crowdfunding is to raise funds so that we can make this project come true and build a Formula Student car in order to take part in this event for the first time. Currently, we are enrolled in the competition and we have already finished the designing stage, so the collected funds would be used to deal with the construction costs and the acquisition of essential components such as the motors or batteries.

The impact

This project is likely to have a big impact on the students, which will evolve as engineers, and it could even imply a boost in the development of the automotive scenario in a long term.

You can help

Everybody that shares our page will be contributing indirectly and that is also a great help for the team. Thanks!

story:
My story is that we were going to have an Indigogo campaign and changed our mind.  They wouldn't let us take it down.  Please don't contribute anything further.  We will refund those who already have.

Be very careful when dealing with IndiGogo.  There's a lot to the fine print and these are NOT very nice people.  They are mostly about their 9% cut.


We tried to cancel our campaign, note the OUR in there, and found out to our amazement that we have no control over it at all.  It is THEIR campaign - not ours.  They can do as they like with it and we have no say so in it at all.


Be wary of this ongoing Internet scam.

story:
Hello All!

My name is Ryan Green and I am a sophomore at the University of Washington. This summer I have the opportunity of a lifetime, but I need your help to be able to participate. At my university, I am a member of the fraternity Pi Kappa Phi. One of the main reasons that I decided to join Pi Kappa Phi was the opportunity as a member to participate in a cross-country bicycle ride put on by Pi Kappa Phi’s national philanthropy, Push America. Push America is a non-profit organization that works towards bettering the lives of people with mental and physical disabilities through their three main areas of focus: disability awareness, volunteerism, and fundraising. I am here to help my fundraising efforts for the trip, but let me tell you about the trip itself first so you have a better idea of why I need your help.

So here’s how the Journey of Hope works. There are three different routes, the North Route, the Trans American Route, and the South Route. I have been given the privilege to ride on the South Route this summer, starting from Long Beach, California and ending in Washington D.C. two months later. Each route varies in length by a few days, but we will all complete this journey together on the same day, arriving on the Capitol lawn simultaneously.

The Journey of Hope is about much more than the cycling. In each city that we stop at along the way, we will participate in events called friendship visits, where we will spend time with people with all kinds of disabilities. These events include things like dances, baseball, wheelchair basketball, and many more things. All of these events have an overall goal, and that is to bring joy and smiles to the people that we will be interacting with, while teaching people to live practicing empathy rather than sympathy. These towns wait for us all year to arrive and I want to help deliver the joy and experience that they have been waiting for since last summer.

Friendship visits are the way the Journey of Hope teams will demonstrate Push Americas ideals of volunteerism and disability awareness. We deliver volunteerism by taking out time to spend time with these people across the nation that have been waiting all year for our arrival. Disability awareness also is displayed here because the teams and the community learn to practice empathy rather than sympathy.

Now this is why I have come to you for help. The last area of focus for Push America is fundraising. In order for each rider to participate in the Journey of Hope, he must raise a minimum of $5,500 for Push America. The money that is raised is then distributed by Push America to local organizations across the United States that work for helping better the lives of people with mental and physical disabilities. I have currently raised just over $3,000 with the fundraising deadline approaching just a couple of months away. Your contribution could be the deciding factor that will allow me to participate in this once in a lifetime opportunity. Even if you are unable to donate, even sharing this page to help spread the word about me and my efforts is something that I will be eternally thankful for.

Here is my promise to you if you chose to support me. I promise that I will expel all of my efforts throughout the entire summer. I will always put my heart into both the cycling and the time that I will spend bettering the lives of people across the country. I will make this summer the best experience for the people that I meet because this summer is not about me, it is about the people that we interact with and the happiness and service that we will bring to them.

If you would like to learn more about Push America, you can visit their website at pushamerica.org.

Thank you for your help and support.

Ryan Green

story:
Empower women to change their world through water

Help give women the knowledge they need to succeed and a voice within their community, making them significant players in the creation of their visions, not simply the objects of development.                    

 

In just one day over 200 million work hours are consumed by the collection of water, a burden mainly carried by women and girls.

Every one of these hours means one less hour working a job, attending school, or caring for family. Millions of women are prohibited from accomplishing anything more than survival.

Our Goal

We are part of a team of people all working together to have an impact on the community & women of Kamrongo Kenya. Our role is to document the creation of the water kiosk, raise funding for the training of 22 women to operate the kiosk, and put together three videos from footage we collect on the journey. We our not doing this alone, and are working with a collective of professionals in this field to ensure its success.

The Kiosk & Training Impact

Upon the completion of the water kiosk,  2,700 people will have access to clean, inexpensive water and the ability to grow their own food gardens year round. Water kiosks are booths that sell inexpensive tap water to the community. The kiosk will keep the price of water down, free up hours of time for the women in the community, and create a business that can support itself with a long term goal of producing more kiosks.

22 women will have the opportunity to become catalysts of change within their own community.  They will receive program training that serves three purposes: reducing the rate of disease in the community, improving the financial sustainability of the water kiosks, and training the women in how to conduct grass roots outreach and marketing. 

After the training, these women will be the ones who operate and run the kiosk. Leaving it self sufficient with room for growth for years to come.

Our fundraiser is piggybacking on Mama Maji, the non-profit who is actually making the water kiosk happen. They have already been a part of one successful kiosk in this area of Kenya and have all the resources already to make this one a success too.

 For more information on the project and Mama Maji please visit:

www.mamamaji.org

 


The Cost

We are fund raising for $5000. That covers travel and provides enough money to train 22 women to operate and maintain the kiosk once it's complete. Any additional funding will go directly to Mama Maji to help cover the water kiosk construction costs.

Once there we will share room and food in the remote village of, Kamrongo, where the kiosk will be made. We are bringing our own gear to document the experience and will edit it ourselves once home in New Orleans.


Who We Are:

We are two people, Colleen and Sean, who currently live together in  New Orleans. Sean works on feature films & commercials, and Colleen works full time at a local night time art market as well as part time with Mama Maji. Together we have years of experience in the commercial market and have crafted many stories. Since arriving in New Orleans we have begun crafting stories of a different nature, stories that matter and serve a larger purpose than simply making a profit.

With are newfound passion for video and the ambition to do something that matters, we plan to mesh both together by traveling to Kenya with Mama Maji. Our goal is to document the creation of a water kiosk, the culture, and most importantly the untold stories of the women in the  small community of Kamrongo, Kenya.


What is our project?

While Mama Maji is working on funding for the creation of the water kiosk, we are working on funding for the training of the women, and the launching of our career paths. The current goal of this project is for August, 2014. 

We plan on creating 3 videos from this trip:

 - 1st. We'll document the water kiosk construction for the non-profit Mama Maji then produce a promo video for them. They have assisted in the creation of a water kiosk before, but never have had anyone along the journey to share the story before. 

 - 2nd. We will also gather media for a piece about the experience, the people, the land, the culture.  Sewing it all together to make a slice of life piece from the month of exploring.

 - 3rd. Will be a piece Colleen is spearheading involving women retelling the story of women from all over the world. This will be a long-term project, but the chance to add footage to it from this experience will be priceless.

We will joyfully be able to put our combined background in commercial and narrative video to good use, as well our audio and camera gear.

*** All we need is airfare there and back, and the rest is taken care of.

In Short:

We need YOUR help. A little bit goes a long way. Please donate what you can and share with those you think would be interested.

Your donations will directly benefit:

To support Mama Maji's success in future fundraising for water projects. A good video showing what your non-profit does helps raise funding significantly. 

The training of 22 women to run, operate, and maintain the water kiosk for their community. And this is just the beginning . . . . Imagine what can happen if hundreds of women have more time, support, and resources to build their dreams. Empower a women and you empower the community. 

Also you are helping us reach our goals of working in a career that positively gives back to the world around us. After this trip, our credentials and hands on experience will give us a jump start into our career journey.



Water is a women’s issue.

We believe that through connecting women in a common effort of change, addressing the biggest challenge to women globally, we can shift the world.

So long as there are women whose lives and voices are limited by their circumstances, no woman can remain silent.

And water is the first step.  - Mama Maji


 We understand if you can't help fund this campaign. Please consider passing it on to others you think may be interested in helping.

We appreciate all your support, and want to say THANK YOU! - Colleen Rowley & Sean O'Grady

story:
Understanding The Basics

TheUnJunk.com is an ambitious website project that wants to break the modern Print/TV and Online barriers. The modern media is awesome, always sprinting for the breaking stuff, and this really helps us (the general population) all around the globe to sit back and think/curse/criticise/follow the trends. However, if Television is great, the web is a step ahead. The www is the driving force for almost all of us and more than the logical information, it’s the ‘Staying Connected’ phenomenon we value the most. The basics for Television revolve around TRP/RATINGS and to achieve this, our standard TV shows, dramas, talent shows, reality shows and even the NEWS follow norms, we find hard to accept. We mean, how many times have you sat down thinking, this isn’t the right way to do things, this isn’t what the news should be like and this isn’t reality, this is all made-up/scripted/untrue/JUNK. You’ll most certainly agree, the electronic stuff is highly monopolised.

The web has its own problems. We constantly read posts/blogs/comments or watch videos/photos that are legit, that are relevant, that are educational, and that are ignored and then banned/censored/removed. Politics, Humanity, Animal Cruelty, Truth, Discriminations against Women, Our Skin Colour, Our Religion, Our Sex or Our Castes are the most affected and targeted topics that most of the times are banned/censored or removed on the name of ‘nudity, hate, violence, spam and harm.’ With the TheUnJunk.com Project, we aspire to create one-of-a-kind worldwide community that is Funded by YOU, Sourced by YOU and even Run by YOU, where there’s no unnecessary restrictions on sharing your links, posts, videos and photos, where there’s no unnecessary bans, where we wish to serve the better web content to the likeminded people who support an open, unbiased web for all. We want to make this the largest crowd based media/social community that doesn’t follow the normal routine, where the modern JUNK that we all are served is UnJunked.


How, What & Why?

Undoubtedly, crowd funding is the smartest and the easiest way for a start-up with coherent ideas to move ahead and create trust from the very beginning. We not only want to create the biggest and the largest crowd run online community that supports truth with proper information flow, but more importantly, an impartial community that loves humanity on the whole. Yes, bans and censors are important, but you need to be fair.

We don’t say the world needs another social networking platform, but there’s always room for change and we want to change this with our own social community where everyone hears and everyone shares. We are the ones who make the news and it should be us who deliver them as it is, unbiased and straightforward. We are the ones who trend things and it would be awe-inspiring if we made them perfect. We all join forums, we comment, we spread the word, but we still have so many things we wish we could say/speak/write our own way. There is a strong need for an open/free web that breaks away from the obvious and isn’t chained by some modern world web villains.


    TheUnjunk.com brings 'I' back into the Internet

    Here's why it matters, why you need to support?

    Social Freedom & Equality: 

    We have followed some convincing stories on the web, which were later tagged unreasonable by social networking sites and taken down or the users were asked to remove them. The same goes for online pages and groups. We curiously monitored our bad habits to curse people on the basis of their race, caste, colour, country and sex and we realised, not all of us are the villains. We LOVE the world around us and the people living in that world. However, there are times when we think about expressing ourselves and suddenly pull the plug. We want to share so many things, but we don’t. This is because we fear of others. We are afraid of lame comments, judgements and remarks.

    There’s so much hatred and biasness that we simply drop the plan of expressing our hearts out. Thus, it is time we make a social community with less Hatred and more Love, where we actually appreciate each other.

    Open Web, Social Sharing and YOU: 

    Online businesses are failing and falling, thanks to the monopolisation policies, most of our social/online sharing services have adopted. We don’t need advertisements to promote our own stuff, but sadly, most of our social networking and sharing sites have restricted our online sharing abilities. Our blogs, posts, links and our content needs to go out in to the wild to reach new places and new people. We want to bring the social sharing and social publishing abilities back into the game. The success requires Crowd Funding, Crowd Sourcing and Crowd Support. We want everybody to take a collective, more responsible approach on sharing information on the web. It is already enough of the unnecesary celebrity gossip (they have their own life), enough of the moderated, paid news, enough of the modern online hatred and enough of the biased Junk.

    "We should only understand one definition for an OPEN WEB and that is to simply have an OPEN WEB, for everyone."

    Genuine, Verified People: 

    Fake People with Fake Profiles/Accounts are a serious matter. Nobody has actually managed to keep a check on these fake profiles/accounts. We want to do this the right way. If people are to truly connect with each other on similar grounds, there has to be trust and truthfulness. The TheUnjunk.com project wants to bring genuine people to join the community and just to celebrate this trust building switch, we will have Verified Accounts for all User Dashboards according to our work of field, which means, whether you are a student, banker, artist, journalist, writer, athlete, cook, speaker, innovator, traveller, maker, business owner, teacher or anything else, you’ll have a Verified Profile. Our social networking sites have made a joke out of these Verified Profiles for People & Pages.

    Human Help & Support Network: 

    Lastly, Teen Abuse, Bullying, Cyber Bullying and Exploitation are the biggest problems our teenagers are facing all around the globe. Such horrific incidents lead towards Humiliation, Loss of Self Respect and Loss of Self Confidence that further triggers their confused minds to look out for unwanted and uncalled for results. We have so many cases of young boys and girls trying to take their lives, when all they actually want or wanted was a little bit of help and support, a friend they can rely on and some love.

    The same goes for all of us adults too. We mean yes, we can cope better with our problems, but who wouldn’t like a shoulder to cry on. Moreover, we support and love everybody and we would like to have similar thinking people at one place. We want people who can motivate others, help others and inspire others or at-least make somebody happy and let him/her smile by not commenting on the way his/her body looked, the way his/her hair were, the way he/she talked, the way he/she dressed, because, at the end of the day, Black/White/Red/Brown/Short/Tall/Fair/Dusky/Dark/Skinny or Plus Sized, we all are HUMANS. So, let’s make this one of a kind Human Help and Support Network as your Personal Psychiatrist. Let’s answer questions, motivate others, inspire each other and make friends.  We don’t want you to spend your money and time on councillors. It’s our problems and we can deal with them.

    The Help and Support network will focus particularly on Teenagers. The worst cases revolve around young teenage girls who find them to be a victim of cyber bullying and blackmailing that mostly doesn’t end well

    What The Unjunk Offers, The Highlights

    What's in it for ME?

    First of all, it's the sense of satisfaction that should be good to keep everybody motivated and inspired. This community is for everybody and the fact that you were a part of this when it happened is huge. Other than that, our Team has carefully selected the best Perks and Rewards for your support, these Perks and Rewards are awesome and you'll definitely find them helpful.

    The Perks & Rewards

    It is about joining and supporting now in order to brag later that you were here from the beginning, which is cool, right? 
    Everybody is important and every contribution is huge. A single dollar, a referal, a share, a tweet. So, Join us!


    You get special mentions on TheUnjunk as Founding Members/Creators/Builders of this community. We know, when we create or support something meaningful together, there has to be Love/Gratitude/Appreciation/Respect towards each other and it isn't because it is the part of the rewards, but because we like to be loved/appreciated and respected and trust us, Our TheUnjunk Team already do, because we are Family. 
    "Everybody, every member of this Family will get his/her verified account with some great early bird offers and features, while those who join us later will have to go through some major account verification stages, which will be part of TheUnjunk's 2-Stage Verification Process."

    Final Thoughts

    We can go on and on about the need for an online community with real people, helping out other real people. All social networks, blogs, websites, services, technology and gadgets have their own gravity, but we don't need another dating service, or a site that asks us to post our morning routine, our workout schedule, the food we had and how much we had. The online/social communities need to serve people better, they need to have a goal, to teach & educate each other, to reach each other, to eliminate hatred, differences & boundaries, to spread love, to help each other.
    TheUnjunk isn't normal and that's fine, because normal is nothing, normal is Junk!

Dashboards according to our work of field, which means, whether you are a
student, banker, artist, journalist, writer, athlete, cook, speaker, innovator,
traveller, maker, business owner, teacher or anything else, you’ll have a
Verified Profile. Our social networking sites have made a joke out of these
Verified Profiles for People & Pages.

Human Help & Support
Network: Lastly, Teen Abuse, Bullying, Cyber Bullying and Exploitation
are the biggest problems our teenagers are facing all around the globe. Such
horrific incidents lead towards Humiliation, Loss of Self Respect and Loss of
Self Confidence that further triggers their confused minds to look out for
unwanted and uncalled for results. We have so many cases of young boys and
girls trying to take their lives, when all they actually want or wanted was a
little bit of help and support, a friend they can rely on and some love.

The same goes for all of us adults too. We mean yes, we can
cope better with our problems, but who wouldn’t like a shoulder to cry on.
Moreover, we support and love everybody and we would like to have similar
thinking people at one place. We want people who can motivate others, help
others and inspire others or at-least make somebody happy and let him/her smile
by not commenting on the way his/her body looked, the way his/her hair were,
the way he/she talked, the way he/she dressed, because, at the end of the day, Black/White/Red/Brown/Short/Tall/Fair/Dusky/Dark/Skinny or Plus Sized, we all
are HUMANS. So, let’s make this one of a kind Human Help and Support Network as
your Personal Psychiatrist. Let’s answer questions, motivate others, inspire
each other and make friends.  We don’t
want you to spend your money and time on councillors. It’s our problems and we
can deal with them.
The Help and Support network will focus particularly on
Teenagers. The worst cases revolve around young teenage girls who find them to
be a victim of cyber bullying and blackmailing that mostly doesn’t end well

What The Unjunk Offers, The Highlights



  

What's in it for ME?
First of all, it's the sense of satisfaction that should be good to keep everybody motivated and inspired. This community is for everybody and the fact that you were a part of this when it happened is huge. Other than that, our Team has carefully selected the best Perks and Rewards for your support, these Perks and Rewards are awesome and you'll definitely find them helpful.

The Perks & Rewards
It is about joining and supporting now in order to brag later that you were here from the beginning, which is cool, right? 
Everybody is important and every contribution is huge. A single dollar, a referal, a share, a tweet. So, Join us!



You get special mentions on TheUnjunk as Founding Members/Creators/Builders of this community. We know, when we create or support something meaningful together, there has to be Love/Gratitude/Appreciation/Respect towards each other and it isn't because it is the part of the rewards, but because we like to be loved/appreciated and respected and trust us, Our TheUnjunk Team already do, because we are Family. 

"Everybody, every member of this Family will get his/her verified account with some great early bird offers and features, while those who join us later will have to go through some major account verification stages, which will be part of TheUnjunk's 2-Stage Verification Process."
Final Thoughts

We can go on and on about the need for an online community with real people, helping out other real people. All social networks, blogs, websites, services, technology and gadgets have their own gravity, but we don't need another dating service, or a site that asks us to post our morning routine, our workout schedule, the food we had and how much we had. The online/social communities need to serve people better, they need to have a goal, to teach & educate each other, to reach each other, to eliminate hatred, differences & boundaries, to spread love, to help each other.

TheUnjunk isn't normal and that's fine, because normal is nothing, normal is Junk!

story:
Am a single mother of 2yrs old boy. My son's name is Benjamin and i have been taking care of my son very well and providing the best for him to the best of my capability.

I know am not rich but i am his mother and every penny i make is for him but it is not enough. My only chance of taking care of my baby in this hard time is to open a resourceful business. I hope to raise $10,000 to start a grocery business to import goods locally and  internationally. Your donations and sharing amongst your friends to donate as well will help me to provide a sustainable business to cater for me and my son . Thank you
