story:
Summary

The Grove, Dallas is a collaborative coworking community in the Historic West End of Downtown Dallas, Texas.  Our passion is to build a community of entrepreneurs, freelancers, non­profits and change agents passionate about transforming our city for the good.  Our first location in New Haven, Connecticut has led the charge in revitalizing their city for the last 4 years, and we intend to do the same for Dallas.

The Impact

We've grown from 6 members in September 2013, to over 60 organizations and businesses creating of a diverse community of freelancers, researchers, technology developers, non-profits and creatives.


          

         


We've already partnered with the Dallas chapter of The United Way in training the non­profits enrolled in their GroundFloor program in social media strategies for non­profits like Accion TX and Cafe Momentum.  We are working with Downtown Dallas Inc in their mission for revitalizing the Downtown community.

Our sister location in New Haven successfully raised $20,000 in their first expansion campaign which exponentially increased their ability to achieve their mission.  Since then, they have grown to become a strong voice for economic development and social transformation in their city.  It is on this model that we are growing this Dallas movement.

  • We believe business can be used for good
  • We believe a city-wide transformation is possible through collaboration and resource sharing
  • We believe we are stronger together than we are alone

This campaign will allow us to triple the impact that we have already had on revitalization and social mission in Dallas.

What We Need

We've done our best to remain frugal while also making sure that our space is top notch when it comes to design and giving people the tools they need to efficiently grow their businesses and organizations.  Here is the general overview of our expenses for this expansion.  

  • Furniture (we are partnering with a local furniture dealer to make sure we get the best value for our money):  $22,490  
  • Hospitality (includes trash cans, dishes, coffee brewers, etc.): $4,920 
  • Electronics (includes additional Ruckus access points and controller for our wifi, and additional sound system components):  $7,700
  • Interior Design (includes new signage, décor, etc.):  $3,850  
  • Miscellaneous (includes gallery lighting, step stools, delivery cart, etc.):  $1,040  

We don't anticipate falling short of our goal, simply because of the amazing community that we have behind this campaign.  But, should that take place, we will still use the funds committed for the items above.  We might have to sacrifice the additional coffee maker, or the delivery cart, but we'll adjust to make sure we have everything we need to make our space amazing.

    Risks & Challenges

    Every dollar we get will be used to furnish The Grove Dallas.  If we are unable to achieve our goal we may not be able to keep our prices as low and some entrepreneurs' dreams may not be fulfilled.

    Our challenges are similar to other small businesses - the difference is we serve the community.  Without continued support and involvement from the community we will find it increasingly difficult to achieve our ultimate mission.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    We realize that not everybody can contribute financially to our campaign, but there are still ways for you to help. 

    You can help by simply letting people know about the campaign. Conversations about the coworking movement and social change are great ways to get the word out.  

    Check the Indiegogo Share tools for ways to get the word out as well.


    Media inquiries can be directed to:

    Justin Nygren, Co­-Owner, Relational Architect

    justin@grovedallas.com

    469-­COWORK-­1

story:
The Mission of Chocolate for Charity

"Is not this the kind of fasting I have chosen - to provide the poor wanderer with shelter. If you spend yourselves in behalf of the hungry...then your light will rise in the darkness and your night will become like noonday...He will satisfy your needs in a sun-scorched land, and will strengthen our frame. You will be like a well-watered garden, like a spring whose waters never fail...I will cause you to ride on the heights of the land..." Isaiah 58

Our goal is to create a simple 1-2-3 method of online fundraising for any valid Charity. For our IndieGogo launch we have chosen one of our favorite charities to get a share of your contributions - For His Children, Ecuador. 

Charities are always in need of funding, to go on accomplishing their noble works. When things get tight, they need ever more activities just to survive. Our mission is to give any charity a ready-made means of fundraising online. Using chocolates, that all-time favorite, CforC can provide any charity with an easy fundraising method using artisan chocolate.

Back in the days when monks were forming their communities and missions, they knew that they needed some form of income, an understanding born of the sheer survival needs of the ancient world. They grew grapes and produced artisan wines. In today's world, non-profits still need funding to survive. CforC's purpose is to help by making artisan chocolates available to incentivize contributions. 

The web is infinitely suitable to reach the multitudes who can help our charities, and we have created a Prototype site that awaits your contributions to launch, at www.ChocolateForCharity.net.

This is a Non-Profit/For-Profit partnership. The mission of CforC is to partner with charities to put them in the virtual chocolate business. The business structure is simple - to distribute 50% of gross profits to any charity. Chocolate Tasting fundraising events, and individual promotions by volunteers and staff, can create an income stream that will support the crucial good works of the charity.

Founder's Comment: "The ideals of a clean environment always drove my career choices, and I've worked many years to preserve sensitive land and clean up pollution in groundwater. Now, I feel called to help raise money for humanitarian work, especially for orphan car. In past years I toured refugee camps in Yugoslavia with Operation Mobilization; went to China as an educator with Educational Resources & Referrals China; and recently worked in Ecuador with For His Children orphan care ministry. This transforming experience now drives my calling to help those in charitable work, in a big way!"

What We Need & What You Get

During this IndieGogo launch we will begin our charity-share venture with one orphan-care charity - For His Children. We chose FHC because they are a small childrens' charity in regular need of funding. CforC founders have personally visited and seen their work on the ground, and it is clear they can grow to do so much more good for children with critical needs, if they only develop a more regular source of income. You can read more at www.forhischildren-ecuador.org or watch our video above to learn more.

This IndieGogo launch is structured to raise $12,500 for ForHisChildren, while at the same time raising $12,500 toward the development of CforC. Your contribution will not only start the ChocolateForCharity fundraising model, you will immediately contribute to a significant children's ministry. This is a Non-Profit / For-Profit partnership at its best. 

The CforC website is a social enterprise with the capacity for universal impact, since it will be used by any charity in any charitable work. Your contribution will immediately benefit the children of FHC, will help in startup of CforC, and you yourself will get the delights of artisan chocolates grown right in Ecuador, where FHC is based! If you choose, you can have your chocolate perks sent as a present to a friend, family or business associate.

Your perks are the same chocolates to be offered through ChocolateForCharity, produced by artisan chocolatiers right here in the USA, from single-source cocoa grown right in the area of ForHisChildren in Ecuador. Artisan brands are always unique in flavor, and the select chocolates are 100% pure in materials, using only chocolate, cocoa butter and organic ingredients like blueberries and almonds. The new interest in artisan chocolate (like craft beer, craft wine, or craft cheese) is a move towards a more pure, more nutritious, and more memorable product. 

Your Contribution

You may contribute from $20 to $1,000 or more. If you want simply to start at $20, we will declare your involvement, or send your Valentine love, on the new ChocolateForCharity site. We'll post your personalized message, and your contribution will be split 50/50 between FHC and CforC.

Contribute $40 and you'll receive two cinnamon hot cocoa sticks, that melt into hot milk or coffee for a heart-warming winter treat. Healthful ingredients are only the purest: organic cocoa beans, evaporated cane juice, cocoa powder, and organic Saigon cinnamon. You will be contributing $12 to CforC and $12 to FHC after chocolate costs and S&H. For a $75 contribution you'll receive a Winter Season Sampler containing a variety including a jar of pure cocoa powder (a delight in anyone's kitchen) pure 67% Chocolate Bar, Celtic Sea Salt 67% Chocolate Bar, and a Michigan Cherry 77% Chocolate Bar. Distribution after S&H will be $22 to FHC and $22 to CforC. A $200 contribution will get you two packages of specially-prepared tasting samplers, in packs of 100 samplers each - 200 tastings total. These special samplers are generally prepared just for wine tastings, and are not available commercially. You will have your choice of flavors, all in organic flavorings of Celtic Sea Salt, Michigan Cherry, Pure 67%, Michigan Blueberry, Pure 77%, Almond, Espresso. Distribution after costs will be $64 FHC/$64 CforC. 

At $1,000 you will receive four specially-assembled valentine gift packages of artisan chocolates, one for each of your favorite people. They include the Winter Sampler noted above, and can be sent one to Grandma, one to the love of your life, one to your daughter and so on. Your contribution will contribute $408 each to FHC and $408 to CforC development.

These perks are all healthy for you and new studies appear each day to confirm the healthful aspects of dark chocolate (see prototype website www.ChocolateForCharity.net). Your perks are great as gifts to anyone important to your life - friend, family or business associate. You won't find these specially-assembled gifts anywhere on-the-shelf, so they make a completely unique present to yourself or others! You will feel good about your contribution, and the good feeling will live on in your chocolate supply.

After the cost of chocolates, S&H and Indie Fee, the returns from your contribution will be distributed 50/50 to FHC and to CforC for development costs. You will have the satisfaction of helping both FHC children and CforC in significant ways. 
We hope you'll be generous to the cause of For His Children, and at the same time to the startup of ChocolateForCharity.net, an online method of producing funds for charitable causes using a totally democratic web interface. CforC will apply your contribution to final development of the website and for promotion to other charities.

Your Impact

There are 1.6 million non-profits registered in the United States*, and every one of them needs money to achieve their vision. If you just wanted to call and see what you could do, you could put 10 people on the phones 40 hours a week, each making 15 calls every hour, and it would take them 5,128 years to reach them all!

To really make a difference for this host of meaningful causes, we need instead the power of the web, combined with the appetites and the power of the marketplace. CforC combines Profit with Non-Profit incentives, in a formula that works for all. People will buy chocolates no matter what, and CforC is a place where their purchases will make a real difference. Buy healthy chocolate here, and not only is your conscience clear about eating healthfully, but you are part of a global solution to suffering and injustices. Healthy chocolates, supplied online by tried-and-true charities, is a win-win-win formula for everyone. Whether the cause is hunger, a cancer cure, orphan-care, or less crime, the world will be a better place when our appetites drive us to fund the meaningful efforts already in place, but struggling for lack of funds.

Step up, and your aid in launching CforC will help a spectrum of charities to achieve their visions over time. This is a concept that is fully sustainable. This is a campaign that will take a million chocolate transactions going on today, and transform them into life-giving help for millions, tomorrow. 

Our goal is to make one of the world's most common market transactions profitable for any charity that cares to reach out and take it.

The founders of CforC have personally visited the For His Children orphanages, and seen their dedicated work up close and personal. Robert & Fran have been involved in fundraising one-to-one in the past, to finance many outreach missions over the years. They have personally give 2, 4 and 8 week blocks of their time participating hands-on in the charitable labors of others, including For His Children, Educational Resources and Referrals China, Living Waters International, Operation Mobilization and Extreme Response to name just a few.

Other Ways You Can Help

Can't help with contributions just now? Just talk it up and tell others about the global potential of Chocolates for Charity. Tell them that this is a way that charities can get a new lift on life. CforC can make a difference, and so can you! Talk is not cheap; talk can be priceless!

We know that sometimes you just can't help financially. Instead you can:
  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
  • Make use of the Indiegogo share tools to tell a friend or family member!

We look forward to your support, and to sharing an experience that says that even just a few people can change the world if we only try!


* http://www.urban.org/UploadedPDF/412674-The-Nonprofit-Sector-in-Brief.pdf

story:
Blunt Youth Radio Turns 20

          If you wanted to contribute to Blunt's campaign, but didn't make the deadline, you can *still* donate! Just go to http://www.bluntradio.org/ and use the "donate" button. (And don't be surprised when it redirects you to WMPG.org, but the funds will go to Blunt!). Thanks to all of Blunt's supporters, the 57 who were able to join the campaign, and any of you who choose to donate via http://www.bluntradio.org/. You make youth radio at WMPG possible!


Since 1994 -- nearly 20 years -- Blunt Youth Radio has provided direct media access for the youth of Southern Maine. Every week, high school age youth from the Portland area, both free and incarcerated, work together to create a live show from scratch, taking on topics that they care about, from their own perspectives. At Blunt, young people handle all aspects of show production: reporting, on-air hosting, selecting topics, locating guests, studio production, and broadcast engineering. Blunt also has an on-going outreach project with youth incarcerated by the State of Maine. Our program is the winner of thirteen regional and national broadcasting awards. Work produced by Blunt has aired on NPR, the BBC, Marketplace, and This American Life, among others.



In the years that Blunt has been on the air, the media landscape has been through some revolutionary changes. The age of the internet has ascended. The analog Marantz tape recorders we used in the past are now quaint, dusty relics. And the mini-disc recorders we are *still* using are far from cutting edge. As we look towards our two-decade mark in 2014, Blunt is seeking resources to make some changes, so we can ensure that Blunt continues to help shape the youth who will soon be in charge of our complex and loveable world. Blunt is many things: a training ground for youth journalists, story tellers, and cutting-edge media makers. Blunt is also a place where young people get taken seriously, where being live on the air means learning to thrive under pressure. Here are some comments from our members:

“As far as producing a feature, my first one I did a piece about my father’s homelessness, and I ended up winning a first place award with the Maine Association of Broadcasters for it and it got a lot of attention… It really encouraged me to continue doing Blunt Youth Radio.” Iris S.

“I like everything about Blunt. Engineering is really fun: you feel in control, and you get to use all of the exciting equipment. But hosting is really great, too, because you get the satisfaction of being on the air and you can interview interesting people. They’re really your shows and if you really want to do a show, you can see it through all the way to its completion, and that feels really nice.”  Felix P.


Blunt is dedicated to our core programs— our weekly live radio show, and the radio program at Long Creek Youth Development Center where we work with incarcerated teens. In addition, Blunt is always seeking to extend our reach, through maintaining a blog, by achieving recognition in youth media contests and challenges, by partnering with other organizations like the Telling Room, Radio Rookies, Youth Radio in California, Terrascope Youth Radio, PRX and others! Many Blunt members have traveled around the USA to media events and conferences, to hone their craft and build relationships. We have hosted our own events, like our music competition, Bluntfest, and more recently the 2011 Great Northeast Radio Rally -- where we launched the Audio Slam -- a live audio competition with a cash prize. All of these efforts require an immense amount of work, and for much of the past few years, Blunt has been doing it ALL ON A VOLUNTEER BASIS.

 


In order to continue this work in a way that can be sustained for another 20 years, Blunt is doing some major fundraising. We need to hire staff and update our equipment. We have a diverse fundraising plan that includes traditional foundation funding, and also funding from you: our grassroots supporters!

    


What We Need and What You Get

First and foremost, we need you to join this campaign. Please donate. And please get others to donate.

You can read about our perks in the column on the right on this Indiegogo page. On a deeper level, you join forces with Blunt, to continue to give youth in the Portland, Maine area a unique experience -- one that offers a long-term commitment to something positive, challenging, socially stimulating, and fun. Thank you.

story: To the hundreds of Maine Media Workshoppers—students and professors who worked with Guru Achary﻿ (whether it was for a week long course or for the several months he was in the Cinematography Track) and friends of Guru, he has changed all of us for the better as people and as filmmakers. Guru sadly passed on January 3rd, 2014. He fought the good fight until the very end. I know we all have been so upset for Guru, his wife Gabriela Fleitas﻿, their families (for what they have had to go through and in seeing their loved one in so much pain and sickness), and we have been upset for each other being so far apart during this sudden discovery of aggressive tumors on his brain and spine. Guru was one of the best people and most talented cinematographers we’ve ever met. I know that we have all felt somewhat helpless being spread across this giant world, which has been extremely difficult because we all got so close in Maine during those magical filmmaking months. It has been difficult to not be there physically for the people we love. I know Guru fought hard because he didn’t want to leave his new wife, his family and friends, or a burden of medical bills behind (whattaguy!)…I thought that this could be a good way to feel that each of us could contribute and show our support to his wife/family and at least help out in some physical way with medical/funeral bills no one should have to face--a form of support at least until we meet with people face to face again. Gabby has also been the most incredible devoted wife, spending all of her time taking care of her husband through this all. If we could all give just a little for medical bills and the funeral (at least to Gabby/his family if they will accept it), it would be a way of coming together and showing support for the people we love and cannot be physically there for right now--and to help out/show his family how much we all loved and respected him/could try to at least help a little in taking away one of the worries he feared leaving behind. Even if you can’t give anything (we’re all starving artists, I completely get that), don't feel bad at all, but please at least share this link and pass it all around, word of mouth is a form of support. It is a way of giving and helping everyone in Singapore/Gabby until we can bombard Gabs with hugs and kisses during the next opportunity. I picked a random fundraising goal, but hoping everyone can give a little (adding up quickly) and exceed expectations to help Gabs and their families at least a little bit. [The website also charges a percentage to be used]. We love these two so greatly, I thought this would be a beneficial way to come together and help for now. Cheers to Guru, we have all changed greatly having met this man, and (in different forms) he's always with us in life from here on out, whattaguy. ;)

story:
Short Summary

  • Manuel and I met when I was only 16. He had just entered college and we met through a mutual friend with whom I still spend much time. We began our adult lives learning together and growing together. We have encountered so many new things on the road to adulthood, love, loss, happiness, struggle, success, and so much more. We are finally nearing our 30's and he decided it was time to pop the question. Of course I said yes, I always knew I would. Along the road to where we are now we have both maintained full time schooling (him to become a doctor, and me to complete my BA and move on to grad school). 
  • This campaign would help us to achieve our long time desire to get married and become a family. So close to finishing school we are both looking at facing the loans and hardship that will follow the exciting graduation. Along with success always comes a struggle to get there. To have a nice wedding ceremony and reception has always been my lifelong dream; along with many other girls I'm sure.
  • We have waited eight years to get to where we are now. Throughout that time we have solidified our relationship and desire to remain together. We are certain that will never change and are excited to start a new life together. This is the first step, raising the money to have our dream wedding would not only inspire more growth and love within our relationship, but it will also send us along the path to many other new beginnings and continued success along the way. We are deciding to hold this campaign not just to achieve our goal, but also because we desire to set a strong foundation for ourselves, one that is not accompanied by wedding debt and forever working to move forward from our past. Your contributions to this campaign would be so greatly appreciated, they would impact the lives of two people who desire to succeed and make changes in the lives of many many others.

What We Need & What You Get

  • My fiancee and I have sat down and worked out a budget for a classy yet cheap and achievable wedding. In total the ceremony and reception along with all the trimmings would total about $9,100. That includes a venue for both ceremony and reception (including food, drinks, decorations, etc) would cost about $3,500. For a cake I have done some research and found creative ways to go cheap. Since we are going to have a very intimate affair only about 25 people this would cost about $150. The dress I have found is about $800. So, everything is coming at a very good price I love to google things and learn how to get the best deal for the money, so any donations would be well spent.
  • Even if we do not reach our goal, we will still put any donations toward the event, we will alter our wedding accordingly to what we can afford. All donations are helpful and even as little as $5 would add a new, exciting, and beautiful addition to our big day and would help to make the event all the more memorable and special for all who attend.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Even if you cannot make a direct contribution, any and all help will be greatly appreciated and accepted. Decorations, research, day-of assistance, advice, anything you can offer will be so useful to us. Even if all you can do is pass the link around and ask others for their assistance you have done so much, and we would be very thankful.  
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

Thank You to everyone who took the time to view my campaign! Life wouldn't be possible without such great friends, neighbors, and family.

story:
If you are an artist, support art, love fashion and enjoy life, you will want to donate for this project!

We are just simple girls that are trying to build up something really, really big and useful for the community.

Our idea

Buying clothes can get exhausting at times and the next coffee shop or bar is mostly far away (in case you are not in a shopping mall) – but we have a solution!

Knowing that being a creative person is not easy, we want to give a chance for people to understand art and artists better, as well as a chance for artists to get to know each other, communicate and exchange ideas in a perfectly relaxing atmosphere.

How we want to do this?

By giving them a place where they can feel inspired, comfortable and happy.

So what is our idea?

Imagine a place where you can learn something new from others, where communication is still LIVE and not through a social network!!! A place where you can shop but also relax and meet interesting people.

Help us make it true!

The importance of your support

Every penny means a lot to us.We are fully aware that we will never be able to repay you, but we gladly offer these perks for your efforts:

1 EUR - Your name in the status of our FB page

5 EUR- Your name in the list of donors on our FB page

10 EUR - Your picture in the “Donors Gallery” on our FB

30 EUR– A T-shirt with a logo on it (we give you some logos to choose)

50 EUR– A bag with a logo on it (we give you some logos to choose)

100 EUR– T-shirt + bag with a logo (we give you some to logos choose)

250 EUR - Your photo will be printed out, framed, and we will put in our bar or shop, so everyone can see your generosity

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute directly, you can still help:
1) Tell your art and fashion-loving friends and family about the project!
2) Use the Indiegogo's share tools to spread the word!

Thank you very much!!!

story:
Writers in Armenian language, especially in Diaspora need your support.

Our first campaign (October 2013) raised US$ 1.005. Five Armenian writers living in Syria received the symbolic financial support. The feedback and the barrage of comments was overwhelming and absolutely positive. We thank the donors who expressed high level of awareness and commitment.

The effort was well publicized in the Armenian media, including several articles and an explanatory interview with Civilnet

The campaign is aimed at supporting writers in troubled locations, where many are deprived of their regular income sources. Nevertheless, they do not stop from writing and enlightening us. They have very high understanding of their mission. Their contribution could be sometimes seen as the only logical and hopeful thing happening in an otherwise war ridden reality.




Let us support them financially. Through their writings we would be able to know more about what is happening, we will feel more engaged with the people and locations they describe, and, most of all, we will contribute in opening a window of hope for the writers and the readers alike. This is a better way of acknowledging their contribution than just clicking "Like" on their postings. It will encourage them to be more dedicated and inquisitive in their noble work.

If you are not able to financially contribute, please share this campaign with others. Let us start a whole new chain reaction for acknowledging the value of Armenian Diaspora writers, especially those living in difficult locations.

story:
Message from Holi Hai's DIRECTOR & Founder of NYC Bhangra School 


Megha Kalia : "I organize Holi Hai because I believe in bringing people together to enjoy each other's cultures and traditions.

 After being a Hospitality and Tourism Management professional for over a decade I decided to follow my dance passion. I started NYC Bhangra Dance School and company to spread cultural awareness of Bhangra (Punjabi folk music & dance from North India) in New York City. I studied Bhangra in Punjab, India and received extensive training with SIAC in Vancouver, Canada.

My education in Modern and Contemporary dance at the Martha Graham dance school has helped me build choreography knowledge and training in dance instruction.

I currently work as an artistic director and manager at NYC Bhangra Dance School & company.  I would like to introduce both, Holi (fun festival) & Bhangra (fun dance) to the masses"


About NYC Bhangra (organization HOLI HAI festival)

NYC Bhangra is an organization promoting India's unique traditions through dance and festivals. We give Bhangra dance lessons (at various locations in Manhattan. Brooklyn and New Jersey), arrange Indian dance shows. or cater to entertainment for corporate and private occasions. Since 2007, the organization has been engaging people of diverse communities to Bhangra & Balle Balle ( Hurray!!! expression in Punjabi).

Holi Hai : Festival of Colors ( NYC Bhangra's Annual Celebration)

In 2010, the organization launched NYC’s first outdoor public event to celebrate the Indian Festival of Colors - HOLI  HAI. In India the festival marks the start of harvesting season and as such symbolizes a time FESTIVITIES, JOY, HAPPINESS and is an expression of LOVE.  Traditional festivities are marked by play of powdered colors smeared on each others faces, holiday feasts and dance & music.

Our event is celebrated as a day long event at the Dag Hammarskjold Park (47th st. and 1st ave.) in Manhattan, NY. The day involves cultural dance and music performances by over a dozen dance companies/ schools and various LIVE musical bands.It offers traditional play of powdered colors, food vendors with authentic Indian food, stand-up comedy and thousands of people dancing to foot tapping LIVE & DJ music . 

From the modest beginnings with only a few hundred attendees, the event has grown exponentially in the last four years; in 2013 the event was attended by over 5,000 people from diverse communities.

With this event, our mission is to not only promote Indian culture among them but with it (going with the symbolic nature of the festival) a sense of tolerance, togetherness, and joy in the community. We use this event as a platform to promote local businesses, dance school and other artists in the community.

Why  do we need your support for Holi Hai 2014?

For over four years the event has remained a FREE admission event. Managing the cost of this event with just sponsor support has been the biggest challenge. We need your support to make this event possible (this year and for more years to come) in New York City!!!

Help us provide you an extended event with longer time period, national artists, bigger production, better equipment, PRIZES and more FREE stuff 


HOW CAN YOU SUPPORT HOLI?

HOLI HAI exists only because of the love, enthusiasm and support of various supporters & attendees. Besides the team of dedicated VOLUNTEERS who help plan, and put up this event,  its people like you, the attendees who bring life to the event.We need your support so we can continue to bring this event to New York City.

How will we use your contributed funds at Holi Hai?

- Event Production ( production staff, generators, U-Haul stage & city permits)

- Event insurance

-Sound Equipment for Music bands

- Logistics for visiting Artists (OUT of state) 

Holi Hai Impact : 

Events like Holi bring people together, create a sense of joy and community among various diverse communities. This Indian festival has known to creating bridges in the caste system prevailing in India for decades and centuries. 

In the last 4 years our event has received tremendous love from various nationalities. Caribbean, to Hispanics & Malaysian media have attended and covered this event to share this in their communities. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to contribute or purchase a ticket to this event, we would greatly appreciate your share status on Facebook or forwarding this web link to your friends.

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and invite people to RSVP on our Facebook page : www.tinyurl.com/holi2014fbinvite
  • If you would like to Volunteer day of the event, please send us your interest here: http://www.tinyurl.com/nycholi2014

India the festival marks the start of harvesting season and as such symbolizes
a time FESTIVITIES, JOY, HAPPINESS and is an expression of LOVE.  Traditional
festivities are marked by play of powdered colors
smeared on each others faces, holiday feasts and dance & music.Our event is celebrated as a day long event at the Dag Hammarskjold Park (47th st. and 1st ave.) in Manhattan, NY. The day involves cultural dance and music performances by over a dozen dance companies/ schools and various LIVE musical bands.It offers traditional play of powdered colors, food vendors with authentic Indian food, stand-up comedy and thousands of people dancing to foot tapping LIVE & DJ music . From the modest beginnings with only a few hundred attendees, the event has grown exponentially in the last four years; in 2013 the event was attended by over 5,000 people from diverse communities.With
this event, our mission is to not only promote
Indian culture among
them but with it (going with the symbolic nature of the festival) a
sense of tolerance, togetherness, and joy in the community. We use this event as a platform to promote local businesses, dance school and other artists in the community.Why  do we need your support for Holi Hai 2014?For over four years the event has remained a FREE admission event. Managing the cost of this event with just sponsor support has been the biggest challenge. We need your support to make this event possible (this year and for more years to come) in New York City!!!Help us provide you an extended event with longer time period, national artists, bigger production, better equipment, PRIZES and more FREE stuff HOW CAN YOU SUPPORT HOLI?HOLI HAI exists only because of the love, enthusiasm and support of various supporters & attendees. Besides the team of dedicated VOLUNTEERS who help plan, and put up this event,  its people like you, the attendees who bring life to the event.We need your support so we can continue to bring this event to New York City.How will we use your contributed funds at Holi Hai?- Event Production ( production staff, generators, U-Haul stage & city permits)- Event insurance-Sound Equipment for Music bands- Logistics for visiting Artists (OUT of state) Holi Hai Impact : Events like Holi bring people together, create a sense of joy and community among various diverse communities. This Indian festival has known to creating bridges in the caste system prevailing in India for decades and centuries. In the last 4 years our event has received tremendous love from various nationalities. Caribbean, to Hispanics & Malaysian media have attended and covered this event to share this in their communities. Other Ways You Can HelpIf you are unable to contribute or purchase a ticket to this event, we would greatly appreciate your share status on Facebook or forwarding this web link to your friends.Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:
Ask folks to get the word out and invite people to RSVP on our Facebook page : www.tinyurl.com/holi2014fbinvite

If you would like to Volunteer day of the event, please send us your interest here: http://www.tinyurl.com/nycholi2014

story:
I am currently completing my MBA studies, and we have been asked to run and manage a project of our own. I chose to work and invest time on a project where I could be driven by passion - I immediately knew I was going to help distressed children in my home country.  This is why I elected to support a shelter for kids and mothers on the beautiful island of Mauritius as part of my charity project.

The Shelter offers a home to abandoned and/or sexually abused kids, and it provides support to mothers and their children who are victims of domestic violence. Priority is given to education, counseling and activities/games in order to brighten the future of the Shelter's residents.

I am running a relay marathon on the 4th of May 2014 in Geneva, Switzerland in order to help me raise awareness of my project, and today, I am asking all of you to make a small gesture (€25/ CHF30 / $35)  to help these children and women who most need it. 

Your precious contribution will help buy educational materials, books, toys, games and clothes for the children and mothers at the Shelter.  You have my word on that and I promise to post regular updates on this page, as well as on my Facebook (Jehan Patel) and Instagram (@jehanpatel) Accounts.

If you are unable to help at the moment, please kindly pass on the word and make sure my project is forwarded to anyone who could be interested in making a contribution. Thanks for caring :-)

Every move counts. A tiny gesture can make a real difference in the lives of many, and there is nothing more beautiful than bringing a smile to a child's face.

Thank you again for your precious time and support. 

Merci.

Jehan

story:
Update: We Just Keep Getting Luckier...

We've made a huge amount of progress since launching our campaign and have even partnered with a studio who is willing to donate their resources to record the album! While this cuts down on the costs associated with the production, it doesn't negate them completely, and we'd love your help getting as far as we can in the next four days! Please share the campaign with whomever you can!

"I am so..."

Message in the Mirror is creating an avenue by which individuals can live with the constant reminder that they are unique, lovable and one of a kind. 

The goal is to shift the way we perceive our own reality through use of visual messages only seen clearly when we look into the mirror and through music that begins to challenge the negative, internal voices that have been speaking doubt and harm over years and decades.

Beauty From The Inside Out

We are creating apparel that you see when you look at yourself and music that you hear when you listen to yourself. We are marketing this to salon professionals because we believe they have built the relationships needed to deliver this crucial message to their clients.

The merchandise comes in the form of cutting capes for the time in the salon but also as clothing and music for the rest of the client's time. The message remains, spreads, and becomes part of the reshaping of the person’s self-image.

In addition to retail sales, we are going to bring this merchandise and music to the beauty industry and community in person. Our presentation will give salon professionals a vision of how their work can have a lasting, empowering effect on their clients, and the people around them.

$8000

If we reach our initial goal of $8000, we’ll be able to produce the album and order our first run of apparel, plus packing and shipping the rewards to you. We would be thrilled to hit this goal and forever grateful for your help.

$10,000 would allow us to bring in additional design and promotion help to bring the movement and products into more salons around the country and the world.

$15,000 would allow us to travel to trade shows to give our presentation to more people within the salon world and spread the Message in the Mirror.

$20,000 would allow us to make a short series of videos to promote the ideas behind Message in the Mirror. We feel this would be the most effective way to reach salon professionals and encourage them to take responsibility for their clients’ well being and it is our ultimate goal.

Kathy and Mark

Kathy Martin Reid has been a licensed cosmetologist for 27 years and in that time has worked extensively as both a hairstylist and an educator for organizations such as the American Board of Certified Hair Colorists, Goldwell Cosmetics and Rene Furterer. She currently operates Kreativ Edge, a hair salon dedicated to keeping it's customers current in the health and appearance of their hair located in Bellevue, WA.

Mark Power has spent over thirty years studying, training and teaching vocal technique in Los Angeles, New York City, and now in Seattle. In Seattle, he has been seen on stage performing Opera, Musical Theatre, Classical, Sacred, Pop, and Rock and has composed four produced operettas, becoming a notable and award-winning local teacher and composer in the process. He has been writing music since he was fifteen years old for various artists including Earth, Wind & Fire.

Thank You.

Whether you can afford to share with us right now, please help us pass the word on by sharing our video. Even if we don't reach our fundraising goal, we believe our message alone has value. If you are in a position to reach out to someone and help raise their sense of self worth, don't hesitate.

Love each other and love yourselves.

Video by Honey Toad Studio

story:
What Is Wearabl?

Wearabl is an online marketplace for independent clothing.

The founders, Tristan Pereida-Rice and Christopher Rice, created the Santa Monica based company with a single idea in mind: artists should have the opportunity to make a living from their creative work. The company is scheduled to launch this Spring. 


The Impact

Most aspiring clothing designers will see their dream of designing clothes for a living slip away, as theyâ€™re repeatedly rejected and ignored by oppressive industry gate keepers.

With your help, we can level the apparel market by creating a place where independent clothing designers can sell their work and pursue their dreams. In turn, this will help everyone express their individuality with unique designs they wonâ€™t find in stores. Independence will inspire Independence. If you choose to help, it will be because of you that the community of aspiring clothing designers has the opportunity to escape the draining 9 to 5 job and do something they actually enjoy doing for a living, which we believe makes for a happier world.

The Wearabl venture is all about  independence for both the independent clothing designer and the individual, but we need your help to get started â€¦ they need your help.

Without your help, gate keepers will continue to reject and ignore these aspiring clothing designers â€¦ which will inevitably force awesome talent into irrelevant day jobs, where they will watch their dream slowly slip away as they try to make ends meet.


What We Need & What You Get

Weâ€™re looking to attract an initial $2,000 to get started.

This capital will go to the overall start-up cost associated Wearabl, including the design and development of the marketplace, hosting solutions, and the premium applications needed to streamline the operation of the marketplace. Weâ€™ve spent a lot of time in researching what we need, because weâ€™re dedicated to keeping capital burn as minimal as possible.

Weâ€™ve outlined a destination for every dollar of the initial $2,000 start-up capital, so you can rest assured your contribution is going where it needs to go -- not just to help Wearabl get started â€¦ but more importantly, help level the apparel market by creating a place where independent clothing designers can sell their work and pursue their dreams.

Weâ€™re humbled to have received such warm support from both the independent clothing community and the start-up community, and weâ€™d like to express our gratitude to our contributors here at IndieGoGo by offering a few tokens of our appreciation.  


Other Ways You Can Help

You can also help out by connecting with us on Twitter and Facebook. Weâ€™d love to learn what youâ€™re working on, hear any feedback you have to offer, and answer any questions you may have.


We have an exciting referral program in place for those interested in earning Wearabl credit as well, which could help you grab your first t-shirt from the marketplace for free! You get $1 for every referred sign up you send us using your unique link. Get 20 friends to sign up and you could be rocking an awesome new shirt of your choice.

www.wearabl.com

story:
Our Story - The Gift Card Loaded with Oakland Love!

We love Oakland. We want jobs for Oaklanders.  We know that supporting local independent businesses and artists -- shopping independently -- keeps and creates local jobs. SO...we want to make it EASY and FUN to do.  This is why we're creating the Oakland Grown Gift Card. 

 

The gift card that you can use at multiple locally-owned businesses. Get local coffee, clothes, housewares, jewelry, kids' stuff...eat at our awesome local restaurants.  Buy art from our amazing local artists... from one fabulous gift card. 

Who are we? We are Oakland Grown - a group of passionate volunteers working to support our local economy by re-directing dollars into the local economy.  We are the product of two non-profit organizations: Oakland Merchants Leadership Forum, where we were born and raised, and the Sustainable Business Alliance, who recently adopted us. Together, we are all working to build a strong, real economy that is healthy and equitable! 

 

  

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

The Impact: Stop Money from Leaving Oakland and Create More Jobs!

 

Just about everyone gives and receives gift cards.  For the past 4 years, gift cards were the most requested gifts for the holidays.  $23 billion is spent on gift cards during the holidays nationally, and almost all of it is to chain stores. (Boo!)  Local stores everywhere are almost completely absent from this market.

 

On a per capita basis, that translates to Oaklanders sending more than $25 million right out of our neighborhoods each holiday season through gift card purchases. 

 

The Oakland Grown Gift Card will help change that. 

 

Soon, with your help, we'll be able to offer gift cards that everyone can buy and use with Oakland's coolest local independent businesses and artists, keeping money -- and jobs -- in our community. 

 

Supporting local businesses supports not only retail jobs, but all kinds of other jobs, as our local businesses support other local business owners like graphic designers, accountants, artists, local newspapers, community banks and lots of other businesses and artists that chain stores would not be supporting because they get most of their work done at headquarters somewhere else.  See this idea illustrated in the graphic above.

 

There are lots of other positive impacts of re-directing this money...local independent businesses and artists

  >>  Give more of their revenue to local causes

  >>  Make our communities more interesting, unique and worth traveling to see

  >>  Carry items by local people and that support the interests of local people

  >>  Diversify our economy portfolio. When we have lots of small businesses, we are putting all of our jobs in

one place, eggs in one basket.  If we put all our jobs in one big fat store and that store folds or leaves town for a better deal, all of those jobs disappear at once. That's SCARY.

 

For even more reasons, go to http://oaklandgrown.org/ 

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

What We Need: $2500 Bare Bones... Eventually Self-Sustaining

 

Bare bones seed costs:

We are seeking $2500 to seed this project. We need about $7500 in total to get this program off the ground and in operation through the holidays.  We already raised $5000 in sponsorships and now need the final $2500. This will pay for the bare minimum expenses, no marketing budget, all-volunteer operation.

 

Our costs

 

Start Up 

$5000 - custom local gift card program and software development

$500 - designing and setting up the cards

$800 - printing the cards

$250 - merchandizing tools

----------------------------------

$6550  

 

Monthly Fees for 3 Months

$100 program vendor fees

$230 operating expenses (insurance, bank fees, credit card processing, etc)

----------------------------------

$330 x 3 ~ $1000

 

TOTAL: $7500

 

Additional funds toward long term, sustainable operations:

Any additional money to this program will help us build up the marketing and staffing of this program.  In order to grown and be sustainable, we'll need to market the program.  If we get enough exposure and enough cards out there in the marketplace, the card fees will cover the costs to operate the program and actually pay some of the people who are currently volunteering countless hours on this project!

 

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

What You Get - You Help Our Economy and Get VCPs (Very Cool Perks!)

In addition to having the satisfaction of helping to keep dollars in our economy, keep and create jobs, and help people have fun exploring our neighborhood businesses and artists, we have very cool perks for you, depending on the level you are able to help out... such as:

 

 >> A thank you + link on the Oakland Grown website
 >> A thank you in the East Bay Express

 >> A $10 Oakland Grown gift card
 >> An Oakland Grown t-shirt
 >> A profile on the Oakland Grown website (for indie biz or charity of your choice)

 >> A tweet or fb shout out on your indie biz or a charity of your choice

 >> A $25 or $100 Oakland Grown gift card
 >> An Oakland Grown gift box  (Adult or kid style)
 >> A Half page or full page ad for your local indie business or a charity of your choice
 >> A booth and signage at an Oakland Grown public event in 2012
 

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Other Ways You Can Help

Love the card and the cause?  Here are some other ways you can help:

 

>> Spread the word!  Use the share tools on this website, and copy our local spending multiplier graphic.

>> Buy some cards when they come out! Consider buying some Oakland Grown gift cards for your friends and family.  If you donate or join our mailing list, you'll get an announcement when they are launched. You'll be able to buy them online from the Oakland Grown website as well as from local events where our volunteers will be staffing tables.

 

>> Buy an Oakland Grown t-shirt!T-shirt proceeds help us with our Oakland Grown programs, including the gift card. Buy t-shirts online.

 

>> Shop Oakland Grown first -  Whenever you shop or get services, we hope you'll think to support Oakland Grown (locally-owned and independent) businesses and artists before heading to a chain store and/or outside of Oakland.  As you saw above, you'll be building the economy with every dollar you spend!
story_txt:
Our Story - The Gift Card Loaded with Oakland Love!
We love Oakland. We want jobs for Oaklanders.  We know that supporting local independent businesses and artists -- shopping independently -- keeps and creates local jobs. SO...we want to make it EASY and FUN to do.  This is why we're creating the Oakland Grown Gift Card.  
 
The gift card that you can use at multiple locally-owned businesses. Get local coffee, clothes, housewares, jewelry, kids' stuff...eat at our awesome local restaurants.  Buy art from our amazing local artists... from one fabulous gift card.  
Who are we? We are Oakland Grown - a group of passionate volunteers working to support our local economy by re-directing dollars into the local economy.  We are the product of two non-profit organizations: Oakland Merchants Leadership Forum, where we were born and raised, and the Sustainable Business Alliance, who recently adopted us. Together, we are all working to build a strong, real economy that is healthy and equitable!  
 
  
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------


The Impact: Stop Money from Leaving Oakland and Create More Jobs!

 
Just about everyone gives and receives gift cards.  For the past 4 years, gift cards were the most requested gifts for the holidays.  $23 billion is spent on gift cards during the holidays nationally, and almost all of it is to chain stores. (Boo!)  Local stores everywhere are almost completely absent from this market.
 
On a per capita basis, that translates to Oaklanders sending more than $25 million right out of our neighborhoods each holiday season through gift card purchases.  
 
The Oakland Grown Gift Card will help change that. 
 
Soon, with your help, we'll be able to offer gift cards that everyone can buy and use with Oakland's coolest local independent businesses and artists, keeping money -- and jobs -- in our community.  
 
Supporting local businesses supports not only retail jobs, but all kinds of other jobs, as our local businesses support other local business owners like graphic designers, accountants, artists, local newspapers, community banks and lots of other businesses and artists that chain stores would not be supporting because they get most of their work done at headquarters somewhere else.  See this idea illustrated in the graphic above.
 
There are lots of other positive impacts of re-directing this money...local independent businesses and artists
  >>  Give more of their revenue to local causes 
  >>  Make our communities more interesting, unique and worth traveling to see
  >>  Carry items by local people and that support the interests of local people
  >>  Diversify our economy portfolio. When we have lots of small businesses, we are putting all of our jobs in 
one place, eggs in one basket.  If we put all our jobs in one big fat store and that store folds or leaves town for a better deal, all of those jobs disappear at once. That's SCARY.
 
For even more reasons, go to http://oaklandgrown.org/ 




--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
What We Need: $2500 Bare Bones... Eventually Self-Sustaining
 
Bare bones seed costs: 
We are seeking $2500 to seed this project. We need about $7500 in total to get this program off the ground and in operation through the holidays.  We already raised $5000 in sponsorships and now need the final $2500. This will pay for the bare minimum expenses, no marketing budget, all-volunteer operation.
 
Our costs
 
Start Up 
$5000 - custom local gift card program and software development
$500 - designing and setting up the cards
$800 - printing the cards
$250 - merchandizing tools
----------------------------------
$6550  
 
Monthly Fees for 3 Months
$100 program vendor fees
$230 operating expenses (insurance, bank fees, credit card processing, etc)
----------------------------------
$330 x 3 ~ $1000
 
TOTAL: $7500
 
Additional funds toward long term, sustainable operations:
Any additional money to this program will help us build up the marketing and staffing of this program.  In order to grown and be sustainable, we'll need to market the program.  If we get enough exposure and enough cards out there in the marketplace, the card fees will cover the costs to operate the program and actually pay some of the people who are currently volunteering countless hours on this project!
 
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------


What You Get - You Help Our Economy and Get VCPs (Very Cool Perks!)
In addition to having the satisfaction of helping to keep dollars in our economy, keep and create jobs, and help people have fun exploring our neighborhood businesses and artists, we have very cool perks for you, depending on the level you are able to help out... such as:
 
 >> A thank you + link on the Oakland Grown website >> A thank you in the East Bay Express
 >> A $10 Oakland Grown gift card >> An Oakland Grown t-shirt  >> A profile on the Oakland Grown website (for indie biz or charity of your choice)
 >> A tweet or fb shout out on your indie biz or a charity of your choice 
 >> A $25 or $100 Oakland Grown gift card >> An Oakland Grown gift box  (Adult or kid style) >> A Half page or full page ad for your local indie business or a charity of your choice >> A booth and signage at an Oakland Grown public event in 2012 
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------



Other Ways You Can Help
Love the card and the cause?  Here are some other ways you can help:
 
>> Spread the word!  Use the share tools on this website, and copy our local spending multiplier graphic.
>> Buy some cards when they come out! Consider buying some Oakland Grown gift cards for your friends and family.  If you donate or join our mailing list, you'll get an announcement when they are launched. You'll be able to buy them online from the Oakland Grown website as well as from local events where our volunteers will be staffing tables.
 
>> Buy an Oakland Grown t-shirt!T-shirt proceeds help us with our Oakland Grown programs, including the gift card. Buy t-shirts online.
 
>> Shop Oakland Grown first -  Whenever you shop or get services, we hope you'll think to support Oakland Grown (locally-owned and independent) businesses and artists before heading to a chain store and/or outside of Oakland.  As you saw above, you'll be building the economy with every dollar you spend!

story:
Our Story

In 2009, Santa Fe IFF was created by local entrepreneurial filmmakers wanting to respond to the growing need for a platform to specifically promote independent filmmakers for the Santa Fe community of film buffs.  The first annual Santa Fe IFF was a resounding success, in 2010 the second Fest screened 80 films over 6 days, including 4 Discussions with filmmakers and five After-parties at the hottest venues in Downtown Santa Fe.

The Impact

The Santa Fe Independent Film Festival advances Santa Fe as a hub for filmmaking and a center for viewing cutting edge film, while attracting filmmakers and movie goers worldwide.  The Fest impacts the youth, the community, and economic development and is a platform for independent art on a global scale.

What We Need & What You Get

Santa Fe IFF receives funding from a number of small sponsors and donors, as well as partnering with local businesses to ensure a great Fest every year.  The funds raised through this campaign will be used specifically to cover travel expenses for filmmakers arriving in Santa Fe for the Fest.  Your donation can bring a filmmaker to Santa Fe to introduce their film.  $100 brings a filmmaker from Colorado, $250 brings a filmmaker from Los Angeles, $500 brings a filmmaker from New York, and $1,000 brings an international filmmaker. 

Be a Santa Fe IFF Member. Your membership builds community for indie films and you receive the latest updates, information and more.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please let your friends know that they can also be a part this effort for indie film:

http://www.facebook.com/santafeindependentfilmf...

http://twitter.com/SFIndieFilmFest

http://www.youtube.com/user/SantaFeIndieFilmFest

story:
Our Story

My name is Abby Woodhouse, and I am the founder of Beauty in Life, an online organization that promotes self-esteem and loving yourself, as well as spreading awareness for eating disorders and depression.

 

The Impact

We have an incredible 3,000+ followers of our blog and love each and every one of you individually. Each day, we are flooded with messages and emails telling us how much of an impact we've made on our followers lives, as well as questions for advice.

 

What We Need & What You Get

We want to raise $500 to do general awesomeness. Essentially, this $500 would restart our bracelet and t-shirt shop. The last time we opened up shop, we raised almost $1,000 to donate to To Write Love on Her Arms, as well as the National Eating Disorders Association.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Just submit your inspiration quotes, pictures, videos, and music to our blog. Spread the word. Tell someone that they're beautiful.

story:
"Surrounded and battered by troubles, but not demoralized....We've been thrown down, but we haven't broken...."

 

 

 

*****

 

UPDATED 5/1/12

THANK YOU TO ALL WHO HAVE GIVEN SO GENEROUSLY! 

WITH ONLINE AND OFFLINE GIFTS, WE HAVE ENDED UP AT ABOUT 20% OF OUR ORIGINAL GOAL, BUT THAT IS SUFFICIENT - IN COMBINATION WITH CMOE'S RECENT RE-HIRE FOR THE SPRING SEASON - FOR HIM TO INCREASE THE CURRENT "AS IS" VALUE OF HIS PROPERTY (IF HE IS CREATIVE!) BY POSSIBLY AS MUCH AS 50% BY VIRTUE OF TURNING THE BASEMENT INTO LIVEABLE SPACE.

WE MAY NOT HAVE REACHED OUR ORIGINAL GOAL, BUT THIS IS STILL BETTER THAN WHERE WE STARTED - AND IT GIVES CMOE WHAT HE MOST NEEDED, WHICH IS FORWARD MOMENTUM.

THANK YOU, AGAIN, AND GOD BLESS!

~LEAH

 

*****

 

 

 

 

If you have any questions, please contact me directly at fritolayah@gmail.com.

 

 

 

THANK YOU FOR READING CMOE’S STORY!

 

   I first met CMoe (I’m using a nickname, here, to protect his privacy on this site) when I was hired to work for the same automotive plastics company that would eventually downsize him when Michigan hit hard economic times 4+ years ago.

 

   An adult-survivor of child-abuse and neglect, CMoe was a man without roots, relocating every couple of years and starting over, often with little more than a dart to a map to determine his next venture, forever trying to reinvent himself. He moved from state to state, job to job, eventually landing in Michigan where he put himself through college living in a storage shed. He excelled on campus, had seemingly found his niche, and graduated with honors. But a year later, when 9/11 rendered his “Recreational Management” degree essentially useless, he was forced to reinvent himself, once again, only this time carrying tens of thousands in college debt.  Two steps forward; three, four, five steps back.

 

   A survivalist at heart, CMoe pulled from his many years of hands-on, MacGyver-like, jack-of-all-trades experience, and he launched a new plan – With ingenuity and an entrepreneurial mind, he partnered with a college associate, invested what savings he had left, and purchased a pair of ramshackle properties, brimming with potential, in this lake-filled, forest-preserved, touristy town in western Michigan.

 

   By the time CMoe and I met, he was working a full time job, and squeezing in countless extra hours on weekends and late nights to execute the first renovation.


   Despite his fiercely guarded nature, CMoe and I forged a fast (if sometimes labor-intensive) friendship. The more I would learn of his story, the more I understood the person inside and would try to find ways to get around his “walls.”  Intentionally looking for a way to speak affirmingly into his life, I invited myself along to see his work on the remodel. I was immediately impressed with his tenacity and vision; and over multiple visits, he would show me some of the basics of how he designed, how to play the "yellow sticker game" for killer deals on clearance materials, and all the redesign inspired by the various, choice finds.

 

   During those months, my brother and a group of more than a dozen young men from our church also joined forces with CMoe in a kind of old-fashioned "barn raising" to demolish and completely rebuild the tattered old, rotting eyesore of a garage, and then again later to strip the two layers of ancient siding, and insulate the house for the first time since its original construction. The work was intense, and the transformation was indeed an extreme make-over! (As you can see by the above pictures.)

 

   After CMoe lost his job, ever aware of the need to stay ahead of the increasingly rash actions of his business partner, CMoe remained faithful to his plan, and continued to put the finishing touches on the property, investing – often literally – his own blood, sweat, and tears.

 

   For CMoe, this was more than a dream of a chance at a new life.  It became, for him, a new way of doing life, a resolve to finish something he’d started.

 

   As you can see, he virtually single-handedly beautified the first property, metamorphosing it from a $25,000 shack into an $80,000 three-bedroom family home....At great personal cost, he had succeeded in bringing one of the greatest works of his life to completion!...Just in time for the housing market to bottom out.

 

 

 

TWO STEPS FORWARD; THREE, FOUR, FIVE STEPS BACK.

 

   Still enmeshed with this inveigling business partner, CMoe gave another year of his life and several more thousands of dollars worth of labor and repair to her home and property in an effort to salvage their investment, dependent on her promises of payment that would in fact never materialize.  In the end, his house was sold out from under him for less than half of its value, covering barely enough to release the mortgages for the 2 houses, and recovering none of the cost (in materials and years!) that went into the remodel itself, thoroughly undermining CMoe's chances to turn over his 2nd house or make any meaningful progress on his desire to further his vocational training and the hope of future work.

 

   For a man who, without the support structure of a loving family or faithful friends, has never been able to get his feet firmly under him, this devastation – primarily helmed by this eccentric and ultimately reckless business partner – was damaging in the extreme.

 

   Forced to live in the gutted, one-bedroom 2nd property that by now had also been seriously damaged by a former tenant, CMoe has since been held hostage another 2+ years, keeping his head above water by pawning his possessions and scrounging up temporary, seasonal and often grueling work for barely more than minimum wage, the last trickle of any remaining unemployment benefits now exhausted.

 

   Even with no budget, he has already cleared and landscaped the property, cultivated a fruits/herbs/veggie perennial garden, and stock-piled roughly half of all the materials he would need to finish this remodel. But he has been effectively dead-ended by the unavailability of any sustainable employment within a 50 mile radius of this camping/hunting/fishing vacation town, and isolated by unreliable transportation.

 

   One remaining fact has anchored his resolve to see his plan through to completion: The very thing that keeps CMoe isolated, here, is nevertheless precisely what we believe will make this property ideal for re-sale ~ its location.

 

 

 

WHAT HE NEEDS …

 

   Timing is of the utmost importance. With the housing market rebounding, the time we must act is now.  CMoe needs just enough water to prime the pump; and the house, the materials he already has, and the property location will provide the rest of the momentum for him.

 

   As anyone who has ever had any work done on their house can attest, $7,800 is a comparatively small sum; and we have intentionally kept this request modest. What we have seen this man do by rubbing only a few pennies together is nothing short of miraculous! We believe this modest budget is sufficient to both acquire the remainder of the materials needed to give the house its much-needed refit – as a starter family home, or a charming vacation get-away, or even as an income property for another enterprising soul – as well as protect the home, itself, (and your gifts and CMoe’s future), until final sale.

 

   The immediate goal ~ to have this house finished and listed for sale by no later than the end of summer. We have left the funding "flexible" because even a partial offering, here, could have the potential to re-infuse his efforts with enough forward momentum to usher this house to market.

 

   Will you allow us to stand on your shoulders in this project? This last boost would not only unlock the potential of this little run-down cottage and turn it into someone's dream get-away in Outdoorsman's Paradise here in Michigan, but it would also redeem CMoe’s original dream, enabling him to relocate, and get into a vocation that utilizes his unique gifts and passions, supported by a community of friends who truly love him.

 

   If we are (miraculously) able to exceed our goal in obtaining funding, CMoe's plan could reintroduce some of the features of the original version, including floor-plan expansion and the addition of one or more bedrooms, and outfitting the home with various “Green Energy” technologies that would make it more desirable and even self-sustaining, such as adding solar panel roofing to power the refrigerator and waterheater, or enclosing the perennial garden with a greenhouse.

 

 

**NOTE:  You can give in any increment - you are not locked in to a "minimum" except if you claim a specific perk, to the right.**

 

 

 

… AND WHAT YOU GET:

 

   We will be documenting this journey photographically from start to finish, and have incorporated what we hope will be an artful approach to capturing the rest of CMoe's story as part of our Thank You! for any help you are willing and able to give. Please see our *perks* to the right to see what might be the best fit for you!

 

A Few Highlights:

 

   For those of you with a unique eye for one-of-a-kind art, if you are able to invest generously, you might be especially interested in the perk which would give you an original, computer-rendered, 36"x48" genuine painting (watercolor or oil) from the photo of your choice.

 

   Or if you love to travel, and have a love of the outdoors, and if you are able to give at the $7,800 level and fully fund this project, we would like to commemorate that gift with a package that would turn this lake-filled county into your destination-wrapped-in-mini-vacation. Depending on the time of year, there is a lot to do, here ~ whether you prefer hunting, fishing, boating, hiking, snow sports, motor sports, camping, or if you just like star-gazing without city haze.  This perk provides a round-trip flight from anywhere in the continental U.S.; and waiting for you when you arrive will be vouchers/gift certificates for several of the local eateries and a scenic river canoe trip. If you've got it in you, you could ride the current all the way to Lake Michigan! after which you’ll be bussed back to the canoe livery, so you can't go wrong!  Also, while you are here, you can become a part of the photograph that will be converted to your wall painting, if you wish!  What a great conversation-starter, a testimonial of your faith and philanthropy as you host friends in your home, and you could inspire who knows how many other people!  (Note, at this level, overnight accommodations would be at your discretion and expense, whether you want to stay for one night or several, unless you are the top giver for this campaign....see the next and final *highest funder* perk.)

 

   Finally, though we believe we can finish this project on this proposed shoe-string budget, we also hope that this amount will be exceeded! So, we are adding a final, "Penthouse Perk" so to speak - not listed to the right, because the dollar amount is unspecified - as a way of honoring our single-largest-contributor. At this level, the funding would necessarily exceed that of the 7th perk; you receive everything previously mentioned, but we also offer the opportunity for our *highest funder* to enjoy the finished house itself! for a 3-day, 2-night weekend. (Note, if your schedule and the sale date of the house conflict, we will have a contingency plan to ensure you would have accommodations at a local, off-the-beaten-path hotel.)

 

 

 

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP:

 

   You can help us tell CMoe's story! Please post links from this appeal on your Facebook sites, your Blogs, and share with your Churches!

 

   If every member of just one, small town Community Church could give at the $60 level, it could fund this whole project, and testify to the overflow of God's grace in each of our lives!

 

   We are blessed in order to BE a blessing. I have watched, over the years, as this man has wrestled with his demons, and I have seen how his character has compelled him to find ways to “pay it forward,” even when it means being generous out of his own hardship. And CMoe is very superstitious about “not letting grace dead end” on him, as he puts it. Helping him finally reinvent his life will spill over, multiplying out as blessing in the lives of others he is then able to touch. Our generosity, here, is sowing life-giving seed in good soil.

 

   There are a lot of worthy causes out there. We're just trying to share our heart for this one...Trying, as the old story goes, to save 1 starfish washed up on the beach by throwing it back in the water for a chance at life. Maybe we can't make a difference to them all, but we can make all the difference to this one.

 

   Thank you for your time and consideration! And may God bless you!
