**NOTE:  You can give in any increment - you are not locked in to a "minimum" except if you claim a specific perk, to the right.**
 
 
 
… AND WHAT YOU GET:
 
   We will be documenting this journey photographically from start to finish, and have incorporated what we hope will be an artful approach to capturing the rest of CMoe's story as part of our Thank You! for any help you are willing and able to give. Please see our *perks* to the right to see what might be the best fit for you!
 
A Few Highlights:
 
   For those of you with a unique eye for one-of-a-kind art, if you are able to invest generously, you might be especially interested in the perk which would give you an original, computer-rendered, 36"x48" genuine painting (watercolor or oil) from the photo of your choice.
 
   Or if you love to travel, and have a love of the outdoors, and if you are able to give at the $7,800 level and fully fund this project, we would like to commemorate that gift with a package that would turn this lake-filled county into your destination-wrapped-in-mini-vacation. Depending on the time of year, there is a lot to do, here ~ whether you prefer hunting, fishing, boating, hiking, snow sports, motor sports, camping, or if you just like star-gazing without city haze.  This perk provides a round-trip flight from anywhere in the continental U.S.; and waiting for you when you arrive will be vouchers/gift certificates for several of the local eateries and a scenic river canoe trip. If you've got it in you, you could ride the current all the way to Lake Michigan! after which you’ll be bussed back to the canoe livery, so you can't go wrong!  Also, while you are here, you can become a part of the photograph that will be converted to your wall painting, if you wish!  What a great conversation-starter, a testimonial of your faith and philanthropy as you host friends in your home, and you could inspire who knows how many other people!  (Note, at this level, overnight accommodations would be at your discretion and expense, whether you want to stay for one night or several, unless you are the top giver for this campaign....see the next and final *highest funder* perk.)
 
   Finally, though we believe we can finish this project on this proposed shoe-string budget, we also hope that this amount will be exceeded! So, we are adding a final, "Penthouse Perk" so to speak - not listed to the right, because the dollar amount is unspecified - as a way of honoring our single-largest-contributor. At this level, the funding would necessarily exceed that of the 7th perk; you receive everything previously mentioned, but we also offer the opportunity for our *highest funder* to enjoy the finished house itself! for a 3-day, 2-night weekend. (Note, if your schedule and the sale date of the house conflict, we will have a contingency plan to ensure you would have accommodations at a local, off-the-beaten-path hotel.)
 
 
 
OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP:
 
   You can help us tell CMoe's story! Please post links from this appeal on your Facebook sites, your Blogs, and share with your Churches!
 
   If every member of just one, small town Community Church could give at the $60 level, it could fund this whole project, and testify to the overflow of God's grace in each of our lives!
 
   We are blessed in order to BE a blessing. I have watched, over the years, as this man has wrestled with his demons, and I have seen how his character has compelled him to find ways to “pay it forward,” even when it means being generous out of his own hardship. And CMoe is very superstitious about “not letting grace dead end” on him, as he puts it. Helping him finally reinvent his life will spill over, multiplying out as blessing in the lives of others he is then able to touch. Our generosity, here, is sowing life-giving seed in good soil.
 
   There are a lot of worthy causes out there. We're just trying to share our heart for this one...Trying, as the old story goes, to save 1 starfish washed up on the beach by throwing it back in the water for a chance at life. Maybe we can't make a difference to them all, but we can make all the difference to this one.
 
   Thank you for your time and consideration! And may God bless you!

story:
A Family Business, A Family Recipe

We're Shannon and Scott, co-founders of Dandelion Cheesecakes.  Shannon's mom came up with a delicious and creamy cheesecake recipe when she was just 17 years old, and has been baking it for almost 50 years.  We haven't found a cheesecake as smooth anywhere else.  A few years ago she passed the torch along to us.  


We've taken her original recipe and added a variety of gourmet flavors - favorites include Bananas Foster, Andes Mint Chocolate, White Chocolate Amaretto, and Cherries Jubilee.  

What We Still Need

We've already come a long way.  We've found a commercial kitchen to rent, and paid the deposit and insurance. We've taken the required food safety classes.  The main thing we need now is the money to keep going so that we can get the word out about these fabulous cheesecakes.  


In the future we plan to start selling cheesecakes in local farmers' markets, in restaurants, and shipping across the country.  All of these things have capital outlays, and while no one thing is hugely expensive, it's just going to take more than we can currently do.

So Far...

We've been operating on a friends and family basis since just before Thanksgiving.  We threw together our Facebook page on a whim, and let it run its course.  

  • According to our tracking graph we have an average reach of 650 people - and we haven't even started selling cheesecakes to the public yet.  
  • We have a list of people all across the country who are just waiting for us to be able to ship.
  • We have two restaurants we're in talks with who are interested in serving our cheesecake once we can commit to prices and quantities.  

If You Can't Donate...

We still love you!  You can still be part of this successful Indiegogo campaign!  Share a link on your Facebook page, like our page, comment on our photos, tell your favorite local restaurant owner about us, and keep us in mind for your next special occasion.    

 Check us out at www.dandelioncheesecakes.com

story:
We are Guy, Ed and Arnout – Our idea is to drive across the world to visit and raise money for some very unlucky children. We have the incredible sponsorship of Chevrolet to cover our costs and car so EVERYTHING from this page goes to HELPING OUR 2 AMAZING CHARITIES.

THE BIG AND WORTHY CAUSE (and 2 fabulous charities)

I'm lucky enough not to have been massively affected by any huge badness or illness. Which got me thinking...such a huge amount about life can depend on where you were born and who to. It’s just luck.  It would be amazing if we could help children born unlucky.

Lucky for us the Mongol Rally thought so too. Their official Rally charity is the Lotus Childrens Fund. These guys do amazing work for children in Mongolia (which seemed appropriate since that is where we will end up... hopefully!)

But Mongolia is quite specific. We wanted to do more. So we have linked up with SOS Childrens Fund too - the worlds largest Orphan charity. Giving some of the worlds unluckiest children a home and a big break in life.  This is the kind of stuff they can make happen - how cool is this (http://www.soschildrensvillages.org.uk/charity-news/archive/2012/01/the-strength-to-power-on-adelines-story)

THE BIG IDEA – the more you give the more we do just for you.

What if we linked a big, ridiculous, probably dangerous event to Facebook, Twitter and YouTube (and Indiegogo) so that you could not only follow it, but you could influence it - so it became your event and the more you donate the more control you could have?

THE BIG EVENT - HOW FAR WOULD YOU GO?

Marathons, triathlons, mountainous cycle rides, one week silences and 40 day fasts didnt seem far enough. 

Then we discovered the Mongol Rally - A race across a third of the world from England to Mongolia, across 16 countries, a fifth with barely any roads, some at war, lots of corrupt officals and plenty of space for your imagination. And it has to be done in a car about the same size as a lawn-mower. 

HOW IT WORKS

We have set up some social network pages.

FACEBOOK, TWITTER, YOUTUBE

1)   You donate cash (see right) to our good cause (see below),

2)  The more you donate the more we do for you. (NEXT WEEK WE RELEASE THE BIG $$ OPTIONS - We are talking fancy dress, truth or dare, tell us where to drive and lots of other things) 

3)   We will post all this on Facebook for you to enjoy.

4)   This way you get much more involved for the money you donate.

5)   This will all happen as we attempt to drive a tiny car from London to Mongolia.

So...

1) DONATE

2) TELL US TO DO SOMETHING

3) SEE THE RESULTS ON FACEBOOK, YOUTUBE and INDIE GOGO

Have fun doing good!!

story:
Short Summary

I have been dreaming of owning and operating my own coffeeshop for years.  At the begining of the summer the opportunity fell into my lap that I was unable to walk away from.  The owner of the Coffee Roaster Fat Boy Roasters in Tijeras, NM had just recently expanded his roasting facilities and had a 300 square foot front room he wasn't using and apporached me about subleasing the space from him to run a small walk up coffee shop.  I inherited a beautiful Espresso Machine and grinder from a friend in Denver and have been working on the space since early June.  We have accomplished a lot of work in the past two months, installed the machines, plumbing, painting, installed a new counter, purchased a POS and register system and are getting extremely close to being able to put in for our business license for my dream, my baby Muskrat Coffee.  

I will be the sole propietor and owner/operator of Muskrat Coffee and have over the summer dumped my entire savings, my Starbucks Stocks and even my parents Bank of America stocks into this dream.  I am so close and now the final sprint in almost at hand for getting the transition of this Muskrat from frolicking days down America's railroads and backroads to running his own small coffeeshop.  

As Sir ernest Shackelton has taught me, when time are tough, Grin and bear it, growl and go and you will make it.  Muskrat Coffee will open this fall and by golly I will make it happen.  

 

 

Here is ia concise list of materials and the final start up costs I have calculated that will be needed in order to get my doors open.

15 pounds of coffee at 8.5 a pound

5 pounds of Espresso at 9 dollars a pound

2 pounds of decaf espresso at 9 dollars a pound

 

1 commerical box of black lids at 45 dollars

1 commerical box of 12 oz paper cups at 82 dollars

1 commerical box of 16 oz paper cups at 85 dollars

6 bottles of Monin Syrups (vanilla, sugar free Vanilla, Hazelnut, strawberry, peppermint and amaretto)

1 bottle of Mocha, White Mocha and Caramel sauce

1 box of sweet and low, 1 box of sugar, 1 box of sugar in the raw and 1 box of honey packets

35 dollar business license fee

Business insurance policy at 44$ a month

Large 4 by 8 sign for the roof of the building

Open LED sign for window

Possible LED Exit sign for front door depending on the building inspector

Chalkboard for menu 

Small display plate for Lee's homemade scone of the day and shortbread of the day!

first months rent 350

internet for POS system 40 dollars

 

Other Ways You Can Help

I would also appreciate any and all advertizing help, handing out fliers, help painting a sign, logo design, and warm bodies to come out once we open to fill up the parking lot and make this dream a reality.  Any suggestions and help i adore.

And that’s all there is to it.

story:
Please visit our blog for the full story behind our plans for The Barefoot Bus for easy-access maternity care!

When I began midwifery school, my pie-in-the-sky dream was to have a mobile easy access clinic to provide prenatal care to low income and at-risk families. We have so many women who want and NEED quality midwifery care but face barriers such as transportation and accessibility to that care. I knew I needed to make the quality care a midwife provides accessible to the families that need it and deserve it!  

Through some beautiful and unbelievable serendipty, I found the amazing Jeff and Kelly Halldorson who live on a converted bus, traveling across the country as they learn and adventure with their unschooling teenagers. They were the perfect people to help us transform an old blood mobile into our dream, The Barefoot Bus.

THE FRONT END OF THE BUS BEFORE:

IN PROGRESS:

I am taking my exam in August to become a Certified Professional Midwife, and upon my passing will become a Florida Licensed Midwife. Once my licensure process is complete we will begin taking the bus out into the community 1-2 days per week to see women for prenatal visits. We are hoping to connect with our local Healthy Start Coalition, local churches, and public women's health services to make them aware of where the bus will be situated for visits each week and how they may go about referring people for care. Women will be able to access information on women's health, pregnancy, early childhood health, find assistance with applying for Medicaid if needed, and of course be seen for prenatal and/or postpartum care. No births will take place on the bus. We will continue to serve women who are good candidates for homebirth, but provide women who desire a hospital birth with excellent prenatal care and a doula to accompany them to the hospital. They would then see the on-call physician or nurse midwife at the hospital of their choice--the same way they might if they were to receive care at a public clinic or health department. 

In order to make such a large scale community project come to life we have to have supporters. We still have the final pull to make the bus operational. Normal maintence, the stocking of supplies, and the finishing touches.

Did you have the awesome care of a midwife during your pregnancy? A great outcome because of it? Help share that with another family! Help us reach hundreds of families and start the pendulum of birth care swing in the more positive direction. We have started this funding campaign with lots of awesome incentives for our supporters. Everything from funny bumper stickers, in-home massages, all the way to adding your company's logo to the bus to be seen all across Tampa Bay! Our funding goal is $10,000- with every bit of that going into the bus. We are setting our sights high, and hoping that you can help make this very important vision come to life. 

Even if you cannot donate, we appreciate you spreading the word about this project with your friends, family, colleagues, and clients! 

Feel free to contact us with any questions you have--we are all so excited to share our vision with you! 

 

Love, 

Charlie Rae & The Barefoot Family

story:
Sponsor a Special Surfer- OR 50 of them!

What is Special Surfer Night?

Special Surfer Night is a program that happens every 3rd Tuesday of June, July and August where we take kids with special needs out surfing.  We have kids on the Autism Spectrum, kids and young adults with Down’s syndrome, a young man with Dubowitz syndrome, you name it. We take anyone who feels like the program is a good fit.

 

Who are the people behind Special Surfer Night?

To start with, Maureen Dow, our local connection to the Autism/Asperger community. Nanci Boutet, owner of Aquaholics Surf Shop AND, most of all, the HUNDREDS of volunteers. We are nearing the 1,000 volunteer mark. Once you’ve come to help with this event, wild horses can’t keep you away.

 

How did it start?

Aquaholics was still a small surf shop in 2 tiny adjoining apartments with 5 soft rental boards when my friend Maureen Dow called to ask if we would take a few of her “kiddos” out surfing. She had heard about a program out West and thought we should try it. THANKS MAUREEN!

In that 1st year, we had 3 surfers. That was 2005. Last year, in 2012, we had 92 kids signed up.

 

How does it work?

We try to have 2 volunteers for each Special Surfer. One (preferably) surfer and one (no skill needed) “catcher”. The surfer volunteer has control of the Special Surfer (we call them “Surfer Dudes”) and the board. They provide the timing, balance and skill set needed to (hopefully) keep the “drinks from the firehose” to a minimum. The “catcher” waits for the Surfer Dudes to finish their rides at the shore and redirects the Surfer Dude back out to the waiting surfer volunteer. We need to keep the mayhem to a minimum with HUNDREDS of people in the water, so 2 volunteers are essential.  We ask the parents to relax and socialize with other parents of these great kids on shore and “leave the driving to us”.

 

Why do we need money?

Last year, we had open registration. In June we had 50 kids. Those kids had a blast and told everyone they saw. In July we had 75 kids. THEY had a blast and told everyone THEY saw. In August we had 92 kids registered. Even with begging and borrowing every soft board and SUP (thanks to the other shops and SUP tour companies), we still came up short and had to run shifts.  Well, that got VERY confusing. Think of 92 special needs kids and their parents and volunteers putting on and taking off wetsuits, then putting on WET wetsuits (hard enough to get into DRY), then finding an available board and two volunteers left over from the first shift, well you get the picture.

 

That’s where you come in!

This year, each month, we have registration capped at 35.  All 3 nights are full. We have a lot of disappointed parents and kids. We don’t like to disappoint these kids. It makes us sad. We at Aquaholics would like to open registration so that every kid who wants to surf can sign up! To do that, we need to buy 50 more boards, leashes and wetsuits, AND a shed to put it all in (these things don’t disappear between sessions). We’ll probably get a trailer if we get more than we strive for but that’s just frosting on the cake.  We’ll buy as much equipment as we can and open as many spots for kids to register as we get funding for. No matter how much we get, we’ll take as many kids on as we can afford! Help us out!

 

What are these awards about?

These are goods and services given by people who have seen this program in action. Some are our friends, some are total strangers who have seen Special Surfer Night on the news, in the paper or heard about it from participants. Barbara Bush nominated us for the “Thousand Points of Light Award” after seeing us while she was having her evening walk. You CAN’T miss us. We take the place by storm!

You are not “buying” these awards, these are our way of saying thank you for supporting our program. The tiers are not so much the value of the goods and services, they are our special way of showing appreciation for your “volunteering” effort (we know you worked for this!). Some of us can afford a lot, some of us can just say “yes, I’m in”. All of these people giving these awards are giving a little piece if their hearts-what they do in this life to get by. They are offering you their gratitude.

 

What do you get for your generosity?

This is not a tax deductible “donation”. This is a sponsorship. This is something you do for many reasons. To get the ultimate warm and fuzzy, to help a kid who rarely “fits in” to be part of the “Cool Kids Club”, to create havoc for three nights at the beach (a HUGE plus if you’re an Anarchist!) and to give these parents a little break from their busy day.  Most of all, your Karma will get a big boost!

 

How long will your sponsorship effect the program?

The wetsuits last a year or two, it’s the nature of the rubber and the wear and tear from tugging and pulling on the suit. Sometimes they last a couple of years, sometimes they last a few wears. The boards last several years. We use the best boards we have found. Global Surf Industries Gnaraloo Soft tops. These are the best riding, best lasting and safest “softies”. The leashes, they’re like the suits they wear out fast. The shed? Yeah, that’s gonna last a few decades at least!

 

What else can you do?

Well, you can come watch, help, SHARE on facebook, twitter, email. Please spread the word! These parents and friends of the Surfer Dudes thank me with all their hearts and I want to thank THEM for sharing their great “kiddos”. I can tell you- this is my favorite part of the summer, and it will be yours too! And I LOVE summer!

* All of the perks levels above $500 get their name or web address on a board.
story_txt:
Sponsor a Special Surfer- OR 50 of them!
What is Special Surfer Night?
Special Surfer Night is a program that happens every 3rd Tuesday of June, July and August where we take kids with special needs out surfing.  We have kids on the Autism Spectrum, kids and young adults with Down’s syndrome, a young man with Dubowitz syndrome, you name it. We take anyone who feels like the program is a good fit.
 
Who are the people behind Special Surfer Night?
To start with, Maureen Dow, our local connection to the Autism/Asperger community. Nanci Boutet, owner of Aquaholics Surf Shop AND, most of all, the HUNDREDS of volunteers. We are nearing the 1,000 volunteer mark. Once you’ve come to help with this event, wild horses can’t keep you away.
 
How did it start?
Aquaholics was still a small surf shop in 2 tiny adjoining apartments with 5 soft rental boards when my friend Maureen Dow called to ask if we would take a few of her “kiddos” out surfing. She had heard about a program out West and thought we should try it. THANKS MAUREEN!
In that 1st year, we had 3 surfers. That was 2005. Last year, in 2012, we had 92 kids signed up.
 
How does it work?
We try to have 2 volunteers for each Special Surfer. One (preferably) surfer and one (no skill needed) “catcher”. The surfer volunteer has control of the Special Surfer (we call them “Surfer Dudes”) and the board. They provide the timing, balance and skill set needed to (hopefully) keep the “drinks from the firehose” to a minimum. The “catcher” waits for the Surfer Dudes to finish their rides at the shore and redirects the Surfer Dude back out to the waiting surfer volunteer. We need to keep the mayhem to a minimum with HUNDREDS of people in the water, so 2 volunteers are essential.  We ask the parents to relax and socialize with other parents of these great kids on shore and “leave the driving to us”.
 
Why do we need money?
Last year, we had open registration. In June we had 50 kids. Those kids had a blast and told everyone they saw. In July we had 75 kids. THEY had a blast and told everyone THEY saw. In August we had 92 kids registered. Even with begging and borrowing every soft board and SUP (thanks to the other shops and SUP tour companies), we still came up short and had to run shifts.  Well, that got VERY confusing. Think of 92 special needs kids and their parents and volunteers putting on and taking off wetsuits, then putting on WET wetsuits (hard enough to get into DRY), then finding an available board and two volunteers left over from the first shift, well you get the picture.
 
That’s where you come in!
This year, each month, we have registration capped at 35.  All 3 nights are full. We have a lot of disappointed parents and kids. We don’t like to disappoint these kids. It makes us sad. We at Aquaholics would like to open registration so that every kid who wants to surf can sign up! To do that, we need to buy 50 more boards, leashes and wetsuits, AND a shed to put it all in (these things don’t disappear between sessions). We’ll probably get a trailer if we get more than we strive for but that’s just frosting on the cake.  We’ll buy as much equipment as we can and open as many spots for kids to register as we get funding for. No matter how much we get, we’ll take as many kids on as we can afford! Help us out!
 
What are these awards about?
These are goods and services given by people who have seen this program in action. Some are our friends, some are total strangers who have seen Special Surfer Night on the news, in the paper or heard about it from participants. Barbara Bush nominated us for the “Thousand Points of Light Award” after seeing us while she was having her evening walk. You CAN’T miss us. We take the place by storm!
You are not “buying” these awards, these are our way of saying thank you for supporting our program. The tiers are not so much the value of the goods and services, they are our special way of showing appreciation for your “volunteering” effort (we know you worked for this!). Some of us can afford a lot, some of us can just say “yes, I’m in”. All of these people giving these awards are giving a little piece if their hearts-what they do in this life to get by. They are offering you their gratitude.
 
What do you get for your generosity?
This is not a tax deductible “donation”. This is a sponsorship. This is something you do for many reasons. To get the ultimate warm and fuzzy, to help a kid who rarely “fits in” to be part of the “Cool Kids Club”, to create havoc for three nights at the beach (a HUGE plus if you’re an Anarchist!) and to give these parents a little break from their busy day.  Most of all, your Karma will get a big boost!
 
How long will your sponsorship effect the program?
The wetsuits last a year or two, it’s the nature of the rubber and the wear and tear from tugging and pulling on the suit. Sometimes they last a couple of years, sometimes they last a few wears. The boards last several years. We use the best boards we have found. Global Surf Industries Gnaraloo Soft tops. These are the best riding, best lasting and safest “softies”. The leashes, they’re like the suits they wear out fast. The shed? Yeah, that’s gonna last a few decades at least!
 
What else can you do?
Well, you can come watch, help, SHARE on facebook, twitter, email. Please spread the word! These parents and friends of the Surfer Dudes thank me with all their hearts and I want to thank THEM for sharing their great “kiddos”. I can tell you- this is my favorite part of the summer, and it will be yours too! And I LOVE summer!
* All of the perks levels above $500 get their name or web address on a board.

story:
↑   WATCH THE VIDEO  ↑   

DON JUAN TEQUILA

Don Juan, the eternal myth, has become a living legend of the amorous male seduction, the irresistible conquistador that makes pleasure the end of all his actions. Don Juan was the protégé of the powerful Marques de la Mota, who teaches him among many things, the appreciation of fine spirits and the seduction of women.

From this living legend comes Don Juan Tequila, the finest distilled Blue Agave Tequilana Weber that is more than a spirit, it’s the representation of an entire culture, an understanding of tradition, food, music and the Art of Seduction. It is our commitment to continue the teachings of the Marques de la Mota and bring to the world the appreciation of the finest tequila ever produced and a complete seduction of your spirit. 

 
 

Art, Food, Music and Culture

The Don Juan Tequila experience is a guided tour of pairing spirit, food, music and art. Our website will include recommended listening music, masterful and seductive recipes to pair with any one of our fine sipping tequila, as well as images of historical and vintage art and photography of the tequila culture in Mexico and around the world.

Indiegogo

To accomplish the launch of Don Juan Tequila we need to raise $40,000 or more within a 30-day time period through Indiegogo contributions.

How Indiegogo Works

Indiegogo is a funding platform for creative projects. Everything from films, games, music, food to art, design, and technology. Indiegogo is full of ambitious, innovative and imaginative projects that are brought to life through the direct support of others.

Indiegogo will charge your card and/or collect your Paypal contributions and disburse the money to us when we reach the $40,000 goal by the deadline.

The money will be used as follows:

 

               Bottles, labels and packaging costs

               Distillation and manufacturing process

               Shipping; custom brokers, licensed warehousing in the U.S.

               Distribution costs

In recognition of your generosity, we’ve created a number of perks that you will certainly enjoy as well as the pleasure of knowing that you were part of the creation of this great new tequila.

Help us reach our goal, click the "Contribute Now' button and let’s all kick off Don Juan Tequila!

Fermentation process

Process of Making Don Juan Tequila

Don Juan Tequila is a fine sipping baroque tequila made from 100% Blue Agave Tequilana Weber and produced in Amatitan, Jalisco the birthplace of tequila and officially recognized in 1769, by the Real Audiencia (Royal Court) of Guadalajara, as the principal manufacturing center of “vino mezcal” the name used to describe the distilled agave spirit before it was known as tequila.

Piña Selection

Our careful selection of perfectly matured eight year-old Blue Agave gives us simply the best possible ripe piña that will, in turn, create the richest natural sugars that, after the fermentation and distillation process, will produce untamed and seductive alcohol that will be finessed and spirited into the elegant creation of Don Juan Tequila Silver, Reposado and Añejo.

Cooking process

Many mass-producing tequila distilleries use modern stainless steel ovens to cook their piñas. Don Juan Tequila piñas are cooked using an earth- stone oven; a traditional method that guarantees a more ardent and direct flavorful tequila.

Fermentation

Once the agave has been carefully cooked it goes through a milling process to extract the agua-miel which is the sap or juice containing all the sugar that, after the fermentation process will turn into pure and raw alcohol. To complement the traditional earth-stone cooking method, the fermentation process is also performed using an all natural open air process with a long  slow fermentation period to produce a more natural intense flavor.

Distillation

The process continues when the spirit is moved from the fermentation vats to the unique stainless steel alambiques (stills) used for the distillation process. Many distilleries will run their spirit through a third distillation process. However, this method, many times, robs the tequila from its intentional purpose and integrity. Don Juan Tequila is distilled twice like many fine whiskeys or vodkas, giving the connoisseur the baroque experience of the whole process and the enjoyment of a smooth, refined and seductive spirit.

Aging

The Art of Seduction begins with Don Juan Tequila Silver which is the purest tequila in its noblest form. Traditionally, blanco or silver tequila has been reserved or used as a shot drink or as part of a mixed cocktail. However, our Master Distiller designed and crafted the Don Juan Tequila Silver to be savored and enjoyed as a fine sipping tequila, as consumed for centuries in its birthplace, Mexico. 

 For our aged tequilas, Don Juan Tequila Reposado and Don Juan Tequila Añejo, the Art of Seduction continues, as our Master Distiller orchestrates his aging artistry employing used American bourbon oak barrels to give the spirit its carefully crafted baroque characteristics as manifested by the final product’s rich color, aromatic bouquet and multi-layered flavors. Our aged tequilas were also designed and crafted to be enjoyed as a fine sipping tequila, as an aperitif or digestive, neat, chilled, on crushed ice, or whatever your pleasure demands. Don Juan Tequila is a complete experience, as we will guide you with recommended food pairings, recipes and even music to fully exploit your encounter and pleasure of a bottle of Don Juan Tequila.

THANK YOU FOR YOUR SUPPORT!!!

-  Familia Mota

THANK YOU FOR YOUR SUPPORT!!!
-  Familia Mota

story:
Let's bring back the joy - and skill - of cooking.

Plantz St. will be a local hot spot for people to come learn about a plant-based diet and build their kitchen skills. With demos and hands-on training, students will learn how to prepare plant-based meals and desserts so it's easy and maximizes flavor.

Please support us in getting started with our first location in Santa Rosa, CA opening Fall 2015, and building the infrastructure to expand nationwide. Plantz St. New York City is already in early development.

The Plantz St. Open House is just around the corner!!! You're invited to join us October 18, 2015 from 2:00-5:00pm. Classes start October 20, 2015.

Click here to see the class schedule and get a seat in a Plantz St. cooking class!


Most Americans either forgot, or never learned how to cook with healthy, whole foods.

Traditionally, how to cook was passed down from generation to generation, but this stopped decades ago when we became a fast food nation.

With these habits and our highly processed food system, of course we're in a healthcare crisis.

But honestly... without culinary knowledge and skill, it's only logical that Americans depend heavily on restaurants and convenience foods.


Unfortunately, most who did learn to cook are only skilled with animal-based foods and their go-to seasonings are oil, sugar and salt.

Most cooks are not comfortable preparing whole plant foods.


We Cook With Plantz To...

As the United Nations reported in 2010, it is essential for our health and the planet that we eat primarily a plant-based diet. This means primarily of whole plant foods, including vegetables, whole grains, legumes, fruits, nuts and seeds.

Animal products, including meat, dairy and eggs, are often avoided. If they are used, they're treated like condiments. At least 90-95% of the calories should come from whole plant foods.

"The future is about a plant-based diet" - Jamie Oliver

It's much more of a lifestyle than a "diet", and it's not black and white. Any consumption of plant foods is helping to improve your health and make the world a better place for us and future generations.

In our culinary gym you'll learn how to easily prepare delicious plant-based dishes. 


Wait... What is a Culinary Gym?

A culinary gym is a place designed to build kitchen skills and the ability to prepare whole foods with the intention to improve and maintain physical fitness and health.

Imagine it.

When you walk in, it feels peaceful like a yoga studio, but fresh like a farmer’s market with a variety of food and color. The smells make your mouth water.

The class allows you to explore new foods and it works your creative muscles. You feel a sense of connection to the food, your body, and the other cooks.

When you leave you feel energized like you just had an amazing workout, and you're inspired to fuel your body with only the best foods.

When you get home you feel more comfortable in the kitchen and excited knowing that you can make healthy, plant-based meals your family will love. You won't be surprised when they request seconds.



Our Classes Improve Appearance & Performance.

Let's break it down:

1) Preparing meals and desserts from scratch is a calorie-burning activity. By making this activity part of our daily lives, we could easily increase the amount of calories we burn each day, even if we can't get in a traditional workout.

2) Preparing whole food meals requires muscle and it strengthens our muscles. Simply standing in the kitchen for 30-90 minutes utilizes your core. Without good posture and engaging the right muscles, you'll start to experience back pain. Chopping involves the arm, shoulder and core. Good strength is essential for the citrus press, salad spinner, spiralizer and the list goes on. Furthermore, the creativity, math and planning involved with cooking is strengthening our minds.

3) Eating a whole food, plant-based diet is building our fitness by promoting a healthy weight and provides optimal nutrition so we can perform at our best. It also limits consumption of excess cholesterol, salt, unhealthy fats, and refined sugar.

4) The motivating culture and social influence at a gym is ideal for bringing new people, influencing behavior change, and raising dopamine levels so people return regularly. We expect this to be effective in creating a local community around a plant-based diet. We also believe the culinary gym will attract more young people, allowing them to experience a plant-based way and learn how to prepare whole foods before becoming sick and overweight.

"The fastest way to toned abs is preparing AND eating delicious plant foods." - Katie Mae



What Will You Receive For Donating?


The Chocolate Cake + Carrot Cake  |  $15


The e-Cookbooks  |  $25


The Exclusive Friday Recipes  |  $50

You will receive two new delicious and nutritious recipes from me every Friday for an entire year. What makes these recipes so special is that they're hot out of Katie Mae's (my) kitchen. I put extra care into making at least two new recipes every week, but they're usually not available for the public for several weeks or often months later if they're intended for a cookbook. By signing up for the Exclusive Friday Recipes you'll be the first to see and taste these flavorful dishes.


10 Cooking Demo Videos  |  $100



License for Plantz 8-Wk Curriculum  |  $100

By licensing the curriculum you can use my lessons and recipes in your classes. Offer individual classes or a multi-week training at a cost or for free. Start the classes in your home, a community center, or rent a space.

The license includes a discount the future training and certification for becoming a Plantz St. Culinary Coach.


The 8 Weekly Trainings
1)  Kitchen Cleanse & Set-Up
2)  Knife Skills & Veggie Variety
3)  All-Star Salads & Dressings
4)  Grain Essentials
5)  Legume Essentials
6)  Super Soups with Herbs & Spices
7)  Tofu & Tempeh Made Tasty
8)  Plant-Based Milk, Cream & Cheese

For each weekly lesson you'll receive a teacher’s guide, a grocery list, and equipment list, student handouts, and a mini quiz.


The Online Plantz Culinary Boot Camp  |  $130+

For more information, go to plantzbootcamp.com.


License for Plantz 16-Wk Curriculum  |  $150

By licensing the curriculum you can use my lessons and recipes in your classes. Offer individual classes or a multi-week training at a cost or for free. Start the classes in your home, a community center, or rent a space.

The license includes a discount the future training and certification for becoming a Plantz St. Culinary Coach.


The 16 Weekly Trainings Include 8 Lessons Above, PLUS: 

9)   The Pleasure Trap Solution
10)   Ultimate Success System
11)   Substituting Made Simple
12)  Blend. Juice. Cream.
13)  Fermentation 101
14)  Smart, Sexy Sauces
15)  Pasta, Tacos & Wraps
16)  Whole Food Sweetness

For each weekly lesson you'll receive a teacher’s guide, a grocery list, and equipment list, student handouts, and a mini quiz.



About Katie Mae

Katie Mae is the founder of Plantz St. She's a Nutritionist and a Culinary Coach teaching how to make a plant-based diet easy, healthy, and delicious so that it’s  sustainable and enjoyed.

Katie Mae holds Master of Science in Nutrition from Bastyr University, a Bachelors in Human Biology from Michigan State University, and has completed the Rouxbe Plant-based Culinary Certification.

Since 2011, Katie Mae’s been teaching weekly at TrueNorth Health Center, and working with Dr. McDougall’s Health & Medical Center. She’s also a contributor to the Forks Over Knives website, the Food Revolution Network, and the Plant-Based Nutrition Support Group.

Katie Mae is the creator of the Plantz Culinary Boot Camp, an online plant-based cooking course and the Plantz eCookbook Series. You can find her recipes and trainings at PlantBasedKatie.com.

Thank you Plantz St. sponsors for your support! We're more powerful together.

story:
About this project

 

Finding customers to pay you (even if you don't know where to start)? Build a brand? Market your business? Or are you just looking to attract more customers?

The rules of the game have changed — there has never been a better time in history to start or be building a business.

But with so much noise on what it takes to attract customers, build a brand, target the right audience and market a successful business, it’s so hard to know who to follow and what to trust.

And it just so happened that we've interviewed them, wrote everything down and we've been working away to put it all together for people like you.

The Ultimate Guide To Attract Customers is a step by step guide that contains nothing but actionable tips, strategies, systems and advice from booked solid stylists, barbers and entrepreneurs.

(Share our Indiegogo Campaign!)

The Ultimate Guide To Attract Customers features comprehensive chapters covering everything from finding customers to pay you (even if you don't know where to start), building a brand, marketing your business, attracting customers and more from game-changing stylists, barbers and entrepreneurs-- we're not talking a simple marketing guide or book like you find in the bookstore: we've broken it down to deliver the stuff you actually need to know from the $5,000 marketing workshop. 

For years, we have interviewed hundreds of successful stylists and barbers, plus we have invested heavily in many marketing workshops. We've compiled the best tips, strategies and systems to share with you.

Find out why and how the best beauty professionals in the world got to where they are today. We take a  look at not only stylists and barbers, but other beauty professionals that have game changing marketing systems. We found out those marketing systems for you, those systems that made them what they are today.

As a stylist, barber or entrepreneur your most important resource is time - and you can't be wasting time it at hair shows and searching through hours and hours of content to find what's right for you. We've done all the hard work and compiled all the important information from over the years, hundreds of interviews and the $5,000 Mastermind Workshop.

We want to give you access to the same lessons, systems and strategies that have led to their success. We learned that most had about the same skill set, but the #1 thing that set the average from the extraordinary was their marketing and branding. 

"The Ultimate Guide To Attracting Customers: how to build your brand, how to target your audience, how to market your business... This is the perfect guide for the new generation of beauty professionals on social media. Social Media will not attract customers to your business like the strategies and systems in this guide. I highly recommend checking out this guide - an invaluable resource to help get your business to a very profitable level."

-David "DL" Hiland, Two Time World Barber Champion / Bronner Brothers

  

"If you're looking for a great resource to learn how to actually attract more customers and brand yourself, The Ultimate Guide To Attract Customers is where you should invest your time."

-Kim Kimble, Celebrity Hair Stylist/Founder K2 Beauty Products

 

As Seen On Barbershopconnect- "if you are a barber or stylist looking to learn how build your business, brand yourself and attract more customers - check out The Ultimate Guide To Attract Customers."

Barbershopconnect

For over a year our team has been working diligently to bring this guide to life. We've spared no expense in making sure we deliver the best reading/learning experience.

We've painstakingly taken all the tips, systems and strategies for attracting customers, we've finalized the manuscript and we've carefully crafted the design layout - there's only one thing left to do:

Your support will help support the cosmetology and barber programs for men and women who are incarcerated. When they are released into society they will have a trade to help them succeed like Uchendi Nwani.

EXCLUSIVE to Indiegogo only. 

Risks and challenges

To get straight to the point, the risks are low. We've been working tirelessly on this project for over 13 months now to make sure that all we need do is get the manuscript to the printer and we can start printing. We have sourced a printer, but you never know what could go wrong with printing complications out of our hand.

We have created a network of incredibly talented and knowledgeable people around us to help fill in any gaps we might have. 

We promise to make sure that we are as open and as transparent as possible when it comes to this campaign. We love our community and we'll do everything possible to do right by you and make sure that you're kept in the loop about the progression of the project.

We've painstakingly taken all the tips, systems and strategies for attracting customers, we've finalized the manuscript and we've carefully crafted the design layout - there's only one thing left to do:


Your support will help support the cosmetology and barber programs for men and women who are incarcerated. When they are released into society they will have a trade to help them succeed like Uchendi Nwani.


EXCLUSIVE to Indiegogo only. 










Risks and challenges
To get straight to the point, the risks are low. We've been working tirelessly on this project for over 13 months now to make sure that all we need do is get the manuscript to the printer and we can start printing. We have sourced a printer, but you never know what could go wrong with printing complications out of our hand.
We have created a network of incredibly talented and knowledgeable people around us to help fill in any gaps we might have. 
We promise to make sure that we are as open and as transparent as possible when it comes to this campaign. We love our community and we'll do everything possible to do right by you and make sure that you're kept in the loop about the progression of the project.

story:
Hey yall,

Nauoda and Mel very sadly got evicted from their co-op in Regent and will be having to move in December.  Cuz of sooo many reasons this is really tough and they need our love n support.  Mel just moved 5 seconds ago, it is mad hard to pack n move with chronic pain, plus also hard to pack n move with a baby.


We would like to fund-raise money to help pay for

  • Packers to pack their personal belongings
  • People to do childcare during packing/moving times
  • Movers to move items and furniture 


Chippin in with packing and moving costs would be a huuuge help for these 2 and hopefully help to make the move feel more manageable, so if you can please donate.


If you are low on funds yourself please consider re-posting, using the Indiegogo share tool, or donating a perk if you have a skill or art or something to donate.  <3 <3 <3

story:
Short Summary

  • Unleash the power of groups and never miss any update from people across all networks.

  • Paths may be different but we stay connected to know them closely.

  • App is in the vision of creating the best social network management tool by providing custom tailored social feeds by filtering the unwanted feeds as per user preference.

  • App integrates multiple social networks like Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, LinkedIn, Tumblr, Google+ and YouTube into a single application and allow users to create groups like family, friends, celebrities by adding your friends to that group.

  • User can view feeds from all social networks posted by friends from that group through seamless scrolling.


  • App also allows user to post new status/updates to all the networks or individual networks at a time.

  • Apart from feeds/status posted by friends user can also see his own activities across all his connected networks.


What We Need & What You Get

  • We are in the final stage of completion of our dream project which has been in development for more than 8 months.

  • All the contributions made will directly go to development process of the application.

  • We are in urgent need of funds to complete the final stage development of app, Website and other works related to submission of app to their respective stores(iOS and Android in Phase 1).

  • For all your valuable contributions we promise to give you an excellent app with futuristic design and quality.

  • We have created perks so that you get back your money in the form of feature unlocks within our app and also get into our proud list of contributors in our Website and App.

The Impact

  • Each contribution made by you will boost our development and its related costs.

  • We don't have any backup from anyone and are in a need to sustain our life by achieving this dream which we are working day and night since months.

  • You can see the hard work and effort we have put in getting these designs out, this floating design is the proof of our determination and hard work towards the product. Same effort is going towards the development as well.

  • Please help us in achieving our goal.


Risks & Challenges

Risks is one of the common factor when you want to achieve anything.

  • We had many iterations of design and development to achieve what we have now.

  • App is designed for iOS and Android where the major risk is to have same user experience in both the platform.

  • App supports Android OS 4.0+ and iOS 7.0+.

  • Since it involves processing large number of feeds we need to keep track of performance as well. So that user gets same performance as that of native app.


Other Ways You Can Help

  • If you really like our concept please do provide your contact information like Email, Etc.  so that we will get in touch with you and let you know the development and other information related to app.

  • You can also spread a word about our app across the social networks and invite your friends when the app is live.

  • Let us know if you want to help us review the app before it goes live.

  • Didn't like our concept? Tell us why and provide your valuable feedback on how we can improve the same.

Update

Our application supports native ads and you don't have to worry about its placement and also any sort of Ads blindness. We assure that Ads placed are seen by the users.


Contact Us

Didn't like our Perks contact us at jay@logoon.me or glasslotech@gmail.com and let us know how you can help us. This includes investment options and also share/equity options in our product

story:
Who are we?

We are Team Birrell Rickham part of the British Sailing Team. The team is made up of Niki Birrell and Alexandra Rickham and we have sailed together for 8.5 years. In that time we have won a Bronze medal at the London 2012 Paralympics, 5 x World Championships and a European Championship.

We were so proud to get the opportunity to represent ParalympicsGB at a Home Games but still left wanting to get our hands on a Gold Medal! This goal has driven us to continue along the Road to Rio 2016. In March we gained selection for the Games. With 100 days left, we need your help for the final push to top the podium in September.

The SKUD18 is a particularly exciting Paralympic class. It is the high performance class! It is the only Paralympic boat to sail under 3 sails (big colourful spinnaker so we can always be seen) so when the breeze is blowing we get to have the most fun and go fast. The SKUD also has the biggest diversity requirements in the Paralympic fleet, with each boat having to have a female and a sailor with a high level of disability.

SO IMAGINE YOU GET TO BE PART OF SOMETHING WHICH IS FUN, INCLUSIVE AND HOPEFULLY GOLDEN. 


What We Need

£4OOO BIG ONES
To help with our final training camp costs in Rio before the Paralympics. This will include flights, accommodation and venue costs.


How Will This Help?

Rio is one of the most difficult sailing venues. With big mountains and tide, time on Guanabara Bay's water is imperative. With your help we will be able to gain a better understanding of what is needed to win on the complicated seas of this amazing city.

story:
A Quick Introduction

In 2013, a group of Notre Dame graduate students visited the rural Guatemalan village of Rio Negro, in Baja Verapaz Department, Guatemala. Rio Negro experienced horrific violence in 1980 and 1982 at the hands of military and civil patrols. Survivors were forced to flee to the surrounding fragile hillsides to endure years of isolation and danger. Many survivors were later relocated to a nearby settlement at Pacux - the community's case has been taken before the InterAmerican Court of Human Rights.

Many members of the community have returned to their land, though now mostly flooded by the Chixoy river dam. Unfortunately, their relative isolation and diminished population make self-sufficiency difficult to sustain. With their arable land largely now flooded, they live with little food security. Still, the community is full of hope, and it has miraculously forgiven the neighboring Xococ community that perpetrated the massacres.  With international support, they have also created an historical memory center to house visitors to the village. The center more formally gives the village a venue to tell the story of the violence that befell their community during the Guatemalan civil war. The center is part and parcel of the community’s efforts to pursue justice for those who committed the atrocities, reparation for lost land and harm done to the community, and international human rights recognition. Also, with each visitor Rio Negro receives income.

The CGI graduate students visited the village to bear witness to Rio Negro’s story, to their testimony, and to begin forming relationships. We were all moved by the remarkable witness to faith and courage manifested by those we met. On the group’s last day in Rio Negro, one of the village elders, Don Cupertino, invited the Notre Dame graduate students to work with them to assist in their process of re-building their chapel in the community. The current chapel is dilapidated – its walls are falling in and it is unusable. It needs serious repair. The new Chapel will also serve as an important multi-use space in the village, too. Correspondingly, the community drew up architectural plans, a budget, and a three-phase construction plan. They have extended a generous invitation to us all to collaborate with them in the building process! Please help us to help this community that shared its story of pain and hope with us. Moving forward, our group has been fortunate enough to partner with World Care to coordinate getting funds to the community and its partner organization, CECEP (http://www.cecep.cosmosmaya.info/menu_04.htm). World Care will be a tremendous partner on the project moving forward!

What We Need 

The CGI group did a family and friends letter writing and petition campaign this spring and raised just under $4,000 for the first phase of construction. A more lengthy description of Phase 1 of the project can be found on our fundraising blog, rionegrochapel.wordpress.com - check it out! Construction has begun! On that webpage, you'll also find more formal design and budget documents, as well as the most up-to-date details on the construction project. The entire first phase will total to between $4,000-$4,500 when all is said and done, and the second phase will total to approximately $3,500. The pictures you see above are of the community working toward the completion of Phase 1. Included in the costs are building materials, transportation costs, construction advising fees, and wages for community members working on the project. There are also minor fees built into working with Indiegogo and World Care.  

Your donation here, in conjunction with other fundraising efforts, will be used to complete Phase 1 and to launch/complete Phase 2. The first phase of construction laid much of the elementary work for the Chapel - clearing and leveling the space, acquiring and transporting building materials, paying for engineering supervision, wages for the community, constructing the foundation and columns for the Chapel, and the beginning stages of constructing furniture for the Chapel (doors, pews, pulpit, and pews). You can see the Phase 1 expense report on our fundraising website (rionegrochapel.wordpress.com). The second phase will be to build the structure more formally and will include the construction of walls and top columns, the purchasing of 30% of the wooden beams and rulers for the roof, an additional 30% of engineering supervision costs, and 30% of the costs associated with wooden boards to construct the Chapel's furniture, windows, and door. Up-to-date construction schedules and progress can be found on our fundraising website. CGI student participants will also be engaging in local fundraising efforts throughout the Fall to assist in meeting the final, phase three funding goals.

    The Impact

    As one of our student participants said, "For the community at Rio Negro, the experience of healing has been one fraught with tribulations and difficulties, especially  due to the fact that the Guatemalan government has not prosecuted any of those who were involved in the massacres... In our discussions with community leaders in Rio Negro, we learned that their faith provided a source of solace and comfort as they worked to rebuild their lives and community.  Worship led them to a deeper encounter with God and enabled them to embrace forgiveness as a mode for healing.  Above all, it became evident to me that church is central to the ethos of this community.  Bearing this in mind, it seems only fitting that they have a space that is safe for them to gather, to worship God and to support one another in their journey of healing.  They need a church where they can be Church.”
    This project, which has been dreamt and planned by this community, is one that will contribute to the on-going healing and development of this courageous community. It will be a place for worship, for hospitality, and for healing. An in so being, is a project that will help empower the community in its courageous witness.

    As the community invited us fund raise, we extend the invitation to you - the invitation to be a neighbor with Rio Negro and to accompany one another on this journey.

      Other Ways You Can Help

      Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help. Here are some ways you can help:

      • Help get the word out through social media - help us to make some noise about the campaign!
      • Reach out to your friends and family personally about the campaign!
      • Use the Indiegogo share tools! 
      Thank you for stopping by!

  Other Ways You Can Help Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help. Here are some ways you can help:

Help get the word out through social media - help us to make some noise about the campaign!
Reach out to your friends and family personally about the campaign!
Use the Indiegogo share tools! 


Thank you for stopping by!

story:
Let's Build A Place To Climb!

Urbana Boulders is about being active and having fun. Our goal is to build a space that brings out the inner climber in all of us. A place you can hang out with your friends and family to just monkey around. A dedicated climbing facility right here in Champaign Urbana will broaden the bouquet of activities our community has to offer. 

By funding this project together we will build the area's only dedicated climbing facility and an all-around fun place to be! 

What We Need & What You Get

In order to offer the quality experience Urbana Boulders wants to provide, we need more capital to make key purchases, like quality climbing holds and a large, clean foam floor. $10,000 will help us make that happen and bring us closer to launching the facility we've been dreaming about. 

Best of all we are raising this money by selling you advanced discounted memberships and swag in the form of perks. You already know you are going to climb here, so help us out by buying your membership early. You save money and we get the tools we need to build this thing. These great prices will only be available now during this campaign.

WE KNOW you will support us and our goal will be no sweat for a vibrant community like ours. But, just in case we don't make our goal all of your contributions will be refunded. 

The Impact - What We Want To Be

Urbana Boulders wants to bring climbing to all of CU. Right now Urbana is in the middle of a climbing void, with the closest climbing facilities in Bloomington and Indianapolis. UB will change that, and will sponsor youth bouldering leagues and competition events to help connect our great communities.
 Climbing is growing in popularity, with gyms springing up across the nation **and right here in the midwest! We want to be the ones to introduce Urbana to climbing and offer veterans of the sport a familiar and superior experience. Your contribution will give us the help we need to craft the experience we know this area wants. 
This team, with roots right here in the midwest, knows how to get this done. We've spent hours upon hours upon hours in gyms across the globe and learning everything about building and operating a facility such as ours. 

Risks & Challenges

 Because Alex and Kris are not millionaires it has been impossible  rather difficult to secure any kind of bank loan against our zero collateral. So coming up with funding this far has been... challenging. We have had to come up with some creative solutions to get as far as we have, scaling back (nixed the full sauna and charmin ultra plush), opening later than we had hoped, finding friends in unexpected places. That said, we know that with your help we can bridge the funding gap and build something... well... awesome!

Other Ways You Can Help

So you believe in what we are trying to do? You want to help but just can't commit any funds? We understand. Hey, we're pretty broke too! Please help spread the word of Urbana Boulders. Tell your friends and family about us. Join team UB and Like our Facebook page. Use the sharing tools here on the IndieGoGo page and tell your social networks about us.
 Hey, If you can spare an afternoon swing on by our space at 1502 N Cunningham. We crave the encouragement and it warms our hearts to see people's excitement!
Let's build something together, something great!

A place you can hang out with your friends and family to just monkey around. By funding this project together we will build the area's only dedicated climbing facility and an all-around fun place to be!    What We Need & What You Get In order to offer the quality experience Urbana Boulders wants to provide, we need more capital to make key purchases, like quality climbing holds and a large, clean foam floor. $10,000 will help us make that happen and bring us closer to launching the facility we've been dreaming about. 
Best of all we are raising this money by selling you advanced discounted memberships and swag in the form of perks. story:
Olá everyone,

My name is Márcia,

I live in the beautiful Azorean island of S. Miguel with my husband Marco and our little girl, Joana.

Born and raised in this mid Atlantic archipelago, which has recently entered the top five islands destinations of the National Geographic traveler magazine, we are now asking for your support, and at the same time, inviting you to come and enjoy all about it!!

Nature is our biggest asset: lakes, walking trails, bird watching, dolphin and whale watching, caves, lava tunnels, sailing, canyoning, sport fishing and over 20 different healing hot springs in Just one place: Furnas. The perfect place for wellness tourism.

That’s where we plan to build two bungalows in a very nice location, just one step away of a fantastic hot spring site called “Poça da Dona Beija” http://www.pocadadonabeija.com

In order to do that we need to raise 80 000 euros (that’s about 100 000 dollars).

So, we ask for your help to reach that goal. In return we expect you to come, stay with us, discover the island and enjoy our rewards!

Even if we don’t reach our goal, your reward is guaranteed, it will not expire.

Let´s get to the rewards!!

-  Donations up to 100 $/€

25% discount on accommodation + Guided

walking trail around Furnas Lake


-  Donations from 101-500 $/€

  50% discount on accommodation + Guided walking trail around Furnas Lake + 2 tickets for "Poça da Dona Beija" + welcome basket


-  Donations from 501-1000 $/€

 75% discount on accommodation + Day sailing (or fishing) trip +  2 tickets for "Poça da Dona Beija" + welcome basket

-  Donations over 1001 $/€

One week free accommodation + Day sailing (or fishing) trip +  2 tickets for "Poça da Dona Beija" + welcome basket

Start planning your next vacation! We will be expecting you!

Help us!! Make it happen!!

story:
Short Summary

We are organic.hr, team of young enthusiast, with the vision of getting closer the Croatian folklore and unspoiled nature to all those eager of beautiful memories and liberation of accelerated stress in everyday life. 

We offer a wealth of Croatian treasure box through its coins of tradition. Gastronomic tastes, thrill of adventure activities, friendship and harmony accompanied by team building programs, the liberation of good feelings through a variety of substantive workshops for children and adults.

Confidence through personal approach to all wishes and requests, whether it's about organizing a wedding in the beauty of Croatian rural areas or small fine escape in the environmental oasis of Croatian rural haciendas ...

Let us co-create the good memories of travelers, the good tastes of organic food available to all those aware of meaning in getting in touch with nature treasure...the essence of life itself.
Your contribute is of the great meaning to us!! It is our essence in making this project more alive ...

What We Need; What You Get

For making it real we need to raise $ 94,750 USD more...We have invested all we have, our knowledge and all our money, but its simply not enough for expanding this project on the level where Organic.hr is supposed to be...

We plan to establish organic.hr as manufacture of good emotions, available world wide through our web site. Our logo, Edelweiss is a symbol of preserved nature beauty, specific for its numerous pistils, which makes it unique among all the flowers....that's what we are hoping to become with our organic.hr resort  Permuda, Adriatic pearl, situated as one of 1000 and one islands in Croatia. In this oasis of untouched nature we plan to tell a story kept by centuries old folklore. 

First chapter narrates about characters from our legends. Tree houses and traditional cottages, custom made by our carpenters, will be named after them, and its interior will be telling a whole legend. So every visitor will be able to choose a fairytale to escape to, from stressed up urban world. 


Organic farming of our traditional crop plants will narrate a second chapter of our little story. Chapter of life, its creation, and a bond between land and people, satisfaction of growth...

In next chapter we will explore the essence of life by various workshops like; organic cooking, art therapy, herbs collecting, natural cosmetics, bio dance and others that celebrate the joy of life.

Organic.hr resort represent a place where stress does not exist. Only happy faces, curious about the next chapter, witch is being held in our treasure box....Ready to discover them?


With your unselfish help and willingness to invest in our project, we are certain that we will achieve our goals.

In return, we will give to you the best value for your money, a little perk in our Croatian treasure box. Get your coin today!!!

The Impact

Organic.hr is a valuable project for sustainable environment, and for releasing a new forms of vacation to our little country. We are promoting anti stress workshops. handcrafts and all the knowledge of nature in close with people, you! Feel free to explore the beauty of work made by your hands. Don't know how? We will show you, among with other craftmakers from all around the Europe, our guests in our nature oasis where we are waiting...

Risks & Challenges

We are aware of all the obstacles in our way to success. First it was the bureaucracy of our country, which is in a small recovery process which lasts for 20 years now. But, we have overcome it. So, one obstacle down. In our way we have succeed to bring few more down. Only one left, is that we don't have anything left to invest. We put all in! But with this raising money for value, we are certain that if we achieve our goal, there will be no obstacles that could put us down.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cant help us with your donation, please spread the word out!!! And please don't forget to use Indiegogo share tools....thank you for your time and patience and see you soon ...somewhere in the woods of Permuda island in Croatia...

story:
Welcome! 

This campaign isn't all about chocolate - but  it IS about togetherness, joy, oxytocin and love!

Imagine you are stepping into your favourite new café… take off your boots and winter coat; take a load off. It’s warm in here, cozy and it feels like your second home.

Giacomo is preparing his signature drink for you – a chocolate Baby’s Breath surprise. 

                                         

What We Need 

We need $10,125 to pay our security deposit and the first month's rent when we sign the lease, and that is what this rent party campaign is all about. When each of you gives even ten dollars, you get a gift (a chocolate surprise). If you give more, more gifts - from a photo session to an original artwork to a sailboat dinner!

The Dream

Why don't you relax in one of those comfy armchairs with a book? Or will you sit and people watch? Over there is a lady you met last time, from Columbia. And there is your friend, but it looks like she’s talking to her partner. Can you smell the popcorn? Or the cinnamon buns? Or the grilled veggies …?

Or the pastries?

This wonderful cafe is coming soon to Montreal. It has been my dream for years now, and it looks like it is going to get real. Because I have finally FOUND A SPACE!! And it’s beautiful! We need to do some renovating - but we're good at that. 

Our café is not only for the mamas - Birth Companions also need a place where they can meet with each other or with their clients, or attend a workshop. Our community needs affordable office space and event venues. This cafe is the heart of our project, but MBC Doula School is the soul. I teach doulas about birth and doula work, and they provide volunteer doula services to the needy women we serve. I am really excited about being able to provide a space where we can teach and learn.  

New mothers need community! Montreal winters are so hard for some mothers, who find it difficult to get out. Others get out happily in the snow but need somewhere to go to meet their friends. Still more want to go to a class or a group so they can learn or get support. Then when spring finally arrives, everyone is out meeting their friends and families… but where to stop for a healthy lunch?

More than anything, and more than ever, we need a place where everyone is welcome and appreciated! Women from around the world, their babies and bellies, friends, teachers and their students can come and taste Giacomo's wonderful food, share experiences and knowledge, and create bonds that may last forever.

The Dreamer 

My name is Rivka, and I am passionate about birth and justice. I love to be with my friends, and I like to create comfortable spaces. I have renovated and lived in a medieval tower in Italy, a stone farmhouse, a restored stone shepherd's house and barn, a lovely 1950's bungalow... all of these places were inviting and warm for my friends and family.

Risks & Challenges

With anything in life, there are risks. I am risking a hefty sum of money to invest in starting up this space. I am looking for cheap or second hand kitchen equipment, and we are brainstorming ways to keep costs low. But I am passionate about this project and I believe it will become a reality. Women and their families need a space like this. I know it is a challenge. But I believe I can make it work - with your help!

Please contribute: even $10 is valuable and appreciated!

Share the campaign!

 Share the Love!

story:
Hi!  My name is  Kouame Yao, I was born and raised in Ivory Coast ( West Africa) . I moved to United States precisely to New York City when I was 18 years old. My wish was to live the American dream that I have seen a lot on  television  when I was growing up but that wasn't what happened . My first five years living in the city I struggled a lot. I had a hard time finding a job because my English was really bad. I could barely  afford to pay for rent and food, with the little savings that I had from back home. At the age of 25 I had the idea of becoming an entrepreneur but I didn't know exactly how that was going to  happen. One day through a job search , I had a proposition to be a cleaner in  an Italian restaurant. It's was overnight job and it was really hard. Even though, the job was hard, I learned two lessons. When you exceed other’s expectations and put forth a lot of effort, it leads to greater opportunities.  That overnight job turned into a full time job.  I had to work 8 hours a day , 6 days a week with a half-hour break. The job consisted of moving heavy couches and chairs around, cleaning and mopping the floor, clean the grill, windows, and rest rooms. I worked in the restaurant for one year and few months, until I was laid off from the recession.  When I got laid off, I knew that I needed to control my own destiny. The only way to do that was to take the plunge into entrepreneurship. That's when I decided to create my own cleaning service company called Es Eco Cleaning Service to become a professional cleaner because I knew that it would be better for me.  

When I first started to put ideas together, It was really frustrating  because I was  facing  many challenges such as, financial difficulties , keeping up with the market, planning ahead, solving problems and knowing the right systems. It wasn't easy for a beginner.


 The beginning of the company will have a huge impact on the community and society not only providing high cleaning maintenance in New York metro area  but also offering  job opportunities, and take it to a future  better than today. 


I am few steps away  from starting my company. I am therefore confronted to face some unexpected financial issues. I, however managed to get a few things done with the funds that I had such as  business cards, a website, T-shirts and some equipment.  The 7,000 dollars I am raising will be used to increase my more equipment ,uniforms, insurance and to hire staff.


I am willing to welcome supporters that believe in me and want to take this opportunity to make the city and  their facilities a pristine environment for business and allowing their employees to increase their productivities.


 Es Eco Cleaning service is a company driven by the society and community to keep facilities clean, my main vision is put into action through activities and focus on the environmental stewardship , activities to benefit society, and a commitment to make Es Eco Cleaning & Janitorial Service a truly sustainable company.  


 Please, help me start this company for a better tomorrow than today. You won't be disappointed. Thank you for your support !

story:
Short Summary

Put down your hammer and sickle and pick up your wallet! Inspired by everyone's favorite Sofa King, this shirt will show the world that you are proud of our little town's reputation as the Communist stronghold of Kansas! 

http://www2.ljworld.com/weblogs/town_talk/2015/...

What We Need & What You Get

  • Each $30 donation will get you a Commies and Candy-Asses t-shirt, printed with pride at ACME in Lawrence, Kansas, plus a handwritten thank you card from me. You can frame it and stuff.
  • Smaller donations are appreciated to get the capital together for a large shirt order!

The Impact

10% of each shirt sold will go to local charities to help serve LGBT rights, the homeless, and underprivileged families in our community and throughout Kansas. This portion will be split evenly between the following charities:

  • Equality House in Topeka, KS
  • The Lawrence Community Shelter
  • Just Food
  • The Ballard Center
IN YOUR FACE, BOB.

Going out for Business

I've had several requests for shirts featuring my Commies and Candy-Asses design, but I just don't have the capital to put in a large order. (My bootstraps must be malfunctioning at the moment!) By offering pre-orders, I can get the money ahead of time and get these shirts going! It seemed easier than standing on the street corner and pretending to light myself on fire, too. At the same time, you will be supporting an awesome local shirt shop and helping local families and individuals!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't donate, share this! Tweet, post it on Facebook, and get the word out to your comrades!
story_txt:
Short Summary Put down your hammer and sickle and pick up your wallet! Inspired by everyone's favorite Sofa King, this shirt will show the world that you are proud of our little town's reputation as the Communist stronghold of Kansas! http://www2.ljworld.com/weblogs/town_talk/2015/...   What We Need & What You Get 
Each $30 donation will get you a Commies and Candy-Asses t-shirt, printed with pride at ACME in Lawrence, Kansas, plus a handwritten thank you card from me. You can frame it and stuff. Smaller donations are appreciated to get the capital together for a large shirt order!

10% of each shirt sold will go to local charities to help serve LGBT rights, the homeless, and underprivileged families in our community and throughout Kansas. This portion will be split evenly between the following charities:
