story:
A brief outline


Hello there!
My name is Panos Kalafatis and I was brought up in a family-owned hotel 17km south of Delphi. So one thing I know well, is hospitality!

Recently we (my family) inherited a house in Athens which we intend to renovate and post it up on Wimbu,com for short stay rentals. However due to the state the house was delivered, we will need some financial assistance to get it ready. The whole project will cost 10000 euros and our finances can only make it to 2000 euros, leaving 8000 euros to be desired.

By buying our services and perks you will help my family, in these trying times, to create a small additional income that will go a long way! Of course, even if you don't intend on coming to Athens but feel like donating towards our goal, you are welcome to do so! It will be deeply appreciated and, equally, we looking forward in having you over in Athens.


Few words about the house:

The house is located in Kallithea, one of the 50 municipalities that make up Athens that lies between Athens city center and Piraeus port.  The house is 2 minutes walking distance from the old metro station "Kallithea". From this station, Central Athens and sightseeing hot-spots, are reached in 10~15 minutes and the Piraeus harbor in 10 minutes. Day tickets (24h) for all public transport is currently at 4 euros and at 1.20 euros you buy 70 minutes of travel time. No need to rent a car or get into a taxi while exploring the main sights. Comfortable shoes is a must!

Following the building style of the '60, the house has high ceilings and fairly large surface area (140 square meters). It has two bathrooms, one with a large bathtub, and another smaller with a shower. It has 4  medium rooms and a small living room adjacent to a kitchen.  

This project and everything that is offered here will be valid for three years so don't worry about getting here this summer. Plus, we will be open all year around and you can take up on it any time. When the room rental go live it will be at 26 euros per room ( accommodates 2 people) per night.

The provisions that will be included will be:

  • free wifi access,
  • a bookcrossing library,
  • local guides written, printed and updated by us on a monthly basis (so you get a list of upcoming events you might wish to participate),
  • and finally the most important provision for the Greek summer: Air Condition!


What We Need & What You Get

We segmented the work in 5 different stages to maximise our results and get going as soon as possible. Here we will breaking down our plan and funding goals:

In detail the stages are as follows:

Stage one is the most expensive when it comes to painting due to the size of the house (140 square meters and high ceiling) and some minor repairs.

Stage two gets one room in working order and effectively we start the renting.

Stage three, four and five finalize the project and delivers the whole house for renting.

All prices of furnitures and nik-naks are taken from three different catalogs (including IKEA).

In order to raise the fund we are offering perks along with discounts, in three ways:
  1. Discounts on your stay
  2. Experience Athens with (and as) a native
  3. one off perks

The funding is separated in stages, so should we fall short of the goal, we will be able to open it up for renting even with one room and work towards fulfilling our perks.

The Impact
Athens will always be a destination and although in the recent years the prices declined, it is far from being cheap. By contributing to this indiegogo campaign you make a little big difference in making it affordable all year round. With one stroke you get a fairly cheap lodging (you may add some perks if you like) and help a young family of three to make ends meet. We will make a big difference in your stay and you will make a big difference in our lives.

In order to witness your contribution at work you may wish to follow our website or facebook page where we will be posting the progress and book your stay with us.

Website: www.hospitable-athens.eu
Facebook: www.facebook.com/hospitableathensblog

Risks & Challenges

Should we fall short of our goal we already have an auxiliary studio available adjacent to the house which is ready to go and can fullfill the perks.  However the funding is crucial and we intend to make it happen as we are already promoting it to students and specific interest group such as photographers, art and history buffs. We will put our backs into delivering the first two stages as soon as possible hence the flexible funding!
Other Ways You Can Help

You cannot see yourself buying  perks or buying services you can still help out!

Share the campaign, perhaps a friend might find it interesting or useful and you will be helping us reach out further

story:
Bucket O' Blood Books & Records has been offering a wide selection of the best new and used vinyl as well as Chicago's best selection of genre fiction for 5 years, but we will soon be without a storefront.  Moving is a daunting (and expensive) task, and we're asking for your support to help us. Our lease is up at the end of July and we have nowhere to go. We're seeking a larger storefront that will not only house our ever-growing collection of books and records, but also give our customers a better shopping experience and allow us to host a wider variety of store events. We cannot do this without your help!

We're offering a wide selection of incentives including gift certificates, merchandise (some of it exclusive to this campaign), and even a chance to have a once-in-a-lifetime experience at our new location.

Please spread the word to friends and help if you can-every dollar makes a difference!

story:
To Begin...

Hi there!

We are Gia and Ade, two lovely ladies who have made our homes, and given our hearts to the Fishtown neighborhood in Philadelphia.



Because Fishtown has done so much for us, we would like to return the favor, by opening a coffee shop. We want to open something that embodies the spirit of the community. Both the old and the new life being added. In addition to fostering our community, we want to showcase one of the things we truly love...art. We want to highlight both genres and people that are underrepresented within the Frankford arts Corridor. As for our coffee, we will serve one local Pennsylvania roster, and feature a rotating selection of roasters from across the country.

By contributing to our campaign you will not only be helping two young women fulfill their dreams and become entrepreneurs, you will be helping a often overlooked, overshadowed and little known section of this growing neighborhood become economical viable.



The Breakdown

Every bit you give will bring us one step closer to our goal of making this community space a reality. We would like to break down exactly what your money is going towards
1) Making it Legit: $3,500
This money will go towards making our company LLC certified with the city and getting serv safe certified so that we will be able to serve you all delicious food! This money will also go towards helping us secure our space by putting a deposit so that we can start making our shop beautiful.
2) Furniture: $5,000
We will be hiring a local furniture maker to create wonderfully, unique tables and chairs. Support the community!
3) Plumber: $1,000
Plumbing, everyone needs running water
4) Cups, Plates + more: $2,300
This includes all the paper cups, straws, lids, plates and glassware that delectable food and drinks will be served in
5) Coffee, coffee, coffee! (and tea!): $6,000
Yes coffee is expensive and that is why we picked some of the best roasters. We have to make it count!
6) Graphic Designer: $200
This money goes toward paying the awesome artist that is doing all the branding for us.

We have pooled resources from our friends, artists and our own pockets to offer you some banging swag! We are going to have an awesome shop and we are offering a lot of things to show how much we care about our future customers. From keep cups, shout outs, a private latte art class and prints from amazing artists, there is something for everyone.
Should we not reach our goal, depending on what we have, we will put it towards our "make it legit" goal. Even though coffee is a large part of our budget, It is a perishable good, We only want to bring the freshest and best to our customers.

Get to know us!

  • As years long residents of this neighborhood we know what it is lacking and plan to fill that void. We know that a sense of community is what drives the Fishtown/New Kensington neighborhood and we want to nurture that. By partnering with artists for small workshops once we have become established, as well as with neighborhood institutions, we will make sure that the neighborhood knows we are not just here to capitalize on the money coming in or step on those already here. We want to stay and make this place even better than it already is. We want to show them that not only do we care about them, but about what we produce and do for ourselves.


    one of the wonderful organizations that we are working with

  • Incarnate Coffee is the embodiment of great coffee, community and underrepresented art. It aims to be an approachable coffee buying experience and atmosphere. One that promotes marginalized artists, longtime residents, and those just starting to settle in the reemerging Frankford Arts Corridor.

  • In regards to growth, this direct area is going through developmental changes. The neighborhood is seeing a lot of growth both providentially and commercially. We would like to set he precedent and tone for the change
  • Our goal is to be a successful shop that makes a positive impact within the community, through our beverages and fostering a welcoming atmosphere.
  • Adesola has years of training in specialty cheese, beer and coffee. She has worked in buying and management positions at Whole Foods Market & Di Bruno Bros. With a degree in the arts, she has a unique approach to problem solving, event planning and curating shows, and has carried this every step of the way to be successful in every role she has taken on.


  • Gia Parker has years of knowledge in the retail and small business management world. From having worked with luxury accessories designers, contemporary footwear showrooms,to eCommerce sites and local boutiques. She knows the ins and outs of how both a successful and and unsuccessful business are run and will bring her go getter attitude as well as knowledge to the business to help it run smoothly.

    • Our basic business philosophy is that you can teach anyone to make a decent coffee, but it takes passion and love of the craft to repeatedly produce something so deliciously well made, that it makes you want to stop everything and focus on that one moment and place.

one of the lovely murals celebrating arts and  great vibes that abound in Fishtown

    It gets scary sometimes..

    • One of the problems we will face as a brand new business is gathering enough funds to secure our space in a timely manner so that we do not lose our great space. It was previously a bar and our wonderful landlords have kept it in amazing condition. However, we still have some construction to allow our dream to fit. We will be using a local makers and builders to construct our peaceful, calm and funky space. 
    • Wonderful handmade furniture made locally to highlight one of the wonderful artists we have in the Philadelphia area. This is important to us because we want our shop to have the essence of Philadelphia in it in every aspect. We want to stay true to our vision of supporting local artist in goods as much as possible. 
    • Our cute shop is located next to a school, transportation and right off the Frankford corridor of the arts. There are many art studios in this area and a lot of homes being built, as this location is about to explode and we would like to be a part of creating the identity of this area of Fishtown. Even though there is a boom happening here, this area is relatively free of commercial business, which can be both a blessing and a hindrance as people are now used to having to leave this vicinity for their needs.
    •   As any new business owner will tell you, it is hard trying to start any kind of business especially when you have little to no money. However, we have been working with many neighborhood people, banks, organizations in the community who have been so wonderful taking time out of their day to advise and lead us to who or what will make us successful. 


    even the trashcans are art around here!!


    All the goodies! Oh my!

    Here are some of the things you could possibly receive by helping us ladies!

    **all prints are just examples of work, not necessarily what you will be receiving**

    A print by Ryan Psota, our graphic designer!


    A print by badass overall artist/tattoo artist/friend, Matt Kerley.

    mattkerley.bigcartel.com

    A keepcup to keep your drinks nice and warm for these upcoming winter months. Light and colorful!


    Prints from local tattoo artist, Resp

    resptattoo.com


      Every bit helps!

      Some of you just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help!

      If you can not help monetarily or would like to go above and beyond, please feel free to share our indiegogo link with everyone that you know. You can find us on Facebook and Instagram, our handle is incarnatecoffee.

      Word of mouth is a powerful tool!

story:
Lighting the Main Lodge at Saratoga Springs

My name is Chas and I have the extraordinary privilege of managing Saratoga Springs Retreat Center in Lake County California about 2 hours drive north of San Francisco.  Our retreat center has been around since the 1870s and been a destination for travelers near and far.  Our mineral springs have traditionally offered relief and comfort for visitors suffering from various ailments.  While the healing waters are more to look at now, we do offer lots of other great things like a huge pool and hot tub, hiking, workshops and delicious food.  

Our main lodge has been around since the late 1800s and is one of the last standing old lodges in California.  The one thing it lacks is decent lighting.  With the latest LED lighting technology that provides good warm light we have the opportunity to significantly transform the interior of this historic structure.  The last  time the lights were updated there was in the 1970s.  The bulbs are flood lights and burn up a lot of electricity.  Switching to LED lights will save as much as two thirds of the cost of lighting the main lodge today.  

Our long-time friend, Buzz Bense has created a brilliant lighting plan for this grand room.

What We Need & What You Get

We need $1500 to buy tracks, fixtures and LED bulbs.  We are purchasing everything online to save the most money and still have attractive fixtures and lighting.  

If you contribute $25 or more, we will put your name up on a plaque in the Main Lodge as one of the creators of the new lighting scheme.  And with the new lighting, you can actually read the plaque!

The Impact

We want to engage as many folks in our Saratoga Springs community as possible.  Over 3,000 people come and stay at Saratoga Springs every year.  We'd love to see people come back and see the impact of their contributions.

Another benefit of this project is that the food on the buffet line will be much more attractive and visible.  Have you ever gone through the buffet line and wondered was that dish was?

Risks & Challenges

If we don't make our goal, we will still proceed with the project, albeit, at a slower pace.  We don't always have a lot of extra income for our improvement projects and this one would normally fall lower in priority than some of our important maintenance projects.  This is why this project, we feel, will have appeal to our customers - because it's something that you will really see the difference in.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute financially at this time, please pass on this opportunity to others you know who know and love Saratoga Springs.  There are links and tools in indiegogo or you can post this campaign on your social media page.  Or just talk it up in a social setting.  Thank you!

Another benefit of this project is that the food on the buffet line will be much more attractive and visible.  Have you ever gone through the buffet line and wondered was that dish was?

    Other Ways You Can Help If you can't contribute financially at this time, please pass on this opportunity to others you know who know and love Saratoga Springs.  There are links and tools in indiegogo or you can post this campaign on your social media page.  Or just talk it up in a social setting.  Thank you!

story:
We are the Utah Code 4 Foundation; you can read about us HERE. Our foundation was created after our father, husband, son, brother and grandpa  was killed in the line of duty on January 30th, 2014. He was ambushed and shot through his windshield. His story can be found by clicking HERE. 

In light of the recent killings of two NYPD officers, also shot through their windows, we decided to take a more aggressive stance on getting our officers more protection. It's time to protect those that risk everything to protect us. If they had this benefit, the NYPD officers would still be living, our father would be alive, and Derick Johnson of Draper PD would also likely still be living. That's just to name a few.  Officers and deputies are being hurt and are dying in greater numbers as we speak.  It's time to give them the protection, that they give all of us when we need them. 

If we are able to reach our goal, we will be able to outfit all Utah County Sheriff patrol vehicles with a bulletproof windshield, plating in the doors, and bulletproof side windows.  Then, our goal is to do Carbon County and start on Draper City's cars. This campaign would act as a pilot project to get the Utah Legislature to move on legislation to make the changes throughout the state. 

International Armoring (found HERE ) is a Utah based company that custom fits cars with their armouring components. They have quoted us $5-7,000 based on the vehicle make for the windshield, windows, and armour in the doors. The more we buy, the bigger the discount. They are committed to our cause and have pledged their help throughout our campaign. 

As we are a non-profit organization, our focus is to aid officers any way we can, If we don't reach our overall goal the money that is raised will go to getting as many Utah County Sheriff vehicles outfitted as possible.

story:
What if there was a social network specifically designed to connect travellers by creating travel diaries and sharing your adventures?

We want to build it.

Introducing nomadmovement. 

Travel isn’t just about the holiday itself; it’s in the planning, the anticipation, and then it’s all in the re-telling and the memories. Travel is the gift that keeps giving, and the one we share with the people we love through emails, letters, postcards, showing photos and videos, and posting on blogs and social media.

www.nomadmovement.com

We couldn’t find a social network that worked for travellers, so we are building it ourselves – with your help. 

There was no online platform that felt right, where we could:

  • share our travel photos
  • write our memories and stories, explain our adventures
  • give travel tips and hints
  • browse other people’s travel diaries
  • search by location, travel type or keyword
  • research ideas for our next trip
  • be inspired by other travelers’ stories, visally and with words
  • meet other adventurers outside of our own friend and family networks
  • experience a visually beautiful site, uncluttered by advertising and confusing applications


How does it work?

Inspired by a journal, nomadmovement is your personal online travel story. Using your pictures, words, links and maps, you can bring people along with you on your adventures; family, friends, strangers, friends you haven’t met yet.

  • build your profile
  • create travel diaries
  • upload pics, videos and notes
  • make regular updates
  • preserve your travel memories
  • connect with other nomads
  • research your next adventure


Your profile page:


Create a travel diary, with pics, videos and descriptions:




Upload a standalone note, pic, video or link:


 

Share on your other social media accounts:

 

Change the dates on your travel diaries:



Create a following. Become a travel guru:

Add comments, ask questions, share others’ pics and videos, like other nomads’ posts, search keywords, add to your favourites, follow and become friends.



Find your next adventure:

How do you decide where to go on your next journey?

Search for keywords and flick through pics until you’re struck. 

Browse diaries and read recommendations of people whose travel style inspires you. 




We need a lot of help to build a movement.

There is a substantial cost involved in building a large-capacity website. Based on the skills of our people and the ideas we have, we could slowly build nomadmovement ourselves.

But this process would take years and would face the constant challenge of building stronger mechanisms to cope with increases in traffic. In a nutshell, it would not be able to handle more than a few hundred users.

Your contributions will go directly towards technology development, technology infrastructure, marketing and promotion, and advertising. 



What's in it for you?
There are definitely perks in being a nomad; especially a nomad in on the ground floor, before nomadmovement launches into the next big social media movement.
We started nomadmovement as travelers who were looking for an experience sharing platform that simply didn’t exist. Our end product is all about sharing, and crowdfunding brings the sharing moment right from the start.



Beyond sharing your travel adventures with just your friends, family and anyone who stumbles across your blog, nomadmovement offers an interactive social media experience:
  • make friends with the same travel passions
  • follow people who’s adventures inspire you
  • gather followers and create your own travel empire
  • give your travel tips and practical hints from your own experiences
  • take the insider info from fellow nomads

Our people are nomads, just like you.
João Monteiro: CEO and Co-founder, Business Development, Porto, Portugal
Francisco Sousa Otto: CFO and Co-founder, Business Development, Porto, Portugal
Pedro Mendes: CTO/COO and Co-founder, Web Developer, Porto, Portugal
Vasco Vinhas: CTO/COO and Co-founder, Web Developer, Porto, Portugal
Matilde Espregueira: CMO, Marketing and Social Network Director, London, England
Sarah Smith: Creative Content Director, Writer and Editor, Sydney, Australia


We are all nomads. We jot down ideas in mini notebooks waiting for the 7:43am Eurail train to Berlin. We Skype from bus stations in Albuquerque and airports in Lisbon. We search café to café for free wifi in Johannesburg. We type out code as the battery warning flashes on our laptops, stuck in the backseat of a friend’s car driving across France without recharge possibility anytime soon. We hold our phones up in the air, searching for any kind of signal, out bush in the middle of the Australian outback.

The world is our workplace.

Our nomads work across the planet; a network of travellers creating a special media platform for travellers.



Financial breakdown
Let's talk finances. Funds from this crowdfunding will primarily go toward technology development and infrastructure. Any remaining finds will go into promoting nomadmovement.

*detailed budgets are available on request, if you're really into the numbers.


nomadmovement: coming early 2015.

Join the #nomadmovement. Share this campaign with your friends and fellow nomads. Let's get connected.



*Note: all screenshots are in development and are indicative only

story:
Our Goal and Vision:

Project LifeSaver is a small device that is worn around the wrist or ankle which emits an individualized signal that can be tracked by law enforcement to bring a loved one home safely. So far there have been 2,909 people rescued with this program.

The cost of a transmitter is expensive (about $300) and many families can not cover the cost of the device.  As of today, Chisago County has been able to keep the cost of the transmitter at $0 through previous fundraisers and donations. Unfortunately, those funds are limited...

There have been multiple news stories of children and adults going missing because of Autism, Alzheimers, Dementia, and Down's Syndrome.  Sadly, some families have lost their loved ones because they were not equipped with a tracking device to be located easily and quickly.

What We Need:

Our goal is set at $2500 but we would like to really like to double or maybe even triple that!   We want to provide as many families in our community as we can with a sense of security for their Grandparent, Parent, or Child.

This is our second year doing a fundraiser for this cause.  Last year we raised over $2100 and it was a HUGE success.  We are hoping to do better this year by trying a different approach.  Many more families still need this service and we want to keep the cost down for every family in need.

  • All of the funds raised in this campaign will go directly to Project LifeSaver of Chisago County, MN.  
  • With your help, we will be able to keep the cost of the device to $0 and the only responsibility of the caretakers, is a low $5 monthly fee.  (To replace the battery each month and to issue new bands.)
  • If our goal is not reached, everything that has been raised, will still go to our fundraiser.  This is extremely important to us and we want to see this program succeed!

The impact of your donation:

Every dollar raised is another step closer to saving families from the expensive cost of the transmitter.  Many do not have the extra money to be able to afford the bracelet and would not be able to be on the program without your donation.

It is extremely important to keep costs down for families with limited incomes and special needs loved ones.

If you are unable to donate:

Please pass this link on.  Through Email, Social Media such as Facebook or Google+, or even just a simple phone call to a friend or family member!

** Video credit to Project LifeSaver

story:
PROJET INUKSUK 

En haut d'une montagne à Ste-Béatrix dans la région de Lanaudière (Québec), un éco-village est en train de se former autour d'un projet commun, le projet Inuksuk.  C'est le propriétaire et artisan entrepreneur Benoît Lasalle, spécialiste dans la construction de maisons de bois rond, qui est l'initiateur de ce projet d'éco-village à des fins récréo-touristique.  Le projet comporte la location du chalet 'Inuksuk', une Auberge de Jeunesse Internationale, la construction et la location d'éco-gîtes (hobbitation, tipi, yourte, queenzy, igloo, cabane dans les arbres, etc.), des infrastructures pour les opérations, des activités récréo-éducatives (jardinage, initiation à l'herboristerie, atelier de survie en forêt, vivre au temps de jadis, ... ;  ateliers: construction de rockets stove (foyers de masse), four à pain, forge, cuir, bois, ...; soirées animées (musique, performances, projections).

Lieu de rassemblement, d'apprentissage et de création, nous vous invitons dès maintenant à vous joindre à notre équipe afin de participer ensemble à la finition de l'auberge, à la construction de nouvelles habbitations écologiques, aux jardins en permaculture, etc.

chalet Inuksuk (construction 2002)

Auberge internationale (en construction depuis 2007)


hobbitation (construction 2009) 


tente médiévale


Jusqu'à ce jour c'est le manque de fond qui a ralenti les travaux de l'auberge, nous aimerions pouvoir continuer à nous y consacrer à plein temps afin de la terminer pour l'automne 2015, .... toute aide est la bienvenue!!!  Bienvenue à tous!  Merci de votre support!

Benoit, Amandine, Philippe, François, Sylvie, Sylvain, Caroline, Alex et tous les Amis de la montagne!


ÇA BOUGE SUR LA MONTAGNE!

Liens vers nos 'travaux d'Astérix' - corvées organisées autour du projet de construction de l'Auberge (automne 2013 -> automne 2014) - VOIR PHOTOS

-> Travaux d'Astérix été-automne 2014 https://www.facebook.com/events/1438093679805829

-> Construction d'un foyer de masse de style rocket stove avec plancher radiant https://www.facebook.com/events/218858148284018/

-> Travaux d'Astérix automne 2013 https://www.facebook.com/events/644048375635650/


ALLEZ VOIR NOTRE GALERIE D'IMAGES!

story:
Prologue: Once Upon A Time...

“If you only read the books that everyone else is reading, you can only think what everyone else is thinking.” - Nagasawa, Norwegian Wood by Haruki Murakami

Now, there are lots of books we all should read. I personally recommend Murakami to everyone I get the chance to. And there are the classics: Jane Austen is a must; Dickens? Absolutely! George Orwell, I’d certainly say so.

But as good as the Gone Girls and Harry Potter’s of the world are, there’s hundreds, if not thousands, of wonderful books out there in the world that most people simply never come across.

And don’t get me wrong, I’m not saying that Gone Girl and Harry Potter aren’t absolutely fantastic - and I, as a confirmed Ravenclaw, would certainly not wish to dissuade you from reading either. 

But I guess I’ve always been a big fan of being different. 

Whenever I discover a new book or author that I love, I am filled with such pure joy. Particularly when it's one that I only by chance stumbled across. Even more so if it involves a genre or topic I wouldn’t usually pick up that gets me out of my reading comfort zone.

There are so many hidden gem books out there. And I want to bring that feeling of finding that special, previously-unknown book to as many people as possible.

That’s why I am launching my business:  

A subscription box book club that will, each month, send out a delightfully packaged box to subscribers, containing one such above-mentioned book, along with some extra goodies, themed around that particular book, to really enhance the experience of reading it. Then we can all read and discuss the book and our experience with it via The Joy Book Club's website and social media. And, to ensure we #ShareTheBookJoy as much as possible, £1 from each box will go to different book-related charities each month! Lovely.

Sound like fun?

I am currently planning to send out my first round of boxes (those ordered through this campaign) at the end of January 2016 and open my online shop to subscriptions on February 1st 2016. (Subscriptions for the first box will also open early on the website from the beginning of December at the full price of £15.99 per box, as part of our pre-launch).

But to do that, I need a little help :-)

Chapter One: The Breakdown

"When I get a little money I buy books; and if any is left I buy food and clothes." - Desiderius Erasmus

Right folks, let's get down to the nitty-gritty:

  • What do I need the funds for?

    Initial stock of books, gifts and packaging for the first run of boxes = £850

    Initial stock of 3000 boxes (buying a large quantity so I can get them at the best price) = £1950

    Welcome packs: Initial stock of membership cards, bookmarks, badges and bookbags for welcome packs, for new members of the club (and to send as ‘perks’ to other funders) = £450

    Initial business expenses: registering as a bookseller; office supplies; laptop and website protection; initial consultation with an accountant; contingency funds = £900

    Initial advertising/promotion = £350

  • 'Fair enough,' I hear you say, 'but what do I get?'

    Well, this is your chance to get one of the first boxes, and save money doing it! Simply choose the £15 perk and you'll be one of just 100 hundred people to receive The Joy Book Club's first ever box! Cue: Excitement! 
    And if you want to order one as a Christmas Present for a loved one (excellent idea that, clever you!), I can send you a voucher so you have something to hand to them on the day!


    (Please Note: This is a sample version of a box to demonstrate what they will look like and contain)
    Each box will contain a book, a hand-written letter about how I came to choose that book and a few gifts themed around it. 


    So, for example if the book were Bridget Jones: Edge of Reason, the gifts might be some candy cigarettes, some tropical Thai incense sticks and     a 'I ❤️‍ wine' drink coaster; if the book were The Elephant Vanishes by Haruki Murakami, you might find some chocolates, a 'fresh-cut grass' scented candle and pull-tab bracelet. Obviously neither of those books will be one of my boxes - they're too well-known and I'll never reveal which books will be the boxes before they've been sent out. But you get the idea.

    Or you can get a little The Joy Book Club merch, have a little perusal of the other perks, see if there's anything you fancy.

                   
    (Designs subject to change - but they'll be something like this!)

    Or just donate a little (or a lot, up to you) to help me out, as the thoroughly lovely person you are.
  • And if you don't reach your entire goal...?

    If I haven't reached my funding goal at the end of this campaign, I'll have to push my planned launch-date back whilst I gather the rest of the start-up funds I need to get things up and running. But I will still launch, it would just take a little longer... And who wants to wait for BookJoy?!

    • Chapter Two: Risks & Responsibilities (the alternative R&R)

    "Only those who will risk going too far can possibly find out how far one can go." - T. S. Eliot

    I am new to the business world. Starting a business is always a risk, especially starting your first business. 

    But I am so passionate about this. I really believe in this idea, I've done incredible amounts of research and have spent lots of time working on the idea and sourcing what I need to do this. I've signed up to Enterprise Nation to seek help and guidance with starting this business. I also went to The School of Communication Arts 2.0, which gives you all kinds of entrepreneurial and branding skills, and has an incredible, expansive network of mentors, so I got a good grounding in the things I need to know about doing this, and list as long as my arm (longer probably) of great, wise people who can help and give advice.

    I also want to do this right in terms of being a responsible business that cares about the wider world. Therefore I am trying to source packaging that is as green as possible - and thoroughly encourage subscribers to recycle all their packaging once they've opened the box. 

    I am also pleased to announce our Read Books, Do Good charity initiative. £1 from each box will go to a different Rad Book-Charity of the Month, that will be in some way linked to the book/box's theme. I truly believe that books and reading play an important role in helping to solve some of society's, and the workd's, biggest problems. Thus simply by buying a box and reading an awesome book, you'll be doing some book-related good in the world. Lovely!

    This company is all about the Joy, so I want to include that in as many parts of the business, and spread it as far out to the wider world, as possible :-)

    Epilogue: Sharing is Caring

    “Happiness quite unshared can scarcely be called happiness; it has no taste.” - Charlotte Brontë

    If you can't help financially, no worries! There are other ways to help:

    • If you have any bookish friends who you think might like The Joy Book Club, you could suggest it to them instead.
    • Or you could, very kindly, just generally get the word out and make a bit of noise about The Joy Book Club and this campaign - Facebook, Twitter, actually speaking to people, however you feel like it. #ShareTheBookJoy!

    And that, as they say, is: 

    The End. :-)
story_txt:
Prologue: Once Upon A Time... “If you only read the books that everyone else is reading, you can only think what everyone else is thinking.” - Nagasawa, Norwegian Wood by Haruki Murakami
Now, there are lots of books we all should read. I personally recommend Murakami to everyone I get the chance to. And there are the classics: Jane Austen is a must; Dickens? Absolutely! George Orwell, I’d certainly say so.
But as good as the Gone Girls and Harry Potter’s of the world are, there’s hundreds, if not thousands, of wonderful books out there in the world that most people simply never come across.
And don’t get me wrong, I’m not saying that Gone Girl and Harry Potter aren’t absolutely fantastic - and I, as a confirmed Ravenclaw, would certainly not wish to dissuade you from reading either. 
But I guess I’ve always been a big fan of being different. 
Whenever I discover a new book or author that I love, I am filled with such pure joy. Particularly when it's one that I only by chance stumbled across. Even more so if it involves a genre or topic I wouldn’t usually pick up that gets me out of my reading comfort zone.
There are so many hidden gem books out there. And I want to bring that feeling of finding that special, previously-unknown book to as many people as possible.
That’s why I am launching my business:  


A subscription box book club that will, each month, send out a delightfully packaged box to subscribers, containing one such above-mentioned book, along with some extra goodies, themed around that particular book, to really enhance the experience of reading it. Then we can all read and discuss the book and our experience with it via The Joy Book Club's website and social media. And, to ensure we #ShareTheBookJoy as much as possible, £1 from each box will go to different book-related charities each month! Lovely.


Sound like fun?
I am currently planning to send out my first round of boxes (those ordered through this campaign) at the end of January 2016 and open my online shop to subscriptions on February 1st 2016. (Subscriptions for the first box will also open early on the website from the beginning of December at the full price of £15.99 per box, as part of our pre-launch).
But to do that, I need a little help :-)

   Chapter One: The Breakdown 
"When I get a little money I buy books; and if any is left I buy food and clothes." - Desiderius Erasmus
Right folks, let's get down to the nitty-gritty:  
What do I need the funds for?Initial stock of books, gifts and packaging for the first run of boxes = £850Initial stock of 3000 boxes (buying a large quantity so I can get them at the best price) = £1950Welcome packs: Initial stock of membership cards, bookmarks, badges and bookbags for welcome packs, for new members of the club (and to send as ‘perks’ to other funders) = £450
Initial business expenses: registering as a bookseller; office supplies; laptop and website protection; initial consultation with an accountant; contingency funds = £900
Initial advertising/promotion = £350
 'Fair enough,' I hear you say, 'but what do I get?'Well, this is your chance to get one of the first boxes, and save money doing it! Simply choose the £15 perk and you'll be one of just 100 hundred people to receive The Joy Book Club's first ever box! Cue: Excitement! And if you want to order one as a Christmas Present for a loved one (excellent idea that, clever you!), I can send you a voucher so you have something to hand to them on the day!




(Please Note: This is a sample version of a box to demonstrate what they will look like and contain)Each box will contain a book, a hand-written letter about how I came to choose that book and a few gifts themed around it. 
So, for example if the book were Bridget Jones: Edge of Reason, the gifts might be some candy cigarettes, some tropical Thai incense sticks and a 'I ❤️‍ wine' drink coaster; if the book were The Elephant Vanishes by Haruki Murakami, you might find some chocolates, a 'fresh-cut grass' scented candle and pull-tab bracelet. Obviously neither of those books will be one of my boxes - they're too well-known and I'll never reveal which books will be the boxes before they've been sent out. But you get the idea.Or you can get a little The Joy Book Club merch, have a little perusal of the other perks, see if there's anything you fancy.
               (Designs subject to change - but they'll be something like this!)Or just donate a little (or a lot, up to you) to help me out, as the thoroughly lovely person you are.


 And if you don't reach your entire goal...?If I haven't reached my funding goal at the end of this campaign, I'll have to push my planned launch-date back whilst I gather the rest of the start-up funds I need to get things up and running. But I will still launch, it would just take a little longer... And who wants to wait for BookJoy?!
   Chapter Two: Risks & Responsibilities (the alternative R&R)
"Only those who will risk going too far can possibly find out how far one can go." - T. S. Eliot I am new to the business world. Starting a business is always a risk, especially starting your first business. 
But I am so passionate about this. I really believe in this idea, I've done incredible amounts of research and have spent lots of time working on the idea and sourcing what I need to do this. I've signed up to Enterprise Nation to seek help and guidance with starting this business. I also went to The School of Communication Arts 2.0, which gives you all kinds of entrepreneurial and branding skills, and has an incredible, expansive network of mentors, so I got a good grounding in the things I need to know about doing this, and list as long as my arm (longer probably) of great, wise people who can help and give advice.
I also want to do this right in terms of being a responsible business that cares about the wider world. Therefore I am trying to source packaging that is as green as possible - and thoroughly encourage subscribers to recycle all their packaging once they've opened the box. 
I am also pleased to announce our Read Books, Do Good charity initiative. £1 from each box will go to a different Rad Book-Charity of the Month, that will be in some way linked to the book/box's theme. I truly believe that books and reading play an important role in helping to solve some of society's, and the workd's, biggest problems. Thus simply by buying a box and reading an awesome book, you'll be doing some book-related good in the world. Lovely!
This company is all about the Joy, so I want to include that in as many parts of the business, and spread it as far out to the wider world, as possible :-)   Epilogue: Sharing is Caring 
“Happiness quite unshared can scarcely be called happiness; it has no taste.” - Charlotte Brontë
If you can't help financially, no worries! There are other ways to help:

If you have any bookish friends who you think might like The Joy Book Club, you could suggest it to them instead.
Or you could, very kindly, just generally get the word out and make a bit of noise about The Joy Book Club and this campaign - Facebook, Twitter, actually speaking to people, however you feel like it. #ShareTheBookJoy!   And that, as they say, is: The End. :-)

story:
Welcome to Mondo Taitu!


Mondo Taitu is the the original surf hostel and bar on the Panamanian Caribbean. Mondo Taitu Hostel put itself on the map by being a staple for it’s wild parties, bohemian setting, and family like atmosphere. 

                                         

Mondo’s chilled out vibe by day and ridiculous party scene by night has made it the top destination choice for free spirited travellers through the Central Americas. 

                         


     What makes Mondo Taitu & Bocas so special?

Mondo Taitu is a hostel and infamous bar that has been around for over 15 years making it one of the originals on the island. In its hay day, travellers would come from all over the world to take part in the Mondo’s nightly themed parties, explore world class beaches and truly get lost in paradise.

When staying at Mondo Adventure seekers are able to find a euphoric feeling of freedom that cannot be felt any where else in the world.       

                       

         

Our story:

We are 3 friends who emptied our accounts and borrowed what money we could to invest in a little piece of paradise here in the Caribbean. Before we arrived the hostel was on the borderline of foreclosure.  The years of wear and tear from the salty air, hundreds of wild parties, and increasing competition on the island had slowly started hurting Mondo's business.

  


We knew it was a risky investment but we truly believe we have the creative drive and passion to bring Mondo back to life. 


What the Funding Will Go To:


First and foremost we want to make Mondo a comfortable place to eat and sleep. 

           

We will be remodelling and expanding the kitchen area as well as replacing all of the bunk beds, bed frames, mattresses and pillows. 

           

We will be remodelling and retiling the toilets, showers and bathrooms. We plan to install a hot water tank for the showers and sinks as well as replace all of the corroded wood around the Hostel.

     


We want to build a deck over the Mondo bar in order to expand it as well as replace our old torn up roof. We would also plan to to install solar panels to reduce energy usage and start the transition into a completely “green” hostel.

              


What’s In It For You:

$5-  You are in a similar financial state as Mondo and want to help but don’t have lots of cash. You will receive a personal Social Media Shoutout for your contribution.

$25- You want to help support our cause and leave your mark forever. Your name will be written on our funding wall at Mondo and a personal thank you post card will be sent to your house

$50- You will get happy hour prices for life at Mondo Bar as well as a Mondo Taitu T-shirt. All previous perks included as well.

$130 (featured perk)- 3 Night free stay, Unlimited drinks at Mondo Bar, Caribbean boat tour, and all of the above perks.

                      

$350- 5 night free stay, Unlimited drinks at Mondo Bar, City and Canal Tour (in Panama city),  plus all of the above perks.

$999-  1 night 4 star hotel in Panama city, round trip domestic flights, 5 nights free stay at Mondo, Unlimited drinks, Caribbean Boat tour and all of the above perks,

$1899-  Couples or friend package. All of the above at a cheaper rate for 2 people.

$1250- Everything from the $999 deal plus 5 days of private boat surf charters to various breaks in Bocas. Surf guide and surf board rental included.

$2500- Our Angel Mentor perk. You would officially become our mentor, our board of directors, and are saving grace. You are entitled to everything in the $999 package as well to come check up on your investment!


     

The Community:

Today, Mondo employs half a dozen of the indigenous Ngöbe people and acts as a second home to  them and their children. The most rewarding part of our job is the ability to directly benefit the lives of the local people in our community. 

   

Panamanian law only requires children to go to school until 6th grade.  Mondo truly is an access point for our employee’s families to take their education and their future to the next level. It is quite common to see many of our employees’ children running around Mondo or doing their homework on a day to day basis before and after school instead of playing around in the streets.  Mondo is truly a second home for them. 


   THANK YOU FOR YOUR SUPPORT!

Not only will you be donating to help support an amazing local community but you will be investing in the trip of a lifetime! We can’t wait to welcome our first funders through Mondos doors. We personally guarantee this trip will be one you will never forget.

 Every dollar we raise is going straight to increasing the comfort of our guests in order to continue running a viable business. Thank you so much for your support and if you can’t personally donate then please help us out by spreading the word to friends and family. Cheers!

story:
Our Story

Lokala Studios: A creative and supportive retail outlet for local artisans, as well as a supportive entity for other local businesses, schools, and community programs! 

 

Hi! My name is Erin Berger, and my goal is to raise money to aid in opening a retail space in my small town of LaSalle-Peru, Illinois. This store would be a special and tailored space where myself and other local artists could sell their handmade creations, including everything from art to crafting; furniture to music. I believe every artist should have the opportunity to grow support in their community, showcase their talent, and subsequentially increase their sales. At Lokala Studios, individual artists would have featured display areas, designed with their vision in mind. This will not be the kind of store customers enter and find the usual shelves and rows of product for sale. It will be a treat for the eyes and senses, creatively incorporating artists handmade goods and displaying their talent and hard work. Clean, uncluttered and unique displays means all creations can get equal grab appeal and the attention deserved by the customers. In addition to an artist friendly space, Lokala Studios will also be a parent and child friendly environment. A specific children's area will be set up, allowing caretakers to shop and visit while their children play.

I am the Owner/Designer of Krinklz Baby. As a stay at home mom I was inspired to form a creative outlet and worked hard to start my own business creating handmade baby toys and accessories with a characteristic crinkly touch. I am passionate about providing a retail space that treats every artist's creations as though they are the store's main attraction.

The Impact

There has been a shift: in the economy, in people's values, in the way people think about what they purchase. Focus has shifted back to family and community, supporting and helping each other.

Lokala Studios will purchase from local businesses and enlist the help of local carpenters/contractors to create the perfect space. This project is heavily invested in the artists involved, giving them every opportunity to take their passions to the next level through monthly features, creative marketing and bringing their vision to life. Lokala would also offer special fundraising opportunities for local schools, special creative workshops for all ages, and guest artist features.

 

What We Need & What You Get

I am determined to open Lokala Studios. Local artists would carry their handmade creations in the store on consignment. This eliminates the need for funding for inventory. The funding is needed for start up costs. I have found a wonderful and open space to rent, and need to be able to provide a security deposit as well as know the first one or two months of rent are covered. Building unique diplay elements, purchasing fixtures for displays, and the workshop space are also required. Other initial costs include items such as point of sale equipment and software, packaging/sales materials, and local advertising. The majority of funds needed to open Lokala Studios exists in the beginning, and this is where I need help.

If I am not able to reach my goal of $5000, I will simply have to be more frugal and creative with how to spend the money that is raised. At this point there is no other funding available, but I am confident that one way or another this store will get off the ground with diligence and passion.

Any monetary support that can be offered will be greatly appreciated by myself, the local artists involved, and the Illinois Valley community. A list of all contributers will be posted in the store, as well as supplied to each artist involved. There will be five random drawings from contributer names and those selected will receive a handmade treat from Lokala Studios. Thank you in advance for your support!

Other Ways You Can Help

Love the concept of Lokala Studios? Use any and all of the share tools provided, send emails, call friends to spread the word! Help local Illinois Valley artists grow and support their passions! Believers supporting artists supporting communities...make some noise!

story:
We have to raise our goal amount, or our plan to bring the Political Pill Pet Invention to the market will die.  Please consider contributing.  Thank you for your time.  R. Mazur

Our Story

What do you buy your parents or grandparents for birthdays, holidays, or anniversaries?  Choose a product that helps them with their daily medicine opening needs, helps the community, and keeps jobs in the US...the Political Pill Pets.

Eight thousand people turned 65 today and will every day for the next 20 years.  With one in three adults suffering from pains associated with arthritis, and over 3.6 billion prescriptions written in the US, we decided to make fun and functional products that fit the daily needs of the aging demographic.  Considering the critical senior vote, we took the award-winning and patented PurrFect Opener and designed the Political Pill Pets.

The designs for the Political Pill Pets are complete, and the prototypes have proven successful, but we need your help to provide US-based jobs for tooling, manufacturing, marketing, and sales.  Will you help with a small donation or advanced purchase of Political Pill Pets?

The Impact

Jobs in USA

  • Fulfillment jobs in SE Michigan
  • Molding jobs in NE Michigan
  • Sticker production jobs NW Ohio
  • Graphic card production jobs northern Ohio
  • Tool-making job in central Ohio
  • Video job in SE Massachusetts
  • Marketing job in eastern Massachusetts

Community Involvement

  • Final assembly and fulfillment is through a nonprofit organization that provides support and services to persons with disabilities and other mental health needs in Wayne County, Michigan.

Small Business Support

  • The Political Pill Pets help B.A.Maze, Inc. continue to invent creative products for an aging demographic and launch effective and supportive websites like www.products4arthritis.com.

What We Need & What You Get

What we need is tooling dollars to make the production products of the Political Pill Pets. Tooling is approximately $7K for each design. Your support involves pre-ordering one or more Political Pill Pets to hang on your fridge.

  Other Ways You Can Help

Like us on Facebook, LinkedIn, and other social media sites.  Visit http://www.products4arthritis.com to see other products that you might find useful for yourself, a parent, or a friend.

story:
Short Summary

Hi, I'm Geanie, age 57, and my husband is Roger, age 59.  We have 3 wonderful grandchildren that we adore, and spoil.  We are homebodies, mostly because Roger isn't quite the same since recovering from stage 4 cancer, and I suffer from congenital spinal stenois, so I can't walk or stand any length of time.  But we don't mind, we love being together and we are always available to keep the grandkids.  Roger hasn't worked in over a year now since his cancer treatments left him unable to continue his commercial insulator job.  I am in IT and my job has been outsourced 3 times now. I am currently working part-time on an as needed basis.  But we make things work and get our bills paid, including still paying on medical bills for Rogers treatments.  We've always done our best to be good people and help others when we could, but now, we need some help.

Our home that we both love to spend time together in has been broken. The City of Broken Arrow, in its attempt to alleviate flooding in 2 newly developed neighborhoods behind us, diverted the flood waters onto our property. This diversion of the flood waters was done mid Oct, 2007, during the time between when our offer on the home had been accepted and when we  closed, and continued until Jan of this year when they finally installed a real storm drainage system. But even when a City knows they caused damage to one's home,  you have to file a claim in order to have the City pay for the damages. We did. It's been 18 months now since filing. In June the City asked us to submit a settlement proposal. We asked for the exact cost of the repairs. We obtained multiple estimates and provided them all to the City. The final total estimate (averaged from the multiple estimates) is over $98,000. Our offer went before the City Council this week, they rejected it with no counter offer. They want to go to trial. Pre-trial is set for Oct. 1.
We hae already spent almost $5000 and We don't have the additional $20-25k dollars it will cost to go to trial. If we don't go to trial, our only other option is to drop the claim. Then the City pays nothing to repair what they did, and we will continue to live in a very badly broken home the rest of our lives. We need help in raising the $20-25,000 so we can go to trial. It's the only way we can get the City to pay for the repairs our home so desperately needs.

What We Need & What You Get

The funds will be used to pay all the costs associated with going to trial. We have 9 witnesses, in addition to Roger and I, that are neighbors, friends and family. We have experts, 2 structural engineers, an appraiser, and every one of the contractors that submitted repair estimates. The City has notified us that in order to go to trial, they want depositions from everyone. That's a lot of people, and at a cost of $250 per hour for our attorney to first spend time with each witness to prepare them for their depositions. And another $250 per hour when he attends each persons deposition and for time spent otherwise preparing for trial and for the trial itself. That's a lot of money. We also need to be able to pay our experts, for their time. The City will pay them their normal hourly rate for their time giving their depostions, but we have to pay for our attorney to prepare them for their depositions, and also for their time spent being at the trial.

If we don't meet our goal, we will use whatever amount of funds we do get for the same purposes as stated. Our attorney wants to work with us, but he can't spend hours upon hours for us for nothing. So if we can get enough to keep him at least happy, we might make it to trial on less. But if the amount of funds is too far from our goal, we will use the funds to make as many repairs as we ourselves possibly can. Such as getting our windwos and doors sealed off since they simply won't close all the way. or sealing all the cracks on the outside brick walls. There are plenty of repairs to do that any amount would help. But we hope to be able to raise enough to go to court and have the City fix what they broke and all repairs get done.

The Impact

Wanna talk about an impact. Roger and I bought our dream house. And within 6 months, it all began. The rains and the damages.  We live in NE Oklahoma, the soil here is clay based. When clay gets wet, it swells. The City put so much water on us, the soil swelled and lifted the outside brick walls up off it's piers/foundation. Our home has a crawl space, it's up on inner piers. We have pictures of those inner piers, showing as much as 4 inches of diverted water has passed under our home. This cause all 14
inner piers to shift, tip, fall over, and the subfloor insulation to suck up the moisture in the air from it and fall, and the subfloor to warp. All the floors in our home have to be completely removed and a new subfloor and floors have to be build. Our concrete 2 car garage was raised 3 inches and all the dirt beneath has been washed away. Our garage is sitting on a sink hole.
We haven't parked our vehicles in there for 3 years now. Walls have pulled away from our fireplace, as well as from our kitchen counters and cabinets. The picture I uploaded shows where the floor and walls have been pulled apart. I have so many picures to show, but can only upload one. Windows won't close and doors jam and are hard to open, others won't stay closed. There isn't a single room without cracks in the walls, huge cracks. We can stand in the kitchen and see the dining room through the wall.  This was our dream home and it's been such a nightmare. Watching it break, piece by piece. We are on just over 1/3 acre and it had no flowers or anything. As soon as we moved in, I put up a white picket fence in the front, planted rose bushes and several other perennial flowers. The fence isn't straight any more and almost all plants died from root rot. We had one of those
wooden fort swing sets for our grandkids. We have never been able to put it up because the ground stayed too wet and it would sink. I have had many a crying spell watching all this happening, for over 4 years. I could go on and on. But, the flooding problem has been fixed and our property is drying out. Now we want our home fixed, put back the way it was. We want to enjoy
our home. Your help will allow us to do that. Without your help, all we can do is walk away. The City knows they did this,  they even admitted it to me over the phone in the very beginning. But then wouldn't talk to me any longer after this went on and on and I called to report more damages. They only rejected our reasonable settlement offer, and are requiring so many depositions to bully us financially so we drop the case and they walk away without having to fix what they broke. Your helping us be able to go to trial makes a HUGE step for all citizens who can't afford to fight for something that should just happen as a matter of common respect and responsibility and you would help us get our home, our dream home, back. And then I
can plant my roses and flowers and we can enjoy our home once again.

Other Ways You Can Help

We know that not everyonoe can contribute to our funding needs. We have made regular contributions to non-profits for years,  but with that has happened to us over the past 4 years, we are no longer able to. So we certainly understand.

But, you can still help by getting the word out to your family, friends and co-workers. Remember, you can use the Indiegogo share tools. Let everyone know we need help from bullying city attorneys who are trying to force us to drop our case simply because we don't have the money to go to trial. They are doing this because they know if we go to trial, they will lose.
THANK YOU ALL FOR CONTRIBUTING FUNDS AND / OR PASSING THE WORD. We Truly appreciate it and God Bless You All
story_txt:
Short Summary
Hi, I'm Geanie, age 57, and my husband is Roger, age 59.  We have 3 wonderful grandchildren that we adore, and spoil.  We are homebodies, mostly because Roger isn't quite the same since recovering from stage 4 cancer, and I suffer from congenital spinal stenois, so I can't walk or stand any length of time.  But we don't mind, we love being together and we are always available to keep the grandkids.  Roger hasn't worked in over a year now since his cancer treatments left him unable to continue his commercial insulator job.  I am in IT and my job has been outsourced 3 times now. I am currently working part-time on an as needed basis.  But we make things work and get our bills paid, including still paying on medical bills for Rogers treatments.  We've always done our best to be good people and help others when we could, but now, we need some help. Our home that we both love to spend time together in has been broken. The City of Broken Arrow, in its attempt to alleviate flooding in 2 newly developed neighborhoods behind us, diverted the flood waters onto our property. This diversion of the flood waters was done mid Oct, 2007, during the time between when our offer on the home had been accepted and when we  closed, and continued until Jan of this year when they finally installed a real storm drainage system. But even when a City knows they caused damage to one's home,  you have to file a claim in order to have the City pay for the damages. We did. It's been 18 months now since filing. In June the City asked us to submit a settlement proposal. We asked for the exact cost of the repairs. We obtained multiple estimates and provided them all to the City. The final total estimate (averaged from the multiple estimates) is over $98,000. Our offer went before the City Council this week, they rejected it with no counter offer. They want to go to trial. Pre-trial is set for Oct. 1. We hae already spent almost $5000 and We don't have the additional $20-25k dollars it will cost to go to trial. If we don't go to trial, our only other option is to drop the claim. Then the City pays nothing to repair what they did, and we will continue to live in a very badly broken home the rest of our lives. We need help in raising the $20-25,000 so we can go to trial. It's the only way we can get the City to pay for the repairs our home so desperately needs.


What We Need & What You Get
The funds will be used to pay all the costs associated with going to trial. We have 9 witnesses, in addition to Roger and I, that are neighbors, friends and family. We have experts, 2 structural engineers, an appraiser, and every one of the contractors that submitted repair estimates. The City has notified us that in order to go to trial, they want depositions from everyone. That's a lot of people, and at a cost of $250 per hour for our attorney to first spend time with each witness to prepare them for their depositions. So if we can get enough to keep him at least happy, we might make it to trial on less. Such as getting our windwos and doors sealed off since they simply won't close all the way. or sealing all the cracks on the outside brick walls. There are plenty of repairs to do that any amount would help. But we hope to be able to raise enough to go to court and have the City fix what they broke and all repairs get done.


The Impact
Wanna talk about an impact. Roger and I bought our dream house. And within 6 months, it all began. The rains and the damages.  We live in NE Oklahoma, the soil here is clay based. When clay gets wet, it swells. The City put so much water on us, the soil swelled and lifted the outside brick walls up off it's piers/foundation. Our home has a crawl space, it's up on inner piers. We have pictures of those inner piers, showing as much as 4 inches of diverted water has passed under our home. This cause all 14 inner piers to shift, tip, fall over, and the subfloor insulation to suck up the moisture in the air from it and fall, and the subfloor to warp. All the floors in our home have to be completely removed and a new subfloor and floors have to be build. Our concrete 2 car garage was raised 3 inches and all the dirt beneath has been washed away. Our garage is sitting on a sink hole. We haven't parked our vehicles in there for 3 years now. Walls have pulled away from our fireplace, as well as from our kitchen counters and cabinets. The picture I uploaded shows where the floor and walls have been pulled apart. I have so many picures to show, but can only upload one. Windows won't close and doors jam and are hard to open, others won't stay closed. There isn't a single room without cracks in the walls, huge cracks. We can stand in the kitchen and see the dining room through the wall.  This was our dream home and it's been such a nightmare. Watching it break, piece by piece. We are on just over 1/3 acre and it had no flowers or anything. As soon as we moved in, I put up a white picket fence in the front, planted rose bushes and several other perennial flowers. The fence isn't straight any more and almost all plants died from root rot. We had one of thosewooden fort swing sets for our grandkids. We have never been able to put it up because the ground stayed too wet and it would sink. I have had many a crying spell watching all this happening, for over 4 years. I could go on and on. But, the flooding problem has been fixed and our property is drying out. Now we want our home fixed, put back the way it was. We want to enjoy our home. Your help will allow us to do that. Without your help, all we can do is walk away. The City knows they did this,  they even admitted it to me over the phone in the very beginning. But then wouldn't talk to me any longer after this went on and on and I called to report more damages. They only rejected our reasonable settlement offer, and are requiring so many depositions to bully us financially so we drop the case and they walk away without having to fix what they broke. story:
5/26 - Thanks again Holly for your new contribution.

5/8  -  Thank you Nicholas for your kind contribution.

5/6  -  Thank you Mario for your referrals and help w/campaign.

5/5  -  Thanks Holly, for your contribution and kind comments.

4/29 - I've received referrals from Angel, thank you. 

Hello and thanks for viewing.

I'm a retired grandmother living on social security (not much) and am TRYING DESPERATELY to get a small business going.  I've tried campaign funding here before and did not get good results asking for a large amount that I thought would really help out with expenses and open up that small business door.  Plus, I've learned a bit more about the funding process.  

My "grey alien" dolls have been copyrighted for years and this is an exclusive product.  Some people wonder how I received copyrights (2) for a species.  All I know is that I do have legal copyrights and who can "prove" that they are a species at this time.  I think the little grey guys are cute and get somewhat attached to them individually as I'm making them.  They seem to take on their own personality and I usually give them a name. 

I'm disappointed that my previous campaign didn't do well and a bit sad but, trying a different approach.  Who Knows???  Maybe this time!!!  I'll just keep trying and see what happens.

What I Need & What You Get

  • My own websites - already have godaddy domain names... "greyaliendolls" and "wayfarout"
  • Business License
  • Additional help in making dolls (ladies waiting to help)
  • Some office equipment and a new camera
  • Material and sewing supplies
  • YOU GET YOUR VERY OWN ALIEN DOLL or a STATUE (thinking alien)

The Impact - no product competition for this niche.

I will be able help some other ladies (that help me sew) a bit more with their financial needs.  They are ladies in my direct community.  I make these dolls by myself now and more orders are coming in.  More than I wish to handle by myself.  Would like to get some pre-made dolls ready to go.  I have many more alien & UFO related product ideas that will require some assistance.  Money I'm short on... ideas, no problem.  

PLEASE HELP ANYWAY YOU CAN.  BY CONTRIBUTION OR LETTING OTHERS KNOW ABOUT MY CAMPAIGN.  USE THE INDIEGOGO SHARE TOOLS.

story:
MY STORY:

 An Ependymoma (tumor) was found in my lumbar spine. The neurosurgeon told  me that after the surgery I came very close to being paralyzed but luckily I  managed to walk again and still undergoing radiation and physical therapy 3-5 times a week. 

I became severely and profoundly deaf due to a degenerative condition that was caused by a drug interaction called Ototoxicity after hospitalization. And since i am required MRI scans each year they denied me for the Colhear implant because you cannot have any metal inside the body with the MRI . Having said that my insurance will not cover my hearing aids either because i've reached the age limit in my state :( although i look younger :) they don't care :(  

(Ototoxic Medications includes antibiotics, chemotherapy and anti-inflammatory type drugs.Ototoxicity affects nearly 120,000 people in the U.S. each year, most of whom are either older persons receiving treatment for cancer, or children undergoing treatment for bacterial sepsis or cancer but save lives at the expense of hearing.) 

REFERENCE: http://deafness.about.com/od/ototoxicity/a/otot... 

 

 Pam Anger, Au.D. Doctor of Audiology at Penn Medicine wrote back to me saying: 

''You would need another hearing test (has to be within 6 months of getting a new hearing aid). That would be billed to your health insurance. We would need a doctor’s order (can be written as “consult to audiology” on a prescription pad). We would also schedule you for a Hearing Aid Assessment, which is a 90 minute appointment where I do further testing of your comfort levels and we would discuss all of your options as far as hearing aids. There is a $200 charge for that appointment and it is not billable to insurance. You are not a candidate for the SoundLens IIC – it would not be powerful enough. Starkey does make power CIC’s, so the X series 110 CIC is an option. Our price would be $3,200 and comes with a 3 yr warranty. We do not have payment plans, but you can put it on a credit card. Hope this helps.''

 

WHY AM I REACHING OUT FOR HELP?

I don't have any credit or any resources at the moment and having been on my own since 15, my parents can't help me either and was hoping this site would help me some after seeing ''Karen the bus driver'' raised $703,873 to go on vacation...

 http://www.indiegogo.com/loveforkarenhklein?a=804618

So that was when I started to ask myself why i don't share my story too and try to get some help?   

Unlike me, it's not money you're giving away... its ways for me to reach my goals. As for Karen and many others...it was never about being able to write a check but being able to touch somebody's life. And i just hope one day that could be me. Both lives blessed. Thank you and thank you...

 

With gratitude,

Sebastian

story:
Help us Raise the Barcode!

Tuscaloosa's own The Left Hand Soap Company is ready to raise the barcode and be a grown up corporate monster...without all the monster stuff, and with more soap.  Help us raise the funds to have an official company code with *official* barcodes that can help us in our plan for world domination one pound of natural soap at a time.  This would give us the ability to continue to grow as a Tuscaloosa business that will, as always, turn around and give back to the community we love so much.  Let's take the next step together.

What We Need & What You Get

  • To get a series of barcodes, we must buy a UPC prefix.  We have to get that from the official holder of UPC prefixes, GS1.  Waaaay back in the mid-1970's, GS1 introduced UPC codes and made it their mission to unite businesses with each other.  Now, we can't work without them.  They seem nice enough; but we get what we pay for - so we have to pay well.  Introductory dues and fees are a bit over $1,500.  After that, building and printing the UPCs for our packaging [with modifications and sizing] takes us up to $3,000, all said and done.  If we raise more than that, we'll dedicate it to making the transition *even better* with upgrades to our packaging and more time spent with local graphic artists, local farmers and charity organizations - enriching our already amazing soap.

  • We want to make you proud, Alabama.  We want to grow and continue to partner with local businesses and sponsor local arts and community events.  Whether it's Bama Art House films like "Turn Me On, Dammit", local community projects, schools, bands, community charity organizations or local theatre performances - we want to bring more attention to the region, do more cool things and hang out with more of you.

  • How can you help?  Cold, hard cash...and support. 

    • To celebrate making our goal - fingers crossed - we'll make a custom batch of celebratory soap called "Look Ma, Barcodes!"  What'll be in it?  Great question.  What would YOU like to see in it?!

    • Also, we'll be printing a special edition TLH sticker and tshirt for the occasion. 

  • If we *don't* reach our goal, that's ok.  We'll keep going and keep up the barcode work.  We'll go as far as it takes us.

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help:

  • Don't have any spare change floating around?  No worries - we love you, too.  You can help by spreading the word.  Share this page - tell your friends...tell your other friends...tell your enemies.  Spread the word so we can keep doing what we do...only better!

story:
Thanks to all who donated in round 1, this is a our round 2 to keep food efforts going as long as possible!!! 

 

Verified Nonprofit Campaign, the funds raised by this campaign will go directly to Williamsburg Northside Association.

About us

We are a small group of moms who came together around the idea of getting hot meals out there to folks. Zoe Adlersberg, a photographer, Erin Wile, a producer, and Sara Kate Gillingham-Ryan, founder of thekitchn.com and cookbook author, are spearheading the efforts. For more information please email zoephotonyc@me.com.

What We Need & What You Get

  • With food trucks, we can get into affected areas and be flexible. Is there an immediate need in Coney Island? Canarsie? We'll get there. In the Rockaways? In Red Hook? We are mobile and can get meals to folks who need them. Power out, can't cook? We can supply HOT meals for communities that are hurt. Power on now but spirits low? What's better to say "I'm with you!!" as rebuilding continues than a free, delicious, hot meal cooked with love.

  • Food trucks can serve 500+ people for $2,500 a day, cost per meal is $5!

  • Depending on the funds we raise, we'd like to make a steady push, sending trucks into the field 1-2 per week UNTIL JANUARY 1. The idea is that this is a LONG HAUL, not a quick fix.

  • We will do a special push on Thanksgiving and Christmas.

  • All money will go DIRECTLY to the trucks for their food/fuel costs minus Indigogo's fee. There is no overhead and no one else is being paid a cent to help with the fundraising. We are doing this because we believe in what we are doing!

Our goal is 2 trucks, 2 days a week ever week (so 4 trucks a week) from next week until Jan 31st, 2012 with 2 additional days on Thanksgiving and Christmas (2 trucks on those days). If we raise more, we'll do more!!

If we don't make our goal we will get as many trucks as we can in the field and focus on current needs and Thanksgiving.

The Impact

The impact is huge. From the smile on the child's face when ordering a burrito the way she likes it, to an elderly person getting some hot food they need. The trucks turn into a social club too, people congregating around food, catching up, sharing their stories. Food is an amazing thing.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you dont' feel like you can contribute financially...please help us get out the word. Tweet us. Post and share us on Facebook. EVERYONE can make a difference. Lend a hand sorting clothing or getting involved through Occupy Sandy or one of the other wonderful volunteer organizations out there.
