We will do a special push on Thanksgiving and Christmas.

All money will go DIRECTLY to the trucks for their food/fuel costs minus Indigogo's fee. There is no overhead and no one else is being paid a cent to help with the fundraising. We are doing this because we believe in what we are doing!

Our goal is 2 trucks, 2 days a week ever week (so 4 trucks a week) from next week until Jan 31st, 2012 with 2 additional days on Thanksgiving and Christmas (2 trucks on those days). If we raise more, we'll do more!!
If we don't make our goal we will get as many trucks as we can in the field and focus on current needs and Thanksgiving.


The Impact
The impact is huge. From the smile on the child's face when ordering a burrito the way she likes it, to an elderly person getting some hot food they need. The trucks turn into a social club too, people congregating around food, catching up, sharing their stories. Food is an amazing thing.
 
Other Ways You Can Help


If you dont' feel like you can contribute financially...please help us get out the word. Tweet us. Post and share us on Facebook. EVERYONE can make a difference. Lend a hand sorting clothing or getting involved through Occupy Sandy or one of the other wonderful volunteer organizations out there.

story:
Ms. Jan's Story

I have lived life as "a journey, not a destination, which has given me the resolve to always be open to My purpose and all of the possibilities that the Universe has bestowed on me. A widow and mother of 3 men, who have also followed their passions and "when given the choice to sit it out or dance", they choose to dance. This makes me proud ! My "heart sings" because I have passionatly embraced and participated in those valiant efforts that have brought us to this place where we all can be creative and passionate about contributing to man-kind in awesome ways. My total dedication and awesome creativity has allowed me to give birth to "Ms. Jan's Creamy White Hot Sauce.   My goal is to bring this epicurian delight to everyone and continue to "Share the Experience"! Made with a traditional Texas flavor and a secret blend of Caribbean spices, this incredible all-purpose condiment, can be used for any dish, as a marinate for fish; dipping sauce for chips, veggies or wraps;salad dressing or simply as a delightful compliment to any dish you want to "pump up a notch", giving the perfect spice without overwhelming your dish. Everyone who has ever experienced the sauce and I mean EVERYONE, unanamously agree that "Ms. Jan's Creamy White Hot Sauce"is a phenomenal and there is nothing like it in the Gourmet Market Place. I don't know about that! What I do know for sure is that: It is a perfect gift to me and with this gift comes the responsibility to Share this Amazing product. I have many "stories" about my journey but the most recent involves this leg of My journey. I am always open to leads, suggestions, advice,etc. and i always follow-up. A industry insider suggested that I meet with Rosemary Goodman, Manager of the Gourmet Market in the World Trade Center. I called and explained that I wanted info on the National Fancy Food Show and she made an appointment with me, cautioning me that "she didn't like HOT. I met her with no anticipation of her "loving" the sauce. We had a very infomative talk and she took me on a tour of the showroom. When we resumed our talk and she "examined" the very impressive bottles of sauce, she went to her refrigerator and got a cracker. She opened the sauce and poured a little on the cracker and began to cough profusely. she returned to the refrigerator with a bottle of water and some more crackers. (i was stunned and guilty but, knew I had not encouraged her). After eating several crackers with the sauce; coughing then chasing with water, she offered me a permanent booth in the Gourmet Market,which guarenteed my participation in the June Gourmet Food and Gift Market. This gave me the experience and connections with other vendors all who have been invaluable contacts and collegues on this journey! We are working with a Local, family owned maunfacturer to produce product to fill all of the orders we got during the show. This experience is the beginning of the next "leg" of my journey ! We are anxious for you to become part of what I think will be a movement in which you will be  anxious to "Share This Experience"!

What We Need

Initally when introduced to "Crowdfunding"by a BFF, I knew nothing about this wonderful concept. The very next morning, there was an article in the Dallas Morning News on"Crowdfunding". I felt this was a prayer answered.I needed to get Licences, Certifications, Insurances, Bar Codes, R&D and Funds to began taking Ms. Jan's on the road. Most of those needs were fullfilled by "My Village of Friends and Family", after I was offered the Gourmet Market Booth. My needs changed and In order for us to bring Ms. Jan's Creamy White Hot Sauce to you and the Marketplace we are asking you to fund the following:

1,000 cases of product to fulfill orders from show, Indiegogo perks and Inventory for current sales                                                            $10,000

Marketing and POS Materials for current stores and new sales               3,500

Web-Site and Video Production , 4G phone for credit card processing     4,500                                               

Texas Manufacturers Certification, Back Office Asst.                            2,000

                                                                  Total Request                            $20,000                                                                          

 You will Receive:

 Ms.Jan's Creamy White Hot Sauce and instantly become addicted as many others. We expect you to share this amazing experience. You will know that not only is this product  a viable and sustainable business model, but will serve as a means for us to continue to support the North Texas Community on a larger level, than ever before. You will also be anxious to" Share Your Experience". As a testament to my strong committmet to this campaign, I am going to immediately send one 10oz bottle of Ms. Jan's...to the 1st 100 contributors for you to taste and share. This is in addition to the Perks you will receive at the end of this campaign for your generous contribution. Hopefully, this will encourage the folk you share with to also support our campaign. I shudder to think about the impact we can have on the Gourmet Food Industry and the Joy that you and others will feel, for really supporting a product that is 1st of it's kind in the Marketplace; Unique and flavorful; will make your heart sing when you think of it. We will use all of the funds as noted and if we are Blessed with more than a full cup we will continue to share our overflow according to the will and purpose of The Creator. I have no doubt that we will have a sucessful campaign. Not only do I need your contribution, but I need you to help me to bring Ms. Jan's... to your City or Town. I want and need your support and remember to always "SHARE THE EXPERIENCE" !

story:
UPDATE 12th Feb 2013
- We just published on our Facebook page the first packaging test of Victorian Garden. Hope you like it:
 
------------------------------------------------------
 
Welcome all, Ladies and Gentlemen, to this land of lost scents and untold legends!
 
Our story began back in May 2012 when we decided to create a whole new aspect in Steampunk art: Candles and Cosmetics.
 
Would you join us on this adventure?
 
Matt grew up in a family dedicated body and soul to the art of hairdressing; he saw how cosmetic products were evolving away from their natural roots forcing us to use more and more chemicals every day; that's when we said stop!
 
Lovers of ecological products and Steampunk style, we decided to create together a new line of natural cosmetics with Steampunk inspiration.
 
The aromas we use are special, lost scents in time, dreaming with every breath you take! Mixed drop by drop with hints of fantasy and vintage!
 
 
Apart from that, our next target after fulfilling the cosmetic needs, will be to show you our magnificent Steampunk candles.
 
 
Each one of our candle designs is unique, made by Matt's own hands, directly out of his imagination; nobody else have them and they are as elegant as cute!
 
Want to know more? Just check below. :)
 
 
For this 1st Phase, our range of cosmetics will cover 4 of the total 8 aromas, which will be:
 
 
If you liked the aromas, then you can't miss the products themselves!
 
- Rose hip oil solid soap (Victorian Garden) - 100gr (regular size) / 50gr (travel size)
- Almonds oil solid soap (Flying over the desert) - 100gr (regular size) / 50gr (travel size)
- Rice bran oil solid soap (Letters from far away) - 100gr (regular size) / 50gr (travel size)
- Pistachio oil solid soap (Clean those gears) - 100gr (regular size) / 50gr (travel size)
- The 8th Wonder solid Shampoo (all 4 aromas available) - 100gr (regular size) / 50gr (travel size)
- Shaving solid soap (2 aromas available, TBA) - 100gr (regular size) / 50gr (travel size)
- Scrub solid soap (Coffee) - 100gr (regular size) / 50gr (travel size)
- Aftershave solid lotion (all 4 aromas available) - 100gr (regular size) / No travel size available at the moment
- Lip balm (4 tastes, TBA) - 7gr (regular size)
- Body butter (all 4 aromas available) - 100gr (regular size) / No travel size available at the moment
 
We will soon also offer Bathroom and Shaving accesories.
 
Our idea for the packaging is the following (for regular soaps and shampoos)
 
 
 
 
And don't miss what comes next!
 
 
A lot of people have done candle holders before with Steampunk design but we couldn't find anyone making actual Steampunk decorative candles; so we thought: Let's do it!
 
It all started with a simple Top hat, but it went way over our expectations. We are continuously working on new creations to increase our selection of unique items.
 
As an addition to the cosmetic and decorative candles, we will also offer three types of aromatherapy candles; made with 100% vegan and ecological soy wax to Meditation&Relax, Inspiration&Imagination and Happiness&Positivity.

What We Need

The project will be funded in three steps as shown in the contributions tracker on the top, the total amount needed is of 22.150€ ($29,590/£18,462)
 
Step 1 (Cosmetics 1st Batch - First 4 aromas) -> 9.500€ ($12,690/£7,920)
 
  • Raw materials + basic packaging: 7.500€
  • Rest of packaging: 500€
  • Licenses*: 1.700€
  • Marketing & Office material: 275€
  • Indiegogo + Paypal commissions

*Licenses include the registration of the cosmetic products (each change to the product requires an additional license) plus the legal licenses of the shop itself.

*We already received a private funding of 1.700€, which has already been deducted from the total requested.

Step 2 (Cosmetics 2nd Batch - Next 4 aromas) -> 8.850€ ($11,820/£7,377)

Step 3 (Candles) -> 3.800€ ($5,075/£3,170)

What You Get

 

The Impact

The project will not only help rebuilding the natural cosmetic usage around the globe but also small shops here in Europe which can resell the products to their clients locally and renew themselves. Examples of this are the following:

"Celebrating the 60th anniversary of its foundation, Friseur Kellner-Wallner [owned by Matt's mother] is proud to become the first hairdressing salon to be using and reselling these new and very special products" Friseur Kellner-Wallner in Mank (Austria) http://www.kellner-wallner.at/

"I started using natural cosmetics to avoid touching parabens constantly. As an occasional user parabens might not affect you that drastically, but as a Beautician or Hairdresser, we are all in danger of leukemia or abortions caused by all these chemicals. Also last week I showed in my blog how dangerous are some commercial lipsticks, full of lead; so I am definitely sticking now to Natural Cosmetics." Tamara Ulric, Beautician and Blogger in Chipiona (Spain). http://eressbella.blogspot.com.es/

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute with money, don't worry! Just spread the word, send it to your friends and family, we are very thankful for anything you can do for us! :)

"I started using natural cosmetics to avoid touching parabens constantly. As an occasional user parabens might not affect you that drastically, but as a Beautician or Hairdresser, we are all in danger of leukemia or abortions caused by all these chemicals. Also last week I showed in my blog how dangerous are some commercial lipsticks, full of lead; so I am definitely sticking now to Natural Cosmetics." Tamara Ulric, Beautician and Blogger in Chipiona (Spain). http://eressbella.blogspot.com.es/


Other Ways You Can Help

story:
Brief...

On Saturday, Nov. 22nd, 2014 our community received news of the untimely demise of Mrs. Sarah Kuwedde-Semakula of Detroit, Michigan.

Mrs. Sarah Kuwedde-Semakula (Nov. 22, 1974 - Nov. 22, 2014), passed away at 12:17pm Saturday, November 22, 2014, right on her 40th birthday. She died at Henry Ford Hospital Detroit - Michigan, after a short battle with LUPUS syndrome. She was born Nov. 22, 1974 in Bubeke - Ssese Island, Uganda, to Mr. John Nswemu (deceased) and Ms. Martha Nakisitu of Kireka - Kamuli. She is survived by her
husband, Timothy Semakula; a son, Kelvin Mukuuma Katende (16) and Shifrah Meeme Nankinga (2005 - deceased). Despite them being relatively new in the USA, the family has been very involved in several of the Ugandan community activities here in US, and we would like to support Mr. Semakula and family during this very trying time.

Currently, the body is lying at Henry Ford Hospital (which has offered to keep the body for 3 weeks), as repatriation arrangements are being established. If you wish to write a cheque (check) or make any cash condolence, please address it to Timothy Semakula - 930 Goddard Road, #110, Lincoln Park, Michigan 48146. Otherwise, we recommend that you use this page to make your contributions/condolence/Mabugo in support in the arrangements.

The body is planned to leave for Uganda on Dec 15th, 2014 for final burial arrangements at their home - Muzei Semakula Road, Lweza – Kajjansi (off Kigo Prison Road), Entebbe Rd. 

For any inquiries, contact ggwangamujje.midwest@gmail.com; or timothysemakula@yahoo.co.uk

Thanks all for your support and prayers.

Ggwanga-mujje Midwest

story:
Hi Friends,

My name is Lucie, I'm 24, and I currently live and work in Haiti. My house is located in a small fisherman village in the South of the country and I have grown very close to the members of my community. My neighbors have became my friends, and their children my proteges. Whenever I can, I organize english or art workshops, or yoga classes for the 200 kids of the community, and I am committed to their happiness and growth.

Christmas is now around the corner, and my younger sister Julia is coming to visit me in Haiti. Our common dream is to organize a wonderful Christmas party for the children of the community. We will need some live music, a lot of good food, a santa and most importantly great gifts for the kids. Our idea for now, is to distribute sophisticated water filters for each household. 


Haiti can be chaotic and miserable for children, and we want them to forget the hunger, and the misery they live in. We want them to dance, eat, smile and have a truly MAGICAL Christmas.

Please join us, and help us bring Santa to Haiti! The more we raise, the more we give. 

Thank you for your support.

Lucie & Julia

story:
The time has come for everyone to get into the Holiday spirit. Stockings are hung. Trees are trimmed. And the air has taken a frosty chill bringing you inside to stay warm with family. But this season is also about giving and bringing happiness to others. 

Here in Humboldt, TN there is a place called Tennessee Veterans State Home. It is a Nursing Home for Veterans. There are 130 residents in this facility that stood proud and strong to fight for us to be able to freely enjoy this season of Holiday cheer. What better way than to say thank you by giving some of that Holiday Cheer and warmth of someone caring than by helping raise money to give each and every individual resident their own small gift. 

These residents are not hard to please. They enjoy the simple things. Things such as Chocolate, Tube Socks, Soft Puff Mint Candy, Word Search Puzzles, and bingo. 

We are trying to raise the funds to give each resident a gift bag including the above things along with a Christmas Card made out to them and a small personal gift. 

We are in direct contact with some of the administration so we can be sure each gift is suitable for its recipient and contains no harmful items.

story:
Short summary about this campaign

I collected and have great products that easily to sell and have rights to resell . All ebooks , sales pages , covers , any graphics will be packed in a beautiful pack and sent to Perks who help us to reach goal of this campaign

What We Need & What You Get

Just contribute what you want to and if you reached any Perks level , we will send you products as we promised .

The Impact

With this bundle and with great content insights , you will have opportunity to build your own ONLINE product without experience and sell them for your own profits .

Risks & Challenges

I understand how hard it is to start an online business , please bear in mind that it's not a short term or some quick rich scheme . After receiving bundle and packages of products , you will need to build your site from scratch , edit sale files and promote your product . You're not going to get an ATM and just want for the cash , so make sure you understand before sending contribution.
